Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel great location.”
Reviews.Author: Nsayed
Reviews.Content: Upon our stay the staff was welcoming. Their location is excellent, every thing is nearby and walking distance to the hotel. The concierge was very helpful. We will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: phishinau
Reviews.Content: We stayed here March 10th-13th and loved it. First of all the location is insane, it's right smack in the middle of everything. When we got to the hotel, our rooms weren't ready but they offered to hold our bags till it was so that was nice. After walking around for a bit and coming back, we get our room. It's small, but it's New York, whatever, that's fine with me, the only time we were in the room was to sleep (the bed was amazing!) and shower (clean in the bathroom) the room was immaculate and the air conditioner worked so we were great. No noise or anything during the night while sleeping, very quiet and the elavator was right there. I will say that Chris was awesome too! Hope you enjoyed the Susansnaps man! We would definitely stay here again, there are lots of things around the area and the price can't be beat. Thanks for a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, smelly, desperate for some attention”
Reviews.Author: Curzio M
Reviews.Content: Attentive lobby staff and courteous employees--to a fault. Good location if you are travelling from abroad. However, the hotel floor I am on (fifth floor) reeks of sweat. The rooms are sad and tired... this place hasn't been painted in years and years and there are pock marks and scratches on all of the walls, all of the fixtures, the bathrooms are clean but the equipment itself is tired, old, and worn out. The bed sheets were eminently adequate. This is supposedly a boutique property. It isn't. It has a wishful thinking mentality within the Chatwal family of hotels and it either needs to be sold to kinder, mor caring owners, or it needs to get an injection of cash for a major refurbishment. At $250 per night this is hardly a bargain given what one gets. Especially because the room is just depressing. I can totally see someone having a breakdown of sorts here. EVERY wall in my suite is blank--both in the sitting room and in the actual bedroom. But for a TV that is plasma this could be a fleabag motel on 11th avenue. And the furniture, though perhaps sleek in its first three years of use, is seriously in need of replacement. Overall two thumbs down. This property is part of the "Preferred" Family of hotels. It doesn't deserve to be. I came for a boutique hotel and I got the Howard Johnson's motel--without the car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay at Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Zian Z
Reviews.Content: Great experience and great hospitality. Neat and Clean rooms. Lifetime experience. Mr. Singh at reception was very helpful. Great for couples. Peaceful and calm. Have bubble bath together and enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: Luc P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We where a bit dissapointed with the room. Very dark, not enough natural light comming trough the window. We looked at exhaust pipes of ventilation or kitchen. The view wasn't that important to us but the sound of these pipes during the night was a bit anoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Subpar hotel”
Reviews.Author: makiba w Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: CONS: I understand that most hotel rooms in NY are small, so I wasn't overly surprised to find a closet sized room. In most cases you don't spend much time in your hotel room in NYC anyway. However, I think the room could stand to be scrubbed and updated. It was dingy to say the least. A fresh coat of paint and a bottle of Clorox would make a world of difference! PROS: The bed was VERY COMFORTABLE! I overslept one day because I just didn't want to get out of bed. The location was more convenient than I possibly could have imagined. You walk out of the hotel and around the coner is Time Square, and every theatre imaginable. It was also conveniently located near the subway entrance that takes you directy to the Statue of Liberty.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Dani864
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, 2 minutes away from Times Square, modern style hotel but in need of refurbishment. For instance, in our room there were some marks and stains on the wall, definitely it should be better to re-paint. Also we could not open the door of the fridge, one of the phone was not working and when we arrived the safe was locked and we had to wait the manager to unlock (a room ready to check in should be completely checked by housekeeping and safe should be ready to use). In the hotel there are only 2 lifts for 16 floors. Same lifts are used by staff too, housekeeping and maintenance (there is no staff elevator) so often you have to wait quite a long. There is no free WIFI connection in the room, only in the lobby where there are only 2 small armchairs, often busy, so it is not really comfortable if you want to quickly check your emails with your laptop. In the room there is no Tea/Coffee facility. The restaurant Serafina serves good food but I found it overpriced comparing to the other restaurants near by. The bar has a nice ambience, very cool but often the whole area is reserved for private party and not accessible to the Hotel guests. The staff at reception are polite and friendly, but I noticed a lack of eye contact and smiles, the doormen instead are always ready to welcome you with a big smile and wishing you a "good day". A smile and a eye contact always make a positive difference and make the guest feels welcome. What really disappointed me was the housekeeping and the management. Briefly I collect coins from each city I visit and as usual I leave the coins I do not intend to spend on my bedside. After few days I noticed that the coins were missing. I was very upset, not for the coins itself but for the principle that from my room should not disappear even one penny… the housekeeping might have tought it was left as tips but in my opinion, if you would like to leave tips either you leave a note either you leave it on the departure day. So my advice for future guests is do not forget to lock your money in the safe unless you wanna leave some tips….. I reported the episode to the reception, they said they had to investigate but nobody reverted back, not during the rest of my stay, not at check out. Perhaps this is something a guest would expect from the management of a 4* Hotel, a few lines of apologies. Following this situation I left the room with the “do not disturb” as I was upset, well the first day they respected my willness, but then they entered to clean my room even with the “do not disturb sign”, and I believe this was very “rude”. At that point I found it even ridiculous and a waste of time reported the episode to the reception. I really believe that few of the above negative aspects are not difficult to fix it like the maintenance of the hotel and perhaps a development customer training to the staff so that a guest can be happy to return, otherwise it is easy look for something else, the area is completely full of hotels, restaurants, bars, etc, etc. Everything you need is there, few steps away. What makes you come back is the customer serviced received.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: bluoshun1
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved out stay in NYC at the TIME - location was perfect - room was "hip" and the staff was so friendly ! We especially enjoyed meeting Andre and Chris - We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “not value for money but a nice option”
Reviews.Author: naducy
Reviews.Content: its a nice and modern design hotel with a very convenient location- times square, theatre district,subway... cozy rooms although quite small.cant use the minibar to store your stuff as its motion-sensitive...the staff was friendly ..good price compared to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Madeleine K
Reviews.Content: This hotel not only had horrible service, but the room was miniature with no view and cheap quality. We called the front desk asking for a bucket of ice and forks to eat our leftovers and 2 hours later, we received nothing. We called back, which resulted in someone bringing us a bucket of ice, but we were told we'd have to call the front desk to call the kitchen to get forks. So we called the front desk again, and guess what....nobody ever gave us forks! Thai food with our bare hands. The ONLY plus to this hotel is that it is prime location to see Broadway shows, but let's face it, Broadway is a subway ride from anywhere in NYC. I recommend somewhere that treats patrons better.

Reviews.Title: “It's an option for NY.”
Reviews.Author: 274856Michael
Reviews.Content: Location is super - three subway stations in the direct proximity of the hotel (2 minutes walk), Times square, theater district. Entrance to the hotel is strange, as You have the entrance (where mostly but not always a doorman stands), then you have a small corridor and a lift that takes You to the second floor (reception)... if You want to get to Your room you have to go to different lifts hidden deeper in the entrance corridor. So it was sometimes strange, as You could go back to the hotel without the doorman waiting and bypass the reception on your way to the room... Room was clean. Towels, pillows etc. were clean. Had hot and cold water. Ironing board was dirty. Everything worked. Toilet got stuck a few times. Room definitely could use a refurbishment. I lived on the 6th floor, bad window view - oh! and the windows did not open, so no chance for some fresh air. AC was loud (could switch on itself in the middle of the night and make some noise) so was the ventilator in the bathroom. Door to room - well it worked, but You could hear EVERYTHING from the corridor. You could say that it is a designer hotel... but when something has not been refurbished when needed it looses it's "designer" status... right? I mean i.e. you have the Artemide lamps next to the bed and on the desk. Well... one lamp had isolation tape around the cable, and the desk one was screwed to the desk in such a way that it moved, and You had a hole next to the lamp (signs of a previous different lamp?)... so it's a over-used, not refurbished in time designer room... You get the picture. This is definitely not a 4-star hotel in European standards. Rather 3 stars. Staff was very kind and helpful. Awkward thing was that the hotel didn't have a service elevator, so You could meet the staff, cleaning ladies etc. in the lifts quite often. And since the hotel has 16 floors and two lifts You could meet them quite often (but still they were very kind). Business - No. This is rather not a hotel for a business trip. Family with kids - errr, rather not. Friends, Solo - yes. Senior - rather not. Couples - errr, depends what Your looking for (note that the door... You hear EVERYTHING through it). Food/Breakfast - they have the Serafina Restaurant on the ground floor. Ate only breakfasts two times there - was ok. Bottom line: Hey this is New York. If You want 5 stars then You have to pay a minimum of 350$ per night... or You can stay at The Time and spend that money on theaters, musicals, food and shopping - face it - You don't spend Your whole day in Your hotel room when in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: careyes45
Reviews.Content: Great decor and lighting. Really like the club/lounge feel of the room. The room showed a little wear and tear (chipped paint). Loved the 2 shower heads in the bathroom. That was a nice surprise. Super friendly and helpful staff. No ice bucket or ice machine on the floor, but it says on their info card that they will bring you ice. Robes in the room were a plus. During our NY visit we stayed in SoHo and Manhattan as well, and we definitely enjoyed Times Square the best. So alive and exciting at all hours. Great shopping for souvenirs. Endless choices for entertainment and places to eat. Highly recommend and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: taferiat
Reviews.Content: huge rooms with a great location. Manager Katz helped us out! we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tatyana_Soroko
Reviews.Content: We have choosen this hotel with Booking.com promotion and paid $776 for double for 5 nights. It was really great deal. The room is small but it is usual for Manhattan. Bathroom could to be renovated. Pesonal is very helpful. We asked for extra blanket and received it in 5 minutes. We read a lot of reviews that staff blocked extra money for deposit. On check-in we were asked for deposit blocked on credit card. We told that we cannot wait for 30 days after check-out to receive money back because we have a long trip and manager gave cash $200 for all our stay and receive them at check-out. I recommend you to do the same visiting this Hotel. Location of Hotel is amazing - you are in the Heart of Manhattan. Broadway theatres, Time Square, Central Park, Diamond district - you can get in 5-15 minutes. I can recommend this hotel to people who appreciate great location and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMiles30
Reviews.Content: Around the corner of Times Square in 49th Street. Subway near the hotel. Perfect for a New York trip. Nice rooms and a friendly staff. Best is you book a suite with two rooms, because the standard rooms are small. I stayed in suite room 912.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in times square”
Reviews.Author: Niral P
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner travelled to this wonderfully placed hotel in November and found its location in times square perfect. we walked to all the tourist attractions and restaurants from there. the only time we had to catch a yellow cab was when we went to wall street and Soho for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel again”
Reviews.Author: CraigSLondon
Reviews.Content: WHat a excellent located hotel , I had the pleasure of staying again in the last week of November. Thanks to Charlie for his hospitality and taking care of returning guests . Only issue i had this time was the keeping of the corridor carpets cleaned, it was a full and busy week with thanksgiving etc , i do understand . But i will see you again soon . Thanks for a great stay as usual.

Reviews.Title: “robbery!”
Reviews.Author: daniela b
Reviews.Content: robbery !!!!!!!! I stayed at this hotel and I people from the hotel opened my bag and stolen! They stole my brand new just bought IPAD 2 . They replied that nothing can be done! Run this mediocre hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Time is the Place!”
Reviews.Author: thalia2muse
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an incredible Times Sq. location-look no further than this hotel. Small, warm staff, great rooms-bed and bath especially and a huge value for NYC. Ask for an upper floor as the hotel does also have a second floor bar. Cannot recommend Serafino-the hotel's restaurant-ultra expensive and unimaginative and uber small portions-though the wait staff is great and not a bad place for a pre or post-show drink.

Reviews.Title: “Every hotel needs a manager like Mr. Katz”
Reviews.Author: lifesabeachct46
Reviews.Content: Prior to our stay I had call the hotel manager to ask a simple question. He called my cell phone back within the hour and was very helpful. Upon check in the staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. The lobby was clean and very quaint. Our room was a simple room w/ 2 double beds. The rooms are a bit dated but very, very clean. The beds were extremely comfortable! The location of the hotel was perfect! Once out the door of the hotel the world of Time's Square was at our fingertips! I had asked Mr. Katz to arrange to have the Giant's win and he even worked his magic with that! We would certainly stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “NEW YORK NEW YORK”
Reviews.Author: m15fff
Reviews.Content: First time in New York, arrived at hotel and was relieved to see it was quite decent, very boutique style, rooms small and can be quite suffocating as air conditioning wasnt the best set up, very noisy.rooms compact, and cleaned everyday, . However the hotel is just on broadway and seconds from Times square which was handy,, New York itself is very expensive,, so be alarmed,,, also we found it better to walk places as the traffic was so heavy and a taxi would take twice as long..... Be prepared the city never sleeps.. .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: FRBM
Reviews.Content: Good location and excellent service I went with my kids and everything was good.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING VALUE!”
Reviews.Author: IslandGuru
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel months ago at a ridiculously low price as a back up to the convention hotel I typically stay at. In the 30 years I have been travelling to Manhattan on business, I have never paid less and never expected such a terrific experience. Two qualifiers: First, anyone who stays in NYC knows the rooms are small. Duh. Try Europe if you think NYC rooms are small. I had a spacious one â€“ 15th floor (1503) â€“ that was just great. Second, most NY hotels that have big rooms are at least two to three times as much with no character. If you want to stay in a stale, unimaginative hotel room, be their guest: pay more for the big brand labels and then get ready for really crummy service over priced food, Internet and drinks. But if you like a boutique experience a la San Francisco, this hotel is a gem for the price with several BIG advantages: 1. Location, location, location: right off of Times Square, a new Food Emporium steps away, best Starbucks in the US (with a Clover machine ï�Š) and in the heart of Broadway. 2. Great bed: It was double-sheeted, high quality all around and comparable to W beds (not kidding â€“ mine was). 3. Thick towels: This is a rare find even in the big brands in NY. Towels were really dense and a pleasant surprise. Even had two nice comfy robes to lounge around in. 4. Design: Yes the hotel is showing its age and is a little worn, but the deep primary colors, cool desk, Bose radio, room safe, iron and ironing board, blow dryer, toiletries â€“ just about everything had a little flair. 5. Window shades and lighting: Again, the design takes the old and makes it new with a large pull down screen shade that blurs so others canâ€™t see and black out pull down shades for total darkness. Plus dim lighting controls so you donâ€™t blind yourself going to the restroom in the middle of the night. 6. Sight and sounds: I thought my room was occupied when I first opened the door. Jazz was playing from the Bose radio and there was a really nice scent in the air. The housekeeper had just prepped the room for my arrival. How cool is that? 7. Service: Young, hip and nice. How many times these days do these three words go together. A very nice surprise is what I found for the time I spent at The Time (3 nights) and yes, I would go again even if I paid a bit more as long as I get the same room. It was a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but oh such a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: WalkerOnWater
Reviews.Content: Purchased room through Priceline. $101 for Friday and Saturday nights. Tiny room and bathroom. View is nothing to write home about. But the location, quietness, and comfort were outstanding. Right next door to "The Book of Morman" so it was convenient to get into the ticket lottery and standing room only at the theatre. It was a father and teenage son trip, so we didn't use the bar or restaurant. Overall, quite pleased with our luck to land at The Time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, excellent sleep quality”
Reviews.Author: Melissa D
Reviews.Content: Great location, specially if your first time in NY. The hotel is near by Brodway theaters and shops, Moma and Rockfeller center. Service is excellent. Staff is extremelly friendly and helpful. Rooms are ok, they call this hotel "boutique", but it's not, furniture is worn. Rooms are very small, but it didn't bother us at all. Shower is great and bathroom is spacious. Sleep quality is great: comfy pillows and bed, dark windows. I ordered breakfast once and it was very good, except for the "hot chocolate". There was no chocolate in it. The restaurant is always very busy, might be good.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Laurent B
Reviews.Content: I have a hard time understanding how anyone could give this hotel a five-star rating. The only thing that is "boutique" about this hotel is the size of the room. I wouldn't say that this hotel is a scam, but it's clearly false advertising. The rooms were cramped, worn-out, and the walls were paper thin. You could practically hear everything that was being said in the other room. The only member of the management that was pleasant to talk to was Miguel. Everyone else was either rude or dismissive. The elevator was just filthy. For the price we're paying, they should at least have the decency to clean the carpet. And the view was just depressing. We were right next to a brick wall. Avoid this place if you can. You can get a better deals at other hotels in the city. I've heard that this hotel was recently renovated. But the only thing that wasn't old or dirty was the elevator at the front desk. Some people may enjoy the location, but Times Square isn't really the most enjoyable part of New York for us.

Reviews.Title: “The Time Is Minutes From Everywhere...”
Reviews.Author: Carmichael1122
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with The Time. We stayed in their large room and found that it was spacious and clean. The King size bed was incredibly soft and comfortable (you really don't do much sleeping in New York but a comfortable bed is always welcoming). The bathroom was clean. Excellent water pressure in the shower. The only problem in the shower was the shower curtain which seemed too short so the floor got wet. The hotel has a beautiful lounge with great music for those that don't mind partying a little longer. We were on the 9th floor so we had no problem with noise. Every staff member that I encountered was pleasant and helpful. The location of The Time is it's greatest asset. You are within minutes of everything that Time Square has to offer. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Occupy Time Square - prepare to freeze”
Reviews.Author: JSD47630
Reviews.Content: Honestly it is not that bad overall but for the price you will freeze your butt off in this hotel. Our room on the 6th floor was in the 50s at night....when we called Leo at the front desk to mention our heater did not work and the thermostat did not control it and it was blowing cold air, he said the whole hotel was on central heat and the room thermostats were disconnected. The hallways were warm; room was freezing. Considered sleeping with door open. Get a upper floor room if you want to sleep; lounge is loud until all hours on 2nd floor. But the room was so cold it ruined the whole experience honestly. We had a "large" room, which was about 12x12. The bed took up most of it. Coke was $5 in the minibar, about average for such places. WiFi was $11 per device per 24 hour day (not per room, per device) Aside from the freezing cold (did I mention the COLD room?) the hotel is located perfectly. Bed was great. Just needed 50 blankets but otherwise great. LCD TV and Bose music player. Small safe in room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great staff, Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jetsfn
Reviews.Content: I was absolutely impressed with the hotel. The staff was excellent and the location couldn't be beat!!! If your visiting NYC this is the place to stay....

Reviews.Title: “If I could give a ZERO I would”
Reviews.Author: smithnyla
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel on December 9th for what was suppossed to be a two night stay. Although the staff were friendly and helpful when I checked in, that is the only compliment I can offer. I found it to be one of the dirtiest hotels I have ever seen. The elevator looked like it had never been vacummed. I was given a nice sized corner room that was handicap accessible and fairly large by New York standards, but the bathroom was run down and there was mildew and rust in the showers. The walls in the room were scraped up and in need of a paint job. The bed was lumpy and the pillows felt like they were 10 years old. I asked to switch rooms because of the mildew in the shower. I looked at four other rooms, THEY ALL HAD mildew in the showers and all needed paint jobs. Finally I just told them I wanted to check out. I found it to be too dirty to justify the price. I went and stayed at the St. Giles Hotel for about $150 less a night and it had a HUGE clean room. Stay there, not here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Rooms needs renovation.”
Reviews.Author: enzfrnz
Reviews.Content: I got a last minute deal at a fantastic price. The location is amazing right off two subway lines on Broadway. The staff was very friendly and iwas able to check into my room early. The rooms were very worn and tired. The rug was threadbare and the duvet cover all wrinkled. The wrought iron sink in the bathroom was rusted and the end tables were chipped. The room looked nice and long as you didn't look too close. The bed was amazingly comfortable and that's really all I cared about. I would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jay C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Time Hotel during the weekend of the NYC marathon, i had an amazing stay at this hotel. Not only was the price of the room a great value despite being the weekend of such a huge event as the marathon, but the staff was wonderful as well in particular the manager Charlie. The room itself was top notch and one of the better rooms I've had in my many travels to NYC, not to mention The Time is right in the heart of Times Square. As a whole, great hotel, great staff, great location and lastly a great price. I would definitely recommend The Time Hotel if one is planning a trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Superficial...”
Reviews.Author: mibl06
Reviews.Content: As a lot of hotels theses days the lobby is well design as the bar/club but as soon as you go into a room it's complete different world. They tried to put some "design" into the room but you feel right away that it's just fake. So no isolation between rooms, I could ear clearly what my neighbour was doing and I had to change room at midnight because the music was too lowed... 4 stars??? And I am not finished, I had too pay an extra fee to hold an extra shopping bag with my luggage, come on!! Seriously could we stop this "fake" hotel trend! Lucky we have Trip Advisor to help us to avoid these places. That's being said location is good but I went to Yotel which is a little bit further from time square but what a service and quality for almost the same price. I hope this review will help you to...avoid this location or push them for better quality in their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience for a first time trip to NYC! :(”
Reviews.Author: Dora T
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were fantastic... AS I said the STAFF.. Assistant Front desk Manager "Dana" Was completely unprofessional... I had arrived on a Thursday night and ALL day Friday we had gone exploring the city! It was a beautiful city but when we returned and we (my travel partner and I) assured that our DND was on the door... When we returned to the room, a housekeeper attendant had gone into the room without anyones permission and didn't even give proper cleaning service... She/He replenished just THREE face towels, they took two used glasses flipped them upside down and had them as if they were fresh and clean on the dresser! Disgusting! I had accidentally left my safe in my room open, one of my rings went missing... I had immediately requested for a manager to come to the room ASAP... It took them 30 minutes to respond... They sent me a young child that had again no professionalism in her and she was playing with her hair while she was "struggling" to answer my questions... Housekeeping manager was called up the day after, applied a smoking fee to my room when we hadn't even smoked in there... Was very rude and although there are more details, I won't bore anyone... I work in a hotel, and no policies and protocal... I definitely intend on returning to NYC as it's a beautiful city but most definitely DO NOT intend on EVER returning back to this hotel.... Mind you again, the staff are super sweet! the management? The owner needs to re-evaluate who he/she hires to represent them! I rate employees @ 5 star, great job... Miguel the door man was FANTASTIC... The management, extremely poor! My ring was never retrieved, found, nor did anyone contact me to inform me on the status and how the investigation went! It was a family heirloom! Very devastating!

Reviews.Title: “Average - cheap in all areas”
Reviews.Author: axel16
Reviews.Content: Not impressed and will not go back. Modern rooms but tired. Chips everywhere - paint was coming of the bathroom wall. Room did not have a good vibe. No other comment. I switched hotel and went to the Royalton for two nights and that was beautiful. Pricewise it was the same except it was a special price for the Royalton - so keep that in mind

Reviews.Title: “"Perfect Location!"”
Reviews.Author: Whodge03
Reviews.Content: Let me just say the entrance was beautiful glass front elevator to the main lobby, the check in was prompt, and concierge desk was extremely helpful with recommending near by location for entertainment. Awesome bar and The Serafina restaurant right next door. Across the street the parking garage gave me a discount for parking 30$ overnight since I was a hotel guest and my friends and I loved the room, clean, with bose radio and a flat screen TV. We didn't hang in to long the location was a block from time square. The pubs were endless bartender stayed open a little late so we can finish the night off with a little nite cap. Oh they even granted me an late checkout with no issues. Definitely heading back to thei hotel frequently. Thanks again to - "The Time" for an affordable place, in an incredible location

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Haley K
Reviews.Content: The Time Hotel was an absolutely amazing hotel with wonderful accommodations. I went to New York City for the weekend to go see a concert, and I am completely satisfied with my stay at the hotel. I love hotels and always have so when I find a good one when I am on vacation I just get so happy. The staff was magnificent and helped me with everything and anything I needed, they were able to provide me with appropriate subway schedules, as well as trains leaving to and from Penn Station. The manager Charlie was very accommodating as well after there was a mix up of the reservation (due to my part) he provided us with a complimentary bottle of wine. With the hotel being in the heart of Time Square it felt like I had the world in my hands. The hotel decor is trendy and modern, it really does represent what NYC's unique look is all about. My next visit to New York I will most definitely be staying at The Time Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: StrictlyBusiness1189
Reviews.Content: The Time Hotel was recommended to me by an associate after I had to book a last minute business trip to New York City. Having traveled to New York on multiple prior occasions with the occurrence of a hotel mishap nearly every time, The Time hotel surprised me with a welcome change. From the location to the decor, the cleanliness, and the hospitality this hotel provided the ideal New York City stay and experience. The staff was nothing but wonderful, particularly the bellboy Jack who went above and beyond to fulfill what some might consider high maintenance requests and was charming, helpful, and attractive. Not to mention the cutting edge design of the business cards which I will be keeping in my wallet from here on out. Will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Silence in New York!”
Reviews.Author: Gl0balTraveller45
Reviews.Content: Spent a night at The Time first week of November. Clean, compact and convenient were my first impressions. Yes I did get a kick out of the fact that the room is lit and the music playing when you first enter you room. Modern decor a good collection of NYC literature, and yes very typically compact New York hotel rooms. A block removed from Time Square the hotel is with reach of everything. After a long business trip, I was grateful for a inner room and actually got an unprecedented 8 hours of sleep a block from Time Square!

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for heart of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: millertimegen
Reviews.Content: I love the location of the Time - very convenient when visiting for work in Times Square. I enjoy the clean, modern feel of the entry and lobby, and the restaurant Serafina downstairs is good. The room I stayed in wasn't as nice as I'd hoped, though. I appreciated when I entered the room, it was lit and lively, as if they were expecting me - but oddly the radio was on very loud to a popular music station (not very soothing), and the room was absolutely freezing - just above 60 degrees. I actually thought for a minute that someone was still in there cleaning. The decor of the room was fine, but certain aspects of the place looked old and worn. There was dark mildew in the edges of the shower tile (places very visible when in the shower, but probably not to the maid cleaning from the other direction.) The television/minibar unit looked like someone had fashioned it on an episode of Trading Spaces out of plywood, and it served as a bulk piece of furniture to hide a huge mess of cords that went to the internet, fridge, tv, cable, and who knows what else. It kind of looked like elements of the room had been put together after the fact - like they didn't think ahead to get a TV stand/minibar, and they had to retrofit one into the design of the room and shove it in the corner. The room had no real closet, but an ironing board and iron in room (not always a given in NYC) and a nice bathrobe. Another nice touch was the turn down service, though the radio was turned on rather loud to an obnoxious station again (I wish they'd go for a classical station, just loud enough to be heard when you walk in - that would be so much more soothing.)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Judy S
Reviews.Content: Making a reservation somewhere I've never stayed before was making me a bit uneasy but once I arrived, all vanished. It is a wonderful hotel in the tradition of what New York offers its visitors. I will recommend it to all my fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Keeps me coming back”
Reviews.Author: jd_three
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times now and The Time does not disappoint. From it's great location on W 49 Street which is relatively quiet in spite of being a block off Times Square to its proximity to so many great restaurants and theaters it's a great placed to stay. Rooms are always clean and comfy and the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad: Marathon Weekend”
Reviews.Author: gymman40
Reviews.Content: The good: staff is uniformly friendly and helpful. They seem to really care about their guests. Room was about $300/night, cheap for that particular weekend. The bad: The hotel needs a make-over; rooms are shabby and need painting, carpeting, and new lighting. Hallways are dim and carpeting is dirty. Towels ought to have been replaced years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Two night stay was great”
Reviews.Author: HusnaO
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel, I liked the decor (though it will get dated very quickly), and I thought the staff was nice. At first our air conditioner didn't work in the first room, and my husband was annoyed, but after we told them, they moved us to another room. Rooms were clean, I had nothing to really complain about here besides the AC issue, but that was resolved, for two nights I had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, aging rooms, but generally clean”
Reviews.Author: jttraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short-notice business trip, when rooms at better hotels were running above $500/nt. The Time is very close to Times Square, and has a nice nightclub next to the small lobby. The rooms, sadly, are tiny, and various parts of my room (dimmer switch, shades) were broken on arrival. The bedding was nice and clean, and the carpets weren't particularly bad, but overall the rooms look very very tired. Room was quiet enough, given the location, but I wouldn't stay here again unless I had no other reasonable options. Not appropriate for families, couples, or anyone who needs some space to work. (Room service breakfast was decent, but who doesn't give you ketchup when you order potatoes and eggs?)

Reviews.Title: “i immediately regret this decision”
Reviews.Author: ThePookies
Reviews.Content: In order to help as much people as I can I'll make my review as a list of all the bad things we experienced during our short stay. I hope that by doing it so more people will read it and will find it helpful. - The staff was very snobby. I felt like I was talking to a bouncer at an elite night club and not to the staff at the hotel I Paid for! - 1st room - Small and with unbearable noise from the room AC and more amazing, from all the hotel AC engines outside the window. Even with the windows closed. - When we requested someone to come and take a look/listen they just did NOT. After 15 minutes we gave up and went ourselves to the reception. - 2nd room â€“ smelled really bad. Smoke and dustâ€¦ - The bed was not comfortable - The TV quality was poor and the TV system crashes (I actually watched windows 2000 loading up several times on the screenâ€¦) - They have a very expensive minibar but no bottle opener. And again when we asked that they'll send us one it took about 20 minutes. - If you even dare to pick up something from the minibar just to look â€“ you will be charged (to be fair â€“ they cancelled the charge after a little debate) - No more than 2 pillows per room - The shower head kept falling on us - The bathroom floor had rust (never seen that one before) - No shelf/rack in the bathroom. You have to put your stuff on the toilet cover or on the floor - The clock in the room wasn't set right - The lights above the bed are hard to turn off. You have to get up from the bed. - The lobby turns at nights to a night club with very bad and loud music - Room keys tend to stop working The good stuff: - Location - Nice design For conclusion â€“ very low price/what you get ratio. It made me search Wikipedia about the hotels-stars system because if this hotel can announce it is 4-starsâ€¦ - it's pretty worthless. Happy vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on a great location”
Reviews.Author: rpo
Reviews.Content: We booked at the last minute just for one night. What a great choice this was. The rooms are nice and well appointed. The front desk staff is very cordial, efficient and accomodating. What a location this place has Broadway, Time Square you are a block away from the center of NYC. We have found our new home base when going to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: SnowMan0190
Reviews.Content: I had to overnight in NY so decided to have a little look around. I decided to stay in this hotel and I do not regret it. The location is excellent, very short walk to Times Square and all the good restaurants. This hotel is very clean, the room I was in was very clean, very nice bed and good television. The only thing that was missing was a nice view, but when I donâ€™t pay a lot to stay here I donâ€™t expect to have a nice view. All the hotel staff were very friendly, had a very nice sleep and nothing to complain about. Would recommend this hotel to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Price is tempting-don't do it”
Reviews.Author: Bozinator
Reviews.Content: I could have upgraded to a motel 6! 4 stars-really! No bell desk, no late check out. Crazy blaring music until 3am. SLOW/NO bar service. View of nothing. At least they were rude to round out the scuzzy gross room experience. Recommend, not no, hell no.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in NY!!! Excelent ratio price /quality”
Reviews.Author: Hugo D
Reviews.Content: We visit NY last week, and again we stay in THE TIME NY Hotel, the people was very kindly and like your family, the location is the best, the hotel is located in the heart of Broadway, just steps from times square and I recommend to drink a mojito in the bar, one of the best mojito that i try. and the restaurant Serafina has a good quality of food and very delicious dishes especially pasta. Near to the train stations and you can move for all NY from there and for the airport too The rooms are very confortables and equiped with all that you need. And finally the prices are reasonables....

Reviews.Title: “My time at The Time”
Reviews.Author: melodyrose27
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very nice employees! You get the newspaper every morning, and every evening you get a card with the next day's weather. To be honest, there are 2 reasons why I love it the most.. first, it has the most comfortable beds I've ever seen! Second, it's right off Times Square.. so if you're there for the shopping, theaters and museums, or anything else for that matter.. you are withing walking distance of almost everything. They also have a small gym for those that like to keep in shape even when they are away.

Reviews.Title: “Could be chic and boutique but no upkeep.”
Reviews.Author: jeffmargel
Reviews.Content: After looking for a small boutique hotel in Manhattan on line, this seemed to be a good value. Although it wasn't the very least expensive it was relatively inexpensive and had Serafina as the restaurant downstairs. Upon check-in we went to the room to settle in and found that the shades were badly worn and one didn't close all the way. The furniture in this tiny space was chipped and very tired. The shelving in the micro bathroom was falling apart and the shower was a mix of tiles and faux tiles with mold in the corners. The toilet wouldn't stop running without some manual help and later in the stay it overflowed, which didn't seem to surprise the front desk. The king bed was comfortable but the sheets were too small for it, exposing the bed pad at the foot of the bed after 5 minutes of sleep. Restaurant was great,true to Serafina's reputation. Elevators are tiny and used by service staff ALL DAY! always waiting to get to the upper floors was frustrating to say the least. The lounge was fun, friendly staff helped warm up the worn look of the space. With a little paint and attention to detail this hotel might be comfortable but obviously no one is spending any money to keep up with the wear and tear a city hotel takes. Is anyone watching? The staff was courteous and as helpful as they could be. Save yourself some disappointment and aggravation and spend a little more to get a much better experience. I do understand the saying "you get what you pay for" but for 500.00 plus dollars for two nights, I expect something that's not falling apart. If you offer an in room safe, have it in working order, or remove it and save the space in the tiny area they call a room. Needless to say The Time has seen IT'S time. We'll take our money and our chances elsewhere next stay. J from L.I.

Reviews.Title: “if you enjoy dirty scruffy hotels with bad staff...stay here!”
Reviews.Author: beth s
Reviews.Content: where do I start. Moved to this hotel from the amazing Distrikt hotel due to having our flight cancelled when hurricane irene hit and the distrikt being fully booked...it looked nice on the website and wasnt cheap either. We got there at 3 and our room wasnr ready..even though check in is at 3. The staff werent helpful at all and the girls behind the reception desk were more concerned about where they'd be partying tonight than the fact they had guests waiting in the lobby for their room to be ready. When we eventually got to the room...it was vile. the hallway leading up to the room looked dirty and had an awful smell so I knew we werent in for much... but the room STANK i dont even know what of it just had the most disgusting smell. It backed straight onto a building and there was no natural light in the room..as well as this the bathroom was dirty. the bright red bed linen also made it seem brothel like. we didnt even have a remote for our tv..........literally the worst value hotel ive ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “in the thick of it”
Reviews.Author: goodadvice3000
Reviews.Content: Depending on the price you can get it this hotel is not bad. I paid a preminum because it was high season so feels slightly overpriced. its a fantastic location. really close to time square , metro etc but quiet inside. Pleasant rooms, ok staff. Have to pay for breakfast and internet daily rate ( I think internet should be free in all hotels but it never is). Enjoyed my stay. There are lots of breakfast places close by but the hotel breakfast is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here...great hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: zapatamama
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC on business monthly, and have stayed at an assortment of hotels in and around midtown but have to say that The Time is simply the best. The hotel was clean, check in was efficient and friendly, the room was perfectly modern and comfortable, room service was awesome, and the location was great. Beyond that, the Charlie Katz and the overnight manager, Leo, were extremely helpful when I had a change of plans and needed to get to the airport in a urgent fashion. They arranged to have everything ready (car, bill, etc.) and went above and beyond. I intend to stay here as much as possible on future trips (when it is not sold out)...

Reviews.Title: “Tolomeo lamps, yes. Mildew, no.”
Reviews.Author: rocket_jdt
Reviews.Content: The good: An amazing last-minute deal on Hotel Tonight. Nice, mostly-not-silly/not-too-designy design (I was worried by the eggs-egg-cartons-under the glass elevator and that lame pipe dripping into an ashtray thing at the entrance. Good location (closer to 8th than Times Square, which is good). The bad: The room was a little worse-for-wear (scuffed furniture, torn carpet) and the bathroom was pretty dirty (mildew in the sink; black, brown and yellow mildew in the grout between the shower tiles and mildew and brown drip stains on the ceiling). I know, it's been damp, but just a wipe down with a cloth would have solved the problem. The toilet overflowed on the first flush (a piece of gum... I know, a waste of water so it serves me right) and kept running, getting water everywhere (which I didn't notice right away because I was in the shower). They fixed the problem and replaced all the towels I used to sop up the water. And that could have happened anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, poor hygiene”
Reviews.Author: Ramiro B
Reviews.Content: It was bad from the start. When I checked in (after 3 PM, not very nice), I was given the wrong room type. When I asked to be changed into a suite, the clerk, instead of checking my booking, said the suite was very expensive, implying I could not afford it. I had to go online (and pay for it) to clear the matter and get the correct room. A couple of days later, my girlfriend actually saw a mouse in our room and was terrified. To be fair, the hotel didn`t charge for that night, but we had to pack and change rooms again, and not for a very good reason. Furthermore, I could not say the staff is very effective. For any simple order (hangers or a bucket of ice) we had to call more than once and wait for quite some time. I would recommend to anyone looking for a hotel room in the Times Sq area to look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Lily S
Reviews.Content: I love The Time hotel great location close to everything. The staff was awesome. There were willing to help me with whatever I needed at the time and went above and beyound with the service. I stayed there a few time and will definitely stay there again next time I'm in NYC. I highly recommened this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkably Bad”
Reviews.Author: jonmrich
Reviews.Content: This hotel was bad from moment one. I arrived at 1pm and was told my room wasn't ready. They said they'd call when it was. I never got a call. I returned to the hotel at 10pm (after a day of meetings) and my room was ready. When I got to my room, it reeked of cigarette smoke. I called to the front desk for another room and they told me none were available (technically, they told me none were available and to call back in an hour (11PM), as some might be available then. Sure, I'm going to stay up all night hoping for another room. As someone who was explicit about needing a non-smoking room due to allergies, it didn't mean much. Also, like a number of other reviews mentioned, the bathrooms are vile. Mold everywhere and on every white surface. It's disgusting. Overall, this has been a terrible experience...the worst I've had in NYC (and I'm here a lot). There are thousands of hotels in Manhattan and there's no reason to select this one. Move along to ANYTHING different.

Reviews.Title: “great GM and staff”
Reviews.Author: Dougt0522
Reviews.Content: THe Time is a very hip hotel in midtown. It is run by a very nice, concientious, and cool general manager, Kanvar Singh. He overseas a good property in NYC with good people. the hotel has the location, the restaurant and lounge, but the gm and his people are the greatest asset.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but the staff is even better!”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter0920
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a two night stay at the Time Hotel, and it couldn't have gone any better. I arrived at the hotel around 12pm on a Tuesday, the doorman greeted me at the curb, assisted me with my luggage and escorted me to the Front Desk. On the way he spoke about the restaurant, introduced me to the GM (who was exiting the building) and the Front Desk Manager who checked me in. Upon check in, I was given a complimentary upgrade into a suite and a late check out at no cost. The manager described the hotel and amenities it had to offer including a $10 wifi fee. I stated i was use to free wifi and without hesitiation he comped the two day charge! You could tell he was a charmer! I was escorted to the room by Gilbert, and on the way he introduced me to the concierge, the housekeeper on the floor, and housekeeping manager in passing. I felt right at home. The room was clean, modern and big for NYC standards. Turndown service at night, and a complimentary NY Times in the morning. Check out was quick and easy. Gilbert assisted me from the room, Charlie was there to check me out and Ed hailed a can like a pro. Great job Time Hotel! You have won me over, this is my new hotel of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Elegance without the pretension”
Reviews.Author: Roadieforrock
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at "The TIme" last night and I have never felt more compelled to share my experience. We are both in the music business, so we have stayed almost everywhere in New York and this trendy, low-key, hot-spot, is hands down the place to stay! Upon arrival we where greeted by an extremely well spoken doorman who led us through the impressive High-design entrance into an all glass elevator that brought us up to the lobby. The front desk attendant Andre, or Andrewi think than quickly checked us in while providing us with a play by play of all of the hotels many amenities.Â  I couldn't believe the level of professional as well as the suave ambiance projected by the hotels staff. They moved quickly and efficiently, without forgoing service. Something most hotels in the heart of times square are incapable of achieving. The time it took us to get in the hotel, check in, and get to our room couldn't have been more than 10 mins which is quite the feat and something a person like myself who is constantly on the road appreciates. The professionalism and competence of the employees with out a doubt stems from the hotels hip gm, Kanvar Singh. I have never had the gm of a hotel actually make himself known, let along approach me and introduce himself, offering his personal knowledge of the property and the surrounding area. The room was perfect size, we had two full size beds, a fully stocked mini-bar with drinks and snacks, and a flat screen high-deff TV! Again, for a hotel in times square I was expecting to be one of countless guests without any personal attention and the time completely blew that expectation away. I cant recommended this hotel enough. If you are traveling to the city for any reason and want a hip, stylish, personally accompanying stay than this is the spotfoRbear guys are killing it, and if you don't wanna feel like another abused tourist in times square, than this is your sanctuary on west 49th! street!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty bathrooms but great service and location”
Reviews.Author: jo-jen2000
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this Time Square hotel in late August/early September on a shopping trip to New York. I have been to New York several times as I used to travel there monthly on business a few years ago. I have stayed at high end hotels, (such as the Pierre, Trump, Soho Grand) and mid-range hotels. This was by far the worst hotel that I have stayed in while visiting New York. The rooms are small and there is no view of any kind (these are not major issues for me). However, the bathrooms are filty (this is a major issue for me). The first room that we got was dusty and the bathroom had mold around the shower stall. We asked for another room and the same thing with that room. We checked 5 rooms before we got one that was acceptable. There is absolutely no reason for this. I went out and bought a bottle of cleaner with bleach and cleaned the bathroom myself. I left the bottle for the hotel. On the plus side the front desk staff were excellent. Very patient and accomodating. It is obviosuly not there fault.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room. Great Location. Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Rotem S
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel on labor day weekend. We booked a queen sized room but were notified upon arrival that we were upgraded to a king sized room, which was awesome. The room was still pretty small but other than that it was excellent. Comfy bed, nice shower and complementary bathrobes. Two things you should know before arriving - there is only a very small sign on the street indicating there's a hotel at this location. So make sure you know exactly where you're supposed to go. Also, the elevators are kinda slow (there are only two) but unless you're riding them up and down all day long it shouldn't bother you as much.

Reviews.Title: “Award for Best Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Dimple M
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay. My girlfriend and I stayed at The Time just after Hurricane Irene. Besides being in a convenient location, the staff at the hotel were amazing. Melissa, at the main level bar, not only served me my coffee and drinks but also offered me some tips on what to see and do in the city including providing me with directions to various spots (Server/Concierge - all in one!) Thanx Melissa! The porter in the elevator offered me to tips on where we can dine, etc. I had a lovely chat with the bartender on the second level lounge my first night there and apaprently Bond St. is a great sushi spot! And I don't think I have ever seen a more efficeint housekeeping service than the one at The Time in a long time. My room was cleaned and serviced in a very timely manner. So thank you Time for making our stay a wonderful one!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and the staff”
Reviews.Author: andrea s
Reviews.Content: We thought the hotel was great! The staff was friendly and helapful, especially the manager, Charles Katz. He helped us when we has a problem with our reservation. They all treated us like royality!

Reviews.Title: “Concierge was awesome”
Reviews.Author: Sam H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the hurricane in NYC and was disapointed that that the hotel lounge was closed (though I can excuse it due to Irene). Other than that it was a very pleasant experience, and the concierge was incredibly helpful and even gave me an umbrella to brave the storm with. I'm sure that without the limited hurricane amenities it would have been a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bystr
Reviews.Content: was in New York on business, stayed at the Time hotel. great place for the value! nice size rooms. clean! very friendly and helpfull staff. wonderful lounge and restaurant! close to all in midtown manhattan. will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Eric L
Reviews.Content: Hi, my girlfriend & i stayed in The Time hotel NYC on july 2011. it's in a grate place, just a block of times square and broadway. however after checking in we got to our room, it was so small we could only open 1 of our suit cases so that was a bad strat. we went down to change room for a biger 1, but was extra. so we desided to pay and up we went to a room a bit biger an wit a view of a 10 story building 10 feet away. e.g NO VIEW!!!! but we were not bothered cos we would only be sleeping there. room was nice otherwise. We tryed the resterunt the next morning for breckfast and it was very poor. price to high not enough food on the plate, had to wait wee bit to long and you would not here the waiter behind a news papper. lol. i'd go else were again.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms in a big city”
Reviews.Author: dfillos
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the location was very central as it was 2 minitues away from the Times Square and the bus stops and 15 minutes (by foot) from the Central Park. On the negative side, our room was very small with no view which does not inspire you in any way. Our room was in the 14th floor. On the 15th floor, things were much worse for our friends as their room was even smaller (it nearly fitted a single bed, a chair and a TV) which was unacceptable since we both had paid for a double bedroom. If you are lucky, the air condition will not make too much noice so that you can sleep at nights.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: ivan r
Reviews.Content: the trip started out ok, we checked in the young doorman John or Jake was friendly and helped with luggage, the front desk is on the second floor so that was different in a good way. The tall Asian man Kan checked us in, he was friendly but couldn't keep eye contact he was busy checking out my wife and staring at anything in a skirt that was behind me. I found this annoying but I am a man so could somewhat understand I just think it was very unprofessional. Once we got to the room I was not to impressed. Lot of scuff marks.. mildew in the showers the air conditioning didn't work and my minibar looked empty. I complained and the room was changed, Kan was very helpful with the change. The staff is a different set of characters but that is what you love about new york. I was impressed at the professionalism and friendliness by Leo, Vanessa, Howard, Miguel, Jake. The restaurant on the ground floor was very good, the concierge Stella helped us with tickets and information on the city. Just with all the wear and tear in the room and the roaming eyes I might try another place first before coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Todd022
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a little less than one week. From the porters, receptionist at check-in, concierge, wait staff, the service was excellent all-around! They were extremely helpful, courteous and accommodating! My expectations were not only met, but exceeded throughout my stay. I will return for another stay!

Reviews.Title: “Live in the Heart of NY - We will be back again!!”
Reviews.Author: Viquar S
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything that one would want from a NY hotel. Location, accommodating staff, great views, location! We were able to get the most of our vacation thanks to the hotel. The location is just fantastic. The rooms were nice. And the staff very courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: JediPierre
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable and everything was fine until we tried to take a shower. It was a bit of a hassle getting a new room with a shower that worked, the staff was annoyed but accomodated us in the end. We were commensated for our troubles once we were got home. Nice hotel lobby, bar and restaurant. You can't beat the location. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful time at The Time”
Reviews.Author: LordShowbiz
Reviews.Content: Just discovered this really GREAT hotel in midtown Manhattan on my recent trip to see friends. Wonderful and friendly staff, very cool and hip bar Inc Lounge and very good food - they have the restaurant Serafina in their hotel - fab Pizzas. From the doormen (I think it was Eddie and Gilbert) to the concierge and the front desk folks - I was made to feel so welcome. If you like theater (like I do) you cannot find a more perfect area as I walked to all the shows I saw. I can only recommend this hotel on a very positive and very high level. I will be back at the end of this year!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find in a Top Spot”
Reviews.Author: judi_rose
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on a last minute booking & loved it! Right in the heart of Times Square and amongst the theatres - one right next door. Lobby is on the first floor, so a little tricky to find, but very helpful staff & fabulous, modern trendy rooms. A great little Italian restaurant on the ground floor added to the enjoyment. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WORST PLACE I HAVE EVER STAYED”
Reviews.Author: scinstallation
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the room was not ready 1/2 hour later 4:00 it was. Went to room headboard falling of the wall it was held up with double side velcro, bathroom filthy tv did not work, phone did not work just a mess. Went to another room that was the same way. Called Manager and she ROLLED HER EYES WHEN I WAS TALKING TO HER ABOUT THE FILTHY ROOM. Changed to a 3rd room still the same Mold in the shower and the sink. They just caulked over with clear caulk and left the mold. The staff is very rude. Owners should take a good look at the staff as I am not the only one that did not have a nice stay. Would never stay there even if it was the last room in NYC. I do have pics on all of this.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome weekend, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Berna26
Reviews.Content: The location of The Time is absolutely perfect if you want to spend a weekend at the theater in New York. I was a bit worried it could be a bit too loud and busy to spend a hot July weekend in Mid-Town, but entering the lobby was enough to start relaxing in a little friendly oasis in the middle of the city. All the staff was super-friendly and nice and were happy to accommodate a couple of changes I needed to make without making any fuss. The rooms are smart and trendy without being cheesy or gaudy, everything is very stylish. Some people complain about the size of the rooms, but having a bigger room in NYC is both unimaginable and pointless. You get everything you need: clean, relatively spacious rooms and bathrooms, nice new beds, huge flatscreen TV and minibar. And on top of everything there are small details that make you feel more comfortable and cared for than in big chain hotels. Overall it was a wonderful experience and difficult to beat: perfect location, cool and helpful staff, cozy and quiet rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Poor Room Quality”
Reviews.Author: JGardner_11
Reviews.Content: We decided to pay extra ($300-$350 per night) to stay in a really nice hotel during our two day vacation in NYC. Upon arriving at The Time we were very happy with the location and the service from the bellmen, the service desk, the bellhop--all very friendly and helpful. But upon entering our room we were very disappointed. The door was badly cracked and broken--as if someone had forced the door open while the night latch was secure. In the bathroom: the shower and ceiling had mildew (mold?), the caulking around the sink was peeling/dirty/slimy, and paint on the ceiling was peeling, Overall, the room was small and dingy with stains on the carpet and furniture with cracks and chips. So although the service was good we could not recommend this hotel to friends due to the discrepency between high cost and low room quality.

Reviews.Title: “Really poor, overpriced and nothing worked!”
Reviews.Author: danmatthews1234
Reviews.Content: So many things wrong with the hotel, so I'll try to be brief: the room key cards were very temperamental and rarely worked. They never worked for the gym. The TV remote didn't work, the safe was locked, the fridge didn't work, the room was the tiniest king room I have ever stayed in. Despite this it had 2 phones, but neither of them worked. The floor was soaking by the aircon unit, which was leaking. I complained about all of this in person (the phones didn't work) after a 2 night stay, the safe was still locked, the phones didn't work still, floor was soaked still. But the TV remote worked! Also, the lifts are very slow and usually full, and despite being part of Preferred Hotels, they refused to take airmiles cards

Reviews.Title: “Was probably nice 10 years ago...”
Reviews.Author: Mykingsdomaine
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Time in NYC. The location is good if you must be in Times Square. However everything in the hotel is tiny and tired. Minimalist is fine if what little there is is fresh and clean. That's not the case here. This property is in serious need of a renovation. It needs new carpet, new furniture and new grout in the bathrooms. It especially needs two new chairs in the lobby! White tufted leather looks great for the first few months. But when it gets tinged gray with dirt - it sets a tone that unfortunately - this hotel lives down too. I'd recommend this hotel only after it goes through a complete renovation. Until then - there are fresher and better choices in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Jozien
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! The place is great And also especially the service!! Everybody here is so kind an is always willing to find another option if one isn't possible. Also I wanted to say many thanks to Kenneth, so overall this hotel is great and I would stay here another time also if I have to compare it with other hotels in New York (been here two times earlier).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DsWoman
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here this past week because we both had interviews in the Manhattan. The Times is centrally located in the Times Square area, which made it perfect for both of us. It also has the beautiful Serafina restaurant on the ground floor of the hotel. We had a lovely lunch there and checked into our room. Clean, comfy and beautiful! Our stay was brief, but exactly what we needed. A little oasis among all the surround "meh" hotels in Manhattan!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome stay”
Reviews.Author: Aayushsaksena
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located right in the heart of time square..they have a very helpful staff and very useful concierge.. The restaurant has great food and in all a very lively place..I recommend staying here. Kudos to the general manager.

Reviews.Title: “We loved The Time”
Reviews.Author: Petermelr0se
Reviews.Content: Funky hotel, great location, cool bar, yummy food and friendly, helpful staff. Great coffee at the bike hire place down the road. Room was spacious and well appointed but the fridge is not usable except for the minibar items. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “an experience i'll cherish for long”
Reviews.Author: ReemaHora
Reviews.Content: as soon as i entered my room on the 14th floor i was greeted by peppy numbers playing on the BOSE system installed in the aesthetically designed cosy room and a complimentary bottle of wine (because there was just a little bit of delay in allotment of room due to the weekend pressure... and to compensate for the same they safely deposited my luggage at the hotel and i was free to hop into the streets of Time Square). After a long day of back breaking shopping, sumptuous meals and long walks i deceided to call it a day and walked back to the hotel (oh! i absolutely loved the location). the highlight of the stay were my multiple moments of terror- like - i forgot my blackberry charger, needed some really urgent print outs, sensible cab hiring for the airport (i am not a native NYer) and many more and ALL of this was promptly taken care of by their pro-active staff. thanks for it all betty and gang... u guys did a great job in handling my chaos :) GOOD LUCK AND THANKS GUYS!! P.S. during ur stay here do drop in @ the INC lounge. its completely worth it !!

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: najeray
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the location is great, BUT ...I spent two nights here and got two rooms. My room was ok. The bathroom shower needs to be redone. It had mildew in a lot of areas. Also, housekeeping did not come the next morning. I was very disappointed. Bed did not get done and I had to call for clean towels. My second room,the door had an opening on top,like it had not been measured and cut correctly. The toilet flushed all night. carpet was lifted in some areas. I called for room service@11:10 and was told that room serviced ended@11 but the hotel book said 11:30.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Trip!”
Reviews.Author: littlebirdie83
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend trip in the city. The hotel was modern, clean, and the staff helpful! Not to mention I love having a copy of the times complimentary. The location was great, near all the trains. Given that it was time square I was worried about the noise, but I didn't hear a peep! I will be making return trips!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: joycefledderman
Reviews.Content: Location was great - few minute walk to the theatre, comedy clubs, etc. Staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was small with a view of the parking garage but it was clean and nicely decorated. Bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY THE BEST STAFF !! WILL DEF STAY AGAIN !!”
Reviews.Author: stevince
Reviews.Content: Just booked this 24 Hrs before on a whim. Location was GREAT, but one STAFF Member in particular was AMZING ! If u decide to stay here ask for Vanessa... I travel ALOT & I cannot tell u HOW INCREDIBLE she was to make my ONLY ONE NITE STAY a COMPLETE PLEASURE ! My Orig Room was Beautifiul but had a Broken AC.. The Next Room some IDIOT Smoked in & Vanessa gave me an UPGRADE to a LARGER ROOM AND a LATE CHECK OUT ! Where in NYC do u find this ? ABSOLUTELY THE BEST !! Hotel was CLEAN & VERY COMFORTABLE. Walked to everything I needed to do, so saved $$ on Cab Fare & taking the Subway. Im a NAtive NYer but live in LA for 20 years now.. It was a JOY to be treated like this ! SOMEONE NEEDS A PROMOTION .. & A HUGE RAISE !! The only DOWNSIDE is that I didnt have a chance to say GOODBYE becuase she was off that day, but Ill be back !!! :)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: lynashe
Reviews.Content: i advise people to disregard bad reviews as we really liked this hotel , the location was excellent staff were very helpful i did have a problem because after we checked out i realised i left my camera on the bed & when we went back to get it the housekeeping said they couldnt find it, i would like to speak to the hotel manager & offer a $700 reward for any staff member who can locate my camera as the photos are irreplaceable im very upset, but i would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting nyc .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Time”
Reviews.Author: nstecker23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Time for a bachelorette party and from start to finish we had an amazing time. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful, the hotel room was nicely furnished and the amenities were great. I will definitely stay in this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a chic hotel in the heart of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: sbwindup
Reviews.Content: Great experience once again!!! Friendly staff and a great location. Fun bar within the hotel. Very close to the recording studio I work out of. Thanks once again TIME staff!! Best, SB

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but ..”
Reviews.Author: BestQuality
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the The Time for 2 nights with my fiancee. I loved the room as well as the bathroom. I could turn on the TV in the first place,called the Guest Services to get some help and I was told: "someone will be right up". After 10mins I figured out the way to make it work,called again to say I did no longer need help. 30 mins later somebody knocks on my door; "how can I help you with your TV Sir" ....! Anyway, the following morning we forgot to put the DO NOT DISTURB sign and the Housekeeping knocked at 9.15 and woke us up! My fault for not putting the sign but 9.15 it's kind of early. The AC was awfully loud and did not do the job. A great guy working overnight came up at11pm to fix it and helped me further with a couple of suggestions for clubs and pubs. Shame it was his last week! Anyway, loved the room, but a couple of Guest Services aspects were lacking. I forgot to say that after calling two days in advance to get an early check-in, I did not get it and the agent at the desk didn't even look as if he knew anything about it upon check-in time!!! Might be back for the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: kanikakchadha
Reviews.Content: I will definitely be staying at this hotel again. The room was amazing. Very modern and chic. The hotel is located right next to Times Square so nothing was really too far. The hotel staff was very kind and helpful. They really know the city and could guide me perfectly. The service was prompt, the rooms were clean, and I can't wait to return. Awesome experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't My First Choice”
Reviews.Author: Rittberg
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the Parker Meridien. They were sold out as was most of the city. As an I Prefer member - I stayed at The Time. Great location near Time Square. Rooms are small compared to what I was used to having. There was street construction the first night - but normal for NYC. Check in folks were nice. Room needs an upgrade. It could stand a coat of paint. A previous guests luggage tag was still stuck to the wall. The shower is in need of repair - new tile, shower head and patching the ceiling would be in order. Bed was fine. AC worked fine as did the TV. Room 705

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: nyc10010
Reviews.Content: Rooms were barely large enough to accommodate the bed. The street noise was pervasive the entire night, preventing sound sleep. The air conditioning did not work on a hot summer night. The room service shut down at least an hour before the time indicated in the materials in the room. And those were its good points.

Reviews.Title: “CONSTRUCTION”
Reviews.Author: sftravel1000
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and found it nice. I would even recommend it normally but CALL for a CONSTRUCTION UPDATE. Unless you love jack hammers, reverse beeping alarms from trucks and awful noise, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: the_danster_85
Reviews.Content: Arrived on May 22 exhausted, went up to room on 14th floor and realized view was of the backs of buildings and alleys. Called and asked if possible to be switched and we were moved to 803 next day (had to check out of 14th floor room at 12 and they held our luggage til 3 when we could check back in - minor inconvenience but worth the new view). Was very worried about bed bugs, so did a inspection of both rooms, which were both fine far as I could tell. Definitely lysoled the fabric behind the bedding though and put the coloured sheet from the bed on the floor, I doubt these are regularly washed. Location is amazing, we literally walked everywhere. Didn't eat at Serapina but did get room service once - bagel with salmon and cream cheese + latte : $23.60 including tip, definitely a bit much. Any call made (even local) is charged $1 to the room whether or not it is picked up. Ordered pizza one night through concierge, Kenneth was very helpful. No bath tub was a minor suprise but not a big deal. If you don't like your view, definitely ask if there is anything else with one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: FlorGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with some friends over the weekend. The location was so convenient and is only walking distance to the heart of Manhattan. We arrived on Sunday and checked in around 2pm. The front desk staff was very accommodating and hospitable. Considering being in the city the room was a fair size. I would definitely return to stay at The Time again!!

Reviews.Title: “Falling Apart”
Reviews.Author: idoltraveller
Reviews.Content: NYC was sold out and I ended up snagging a King Suite here for a $565/night rate. I know New York Hotels and wasn't expecting a palace but boy, I wasn't expecting a room that felt so worn out. There were nicks in almost every piece of furniture and the bathtub was in need of replacement - the grout around the tub was falling off. The bathtub stopper had mold on it. And the shower ceiling's mold had been spackled over, just barely. The elevators are tiny and take forever and the room service is overpriced considerably. Bonus: being able to hear the dumptrucks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: travel121069
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel this week and had a great experience. The service was good and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: traveller81England
Reviews.Content: We only stay for the weekend icame from london to new York With my mum it's a very good location if your two girls on yur own and you go out at night and don't want to get the subway home. Very close to time square which is always handy and very close to bordway. Staff were friendly and helpful rooms were a bit small but we didn't mind as it was only 3 days I would stay here again only for location bit to much for 4/5 star hotel as it doesn't exceed expectation. There a Italian restaurant next door don't go there it over price for such little food. Apart from that great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: krugarcia
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience of my life. The customer service at this overpriced, dirty, outdated hotel was spectacularly bad. When I went to check in, it took the three juvenile, unprofessional and class-less people behind the desk nearly ten minutes to acknowledge me, even though I was in line at the desk and there was only one other customer in the lobby. One of the reasons it took so long is because one of those three individuals had, apparently, broken wind at the reception desk, stinking up the lobby. The male worker was so busy making a big deal about it and drawing attention to it that they were all distracted. There was no opportunity for a good night's rest for two reasons.
