First, my phone kept inexplicably ringing in the middle of the night due to some malfunction. Second, in the early morning hours, hotel employees were loudly coming and going down the hall, slamming doors up and down the floor. The day I checked out, the elevator was broken. A hotel employee cut in front of me to get into the only working elevator with a cart so large that only he and the cart could fit in the elevator. When I explained that I had been waiting for a very long time (and needed to check out), he angrily told me he needed the elevator because the other one was broken. On the day I checked in, my bags had to be stored for a few hours. I had to call reception three times (over the course of half an hour) to get my bags even though I was the only person who checked in during the time I was in the lobby. The last day I was at the hotel, the hallways were littered with trash. There were huge trashbags on the floors for hours that final morning. And the rooms, while decently cleaned, were old, scuffed and dated. This hotel is TERRIBLE. Truly, I have never had a worse customer service experience. Do not stay here. A youth hostel would be better. It is TERRIBLE.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and quirky in a bad way”
Reviews.Author: Bennett831
Reviews.Content: I might stay here for $225/night, but never again for $450. Windows not soundproofed, so street noise kept me up even though I'm usually a sound sleeper.Turning off the lights was also a challenge--the two-way dimmer switch for the light next to the entrance was infuriatingly hard to figure out. Even more infuriating was the fact the card key to the room only worked sporadically. I thought the cards had been desensitized and got new ones at the front desk, but the problem persisted. One day the maid saw me struggleing with it and offered to help. She got it on the fifth or sixth try, and when I asked if there was a trick, she said "Oh no, they're all different." Luckily I never needed to get into the room in a hurry. The "closet" was bisected by a shelf with the room safe on it, so that there was no way to hang anything longer than a shirt. My colleague's room had no closet at all, though there was a bathrobe hanging on the shower curtain rod. The bathrooms in both our rooms appeared to be fitted for handicapped accessibility, but it would've been impossible for a wheelchair to fit through the narrow hall/corridor in my room, so maybe all the bathooms were designed that way? Just odd.

Reviews.Title: “this is not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: genow39
Reviews.Content: very small rooms, ac did not work well, bathroom shower was moldy and tile was falling out. Shower leeked pretty bad. Soap dish falling off the wall. Bed spread was smelly . Tv didnt work well, had a hard time with the remote working. Toilet would stick on.The hotel was dark and seedy like an off strip vegas hotel. Staff was nice but could of been more helpful to plann tours. We did get a NY times paper one morning that was nice. The resteraunt was expensive and not that good. It has a night club in the hotel that has an unsavory element.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience with payment”
Reviews.Author: gabriel1406
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Time NY hotel at 1218 suite since May 9th until May 14th. On March 10th a 386.58 dollars were charged at my AMEX credit card (operation number 397277). Last day of my stay at hotel the invoice did not show detail of my payment in advance. So, I went to claim to front desk, Saturday 14th morning, where I found very few assistance and lack of kindness... It was a bad surprise because everything had been good until then. When I checked out, the full amount (1973.09) was charged to my AMEX. So, I would very appreciate the hotel pay me back the 386.58 ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: M2011
Reviews.Content: Service was unprofessional, my account was debited 700 dollar too much, and no explanation for that. Me and my friend "upgraded" first, but we ask to get our "deluxe" room after we saw that "upgraded" room. Bad "deluxe" room was better than that "junior suite" and its crappy sofa bed. My door key end of working cause our room was not paid (??), and still they have overcharged me 700 dollar (as well as my friends). Finally they said that I canÂ´t get my room key because of "security reasons", what the f**k! Bathroom was broken, air conditioner was too loud and room was not cleaned up, there was towels, duvet etc. for two, and after several request we got one duvet more (and after tens of towels, blankets, bedsheets etc). So, there is plenty of good hotels in NYC, this is not one of those.

Reviews.Title: “It's worth staying there”
Reviews.Author: BetoChristo
Reviews.Content: Location is very nice! Hotel is comfortable but needs some repairs. Staff is not that friendly but not that bad as well. I would rate a very nice three stars hotel with a wonderful location. Serafina restaurant is really good for simple meal.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Modern, Chic, and Well-Located”
Reviews.Author: KehPark
Reviews.Content: I won my stay at the Time through a local contest, so my view may be somewhat skewed (as it wasn't MY money spent). Everything was very striking in modern white, blacks, and reds. The front desk (night staff) was at times stereotypically New York - flip and too casual, even to customers. But the highlight was surely the location (right next door to the Book of Mormon, and across the street from a charming old world Roman Catholic church). Also, one of the day staff at guest services really impressed me. I heard Howard Singh speaking Portuguese with two other clients. When I asked him how many languages he spoke, he told me 3. After a bit of conversation, I realized that this wasn't a requirement of the hotel for employment, just a lucky coincidence. As a former student of foreign language, this bit did the most to give the hotel a worldly, polished air. He was also extremely accomodating (his attitude more befitting a hotel front -desk attendant) and articulate. Kudos, Howard Singh.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, dated and dirty room”
Reviews.Author: iambuddylee
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, the doorman wasn't very friendly, or helpful. Check-in wasn't terrible, but also wasn't great. I got a room and immediately when I walked to the room the floor smelled like cigarette smoke. The room was standard small for NYC, but the carpet was dirty, the bathroom had mold and the bed had springs sticking out of it. The shower door didn't shut, and all the crevices in the bathroom had mold. The toilet broke at one point in the stay too. Really, the only good thing I have to say is that it was a good location. The bar or club or whatever is in the hotel draws all kinds of people to the hotel, I didn't appreciate the fact that the elevators weren't key controlled and there were a few people that would come up from the club and just wonder the floors.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: jkbnole
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York fairly frequently for work, and The Time is by far the worst hotel I've stayed in at this price point. The floors and walls were filthy, the bathroom was grungy, the cabinetry was worn, the bed covering was stained, and even the TV had static-y reception. I was scheduled to stay at The Time for four nights. After the first night, I checked out, and told management that the rooms were filthy. They offered me a discount on my next visit, and I explained that there would never be a next visit. As I was checking out, another patron was doing the same, and had the same complaints that I did. The Time simply has not maintained their facility. After I checked out of The Time, I walked across the street to the new hotel The Pearl. Their rates were competitive with The Time and The Pearl was sparkling clean and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, Bad and All That”
Reviews.Author: Chi-T2011
Reviews.Content: I recently celebrated my 40th bday in New York City. Since I was traveling alone and decided not to stay with friends during this trip. I decided on The Times Hotel in NYC. I did read many reviews before settling on this hotel. The reviews were mixed; overall I did not get the feeling that It was the worst hotel in the area. I checked in for only two nights-- I loved the fact that the hotel is really a hands throw from Times Square-- The trouble began when I called to ensure that my reservations were confirmed; the person whom I spoke with was perhaps the rudest person ever! instead of asking me to hold the line, while she checked on my accomodations, she said nothing.. I was on hold for a good five minutes; when she returned, she never apologized for the wait, nor did she apologize for telling me that there were no reservations under my name, even though I did give her a confirmation number. Eventually my reservation was located; when I arrived at the hotel, the main check point is on the second floor; there was no one to assist with my bags; when I got to the room, I was beyond dismayed; the room was so tiny; I quickly got over the size of the room, as I was only staying two nights. When I went into the bathroom, I was a bit taken aback-- it was not modern at all, and it was not very clean ( on the surface, yes) however, the WHITE towels were on a rack that was visible dirty as well as dusty: I did not find out until later that night that the bathroom sink had a leak. At this point, I should have requested a new room; however, again, since it was only two nights... I decided to stay. The next day when I came back to the room after some sightseeing-- I noticed that there were food trays left in the hall by others, not just one tray, but at least 3-4; when I entered the room, It was obvious that someone had been in, as the bed was turned back for the evening. The sheets had not been changed; nor had the floor been vaccumed. The afternoon that I checked out was perhaps the best part of my stay, the doorman was very helpful and someone even helped with my bags. I would say that if you are looking for a place just to sleep, that is relatively inexpensive, that is very close to TS, this would be an ideal hotel, anything more than two days... I would not recommend. My reason is really based upon the fact that the service was not that great, and the room was just dirty-- on my next visit, I will plan to pay to stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, but too much wears everywhere”
Reviews.Author: chies1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Time last weekend. When we did the booking, we were attracted by the fact that it is a Tihany design and its great location. However, after our stay we were a little bit disappointed. I will start with what we liked: This hotel is indeed quite nicely located. It is very close to time square, but since it is not in time square, it is relatively quiet. The service was also not too bad, especially the guys working the ground floor. (I am a bit annoyed by the guy who did the check out. He didn't seems very eager to serve the guest) However, they did give us a room earlier than other people because they saw that we have a baby with us. We appreciated that. The biggest problem with the hotel, however, is that the rooms looks old and dirty. The carpet looks dirty and way too much wear. The walls have many scuff marks that is almost unacceptable. In the shower, many places between the tiles are turing black and very unclean. Our toilet also stopped working on the second day. Please see the pictures I have posted for reference. We have booked 2 rooms, and both of them are quite small--in fact one of them is really tiny even though they charge us the same amount. Lastly, for the price we are paying, we are also surprise that there isn't any coffee maker in the room. As a conclusion, I agree with the complains other member is posting. The hotel really need to step up its maintenance--like repaint the wall as a starter. I sincerely hope the management will turn things around around.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great location and accommodating staff.”
Reviews.Author: priscilla0889
Reviews.Content: Front desk was very efficient and friendly. They were knowledgable and helpful to us with directions to area attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Get-Away at The Time Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clyneman
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying the staff at the Times NYC was excellent especially your â€œDoor-manâ€� Chris Sanchez and his crew as well as security. My wife and I stayed at the hotel for my birthday and Chris was a perfect gentleman with all his assistance from recommendations where to eat, visit, hailing cabs, making change ectâ€¦ Itâ€™s people like Chris and the service that was received that will bring my wife and I back for another stay at The Time Hotel in the future. Iâ€™d advise anyone staying at the Time Hotel to sign up for their â€œiPreferâ€� free membership at www.iprefer.com. This will give you an automatic upgrade as well as free wireless internet in your room. We stayed in the suite which is actually a small living area and a bedroom. Each room has a refrigerator stocked with snacks and drinks which is charged to your room as soon as the item(s) have been removed from the slot. Every morning youâ€™ll receive a complimentary New York Times News paper. The Hotel is located just off of Times Square and all eateries, hotspots and shopping is in walking distance. The only service experience Iâ€™d say that needs a little improvement would be the information we received at the Concierges desk. We purchased the Gray-line tour package for 2 couples and the break-down was done on one ticket and not two. This was significant because when we went to the site to pick up tickets the bill could not be split and all four tickets had to be purchased on one card. Another improvement would be to notify clients that there are premium tickets that could be purchased in advance for the ferry ride to Liberty Island in order to avoid the 1.5 hr line. The last improvement would be to inform clients where to pick up tickets. We were informed to pick up tickets at the bus stop when actually we had to walk another block to a building site to pick them up. We almost missed our scheduled pick-up. Other than these issues the stay at your hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A total dump!”
Reviews.Author: Worldbiztraveller86
Reviews.Content: Checked all the reviews before booking, was totally taken aback. I have stayed in a lot of 3 and 4 start hotels in New York, this was the worst. The place is is terrible shape, everything worn/torn, dirty, broken - my closet door had been replaced with a curtain, there were chunks of repair plaster falling off the bathroom walls, etc...apparently the hotel has just been sold and is going to be remodeled. It certainly needs it! In the meantime, my advice is to avoid the place. The only good thing about it right now is the location which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Kushie77
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the time for a weekend trip to see a hockey game. Located nicely in the Theatre District, it was close to shops, resturaunts and the subway. checkin was easy and upon arriving in our room we discovered the bathroom has dirty towel laying all over the floor. We called the front desk and they we quick to give us a new room with a nicer view. The bed was comfortable with nice linens and plenty of pillows. The bathroom was roomy for a NYC hotel bathroom although the tile in the shower was showing it's age and needed a little TLC. Checkout the next moring was easy and they even offered to let us leave our luggage while we went to the hockey game and did some last minute shopping. The staff was kind with the exception of the rude doorman who was a little put off that we interruped his cigarette break and he had to actually open the door. We would gladly stay here on our next visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1Businesswoman
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend staying at this hotel, not only was the staff pleasant and helpful but the amenities were plenty for someone using it on business. Drawback was gym (small) but I made do. The room was very clean as is the bathroom. A bonus to the hotel is the restaurant Serafina located on the ground floor; not only convenient but good food too! Especially, after a long day at work nice to come and enjoy a delicious dinner. I guess if I had more time I would have a grabbed a drink in the plush lounge however was too beat. Lastly, ran into the GM who was very polite and helpful. He offered his full attention. Excellent staff and service. Again drawback gym but other than that highly recommend staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Rosa and staff were great”
Reviews.Author: jondris
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the big name hotels in Times Square but got the time through Priceline and although the room was smaller then I like everything was hip and ok, the people were fantastic and that sometimes is best of all. I met Rosa the housekeeper who worked with me in getting a late checkout and the people athe front desk were a delight. I want to give a shout out to the girl with the tats on her arm as she made me feel at home and the bellman were awesome. All in All a really fun experience !!!

Reviews.Title: “Worn around the edges”
Reviews.Author: rct225
Reviews.Content: Last year, my wife and I stayed at the Night hotel and really enjoyed our stay. With that in mind, we decided to try The Time since it also a Vikram Chatwal Hotel. I don't think we will make the same choice next time. The best thing about the hotel was it's convenient location. It was close enough to walk to attractions, but far enough away from Times Square to avoid huge crowds. Just avoid the times when Chicago (across the street) opens and closes. The first thing I found quirky was the second floor lobby. It was fine for check-in, but offered little in the way of interacting with the staff unless you wanted to ride in two elevators. My wife commented that it was almost like living in an apartment building. Not a big deal, just a little quirky. Initially, the room seemed nice enough. It was clean, but starting to show it's age. There wasn't much of a view, but it's New York City, so you're likely to be staring at a building no matter the view. The first problem was the heating/cooling system. The system was noisy and the choices were virtually on or off, regardless of the temperature setting on the thermostat or the other controls. The next issue was the constant noise from the elevator, it was non-stop regardless of the time of day and it made sleeping difficult. The television set was a wall-mounted flat panel, but the exposed cable wire (they hid the outlet, but couldn't bother with the cable line .. really?), lousy sound and lack of high-definition made it seem like an afterthought. The bathroom was clean, but there were definite problems. The first problem was the sink almost coming off of it's pedestal and separating from the wall. Apparently the maintenance staff believes that caulk is a structural material. The other problem was with the shower control. The knob or the valve was stripped to the point that it took several minutes of slowly adjusting the knob back and forth, so that the hot water wouldn't scald my wife. I'm on vacation, I don't want to do fixes like I'm at home. Two other small things that we found annoying was the $6 dollar charge for storing our bags, a practice of which I nor my wife had every heard (it seems like "nickel and diming" the customers), and the small $12 glass of sangria at the Sarafina bar which seems a bit ridiculous when compared to the $6 bottle of Stella Artois I bought at the same bar. At least the parking deck across the street was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a location!”
Reviews.Author: Cheerdeb
Reviews.Content: In NYC it's location location location! The Times hotel has it! It is right in the heart of NYC! We had a Girls weekend at the Times! And our stay was great! The Times staff was so friendly, and went the extra mile to make sure we had a great stay! The front desk staff checked us in with great care, letting us check our luggage early and calling us when room was ready! So we could be off to eat at Bobby Flay's Bar American, shop Mac make up, forever 21, Disney Store etc. and site see! We were so amazed with the super location walking distance to everything! We attended the musical "La Cage" and it was right around the corner! The Times hotel room had everything a girl could ask for! Loved the Bose radio and the flat screen tv. We even had time to stop by the bar at the hotel to have a drink! I can't say enough about what a great time we had- Thanks to a great hotel and staff!

Reviews.Title: “They've lost their edge”
Reviews.Author: loveromeforever
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at The Time. We went back because the previous stays had been fine. Two things tell me that they've lost their edge: There was a power outage on our first night there and as we were staying on the 12th floor we had to walk up/down to our room. Not a disaster but no recognition from the hotel staff that this was hugely inconvenient for us - a cocktail, some discount on that night's lodging, something. On departure, we used the car service to JFK that the concierge recommended and arranged. $70 all-in was the deal and upon arrival at JFK the driver tried to stiff us for 70 plus a 20% tip and as I handed him a $100 he said "thank you" planning on keeping the extra $10 to boot! I called him on it and he handed the change back - all of it - and stormed off. I wrote the hotel on its website letting them know they need to watch their vendors closer. Their response? Same as the power outage - nothing. It's such a disappointing lack of care for a hotel that is otherwise pretty cool and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “The time needs a thorough cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Kayakit
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the time for two nights and was unimpressed. The floors were dirty in the rooms and the hallways. The door to my room looked as if some had tried to kick it down or open it with a crow bar. In my second room the cloth covering for the closet had been torn down and no one had bothered to replace it. Caulking was cracking and pealing around the room. There were hairs around the room that wer not mine. The water in the shower dribbled out....I could go on, but you get the idea.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: dneiman47
Reviews.Content: For the past year I've always stayed at the Time when I'm in new york. The convienient mid town location, steps from the A-C-E from JFK, Times Square just down the street, but not right outside your door, and a lot to eat and drink on 8th ave. Plus the hotel bar is very chill. you can drink a beer and get some work done all at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sweetebear345
Reviews.Content: Great Location...close to everything. All the staff was really friendly and the room was comfortable as we did not spend much time there. I will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY AT THE HEART OF NEW YORK”
Reviews.Author: solomou_eva
Reviews.Content: Great choice for someone who visits N. York for the first time because it is located at the heart of Broadway, subway station nearby, big choice of restaurants at walking distance, ideal as a starting point to explore the city. Comfortable, clean and warm rooms (some problems with the heating system were solved quickly) Very helpful personnel at the reception -even helped us book tickets at a jazz club Didn't have breakfast in the hotel - the extra cost was one reason...- so don't have an opinion

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: kar086
Reviews.Content: i booked in here with my partner & friend. we booked a one bed suite as there was the 3 of us & thought we would have plenty of room, but this was not the case!!! the bedroom part was nice & the room would have been acceptable for 2 people but wit all our luggage it was far too small.the hotel did offer us another suite for the next night but it was the same size in Sq Ft but had king size bed. the bed was not the issue!!! To open out the sofa bed we needed to take the coffee table out of the room & put it in the bedroom. the bed when opened out was wedged up to the desk & fridge which meant that we could use neither!!! the carpet in this room was very grubby and the mirror covered in dust!!! also our safe was not working! granted we stayed here at a busy time of year, the queues for the lifts were crazy & there was no order with a lot of pushing & shoving!!! i know this was down to the guests themselves but my experience was not the best. be warned that this hotel take a $100 dollar deposit per night you are there off your credit card. this was not explained to me at time of booking so that was a lot out of my shopping budget(ha ha) . We arrived at this hotel at 2.50 but we were not allowed check in till the official time of 3.30!! i know the room may not have been ready but it meant waiting around & there seemed to be no flexibility that we could have checked in before that time even if there was a room ready!! On a plus the doorman that welcomed us downstairs was very friendly ( i cant remember his name). The bed was very comfortable for the one night we stayed. we were due to stay 6 nights but checked out after 1st night because we just were so unhappy overall!! really put a dampner on the beginning of our holidays!! Unfortunately i would not be recommending this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “The Tim was a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: PamelaHelen
Reviews.Content: I love hotels, especially boutique hotels, and I think I'm a bit fussy about things being really nice, but I must be less fussy that some of my dear traving colleagues here on Tripadvisor. I too read the mixed reviews, and set me excpectations accordingly, thinking we were talking a bit of a chance but had an amazing rate from Priceline. Our expectations were exceeded at every turn. Yes, the location is fantastic. But the hotel did not disappoint in any way! You walk into the ground floor next to a darling restaurant which is part of the hotel and take a cool elevator to the second floor to check in. The reception staff was warm, funny and welcoming. We were upgraded to a suite, which was just great -- made us wish it was longer than a one night stay! Our room was clean, the carpet looked great. Though not high end, the furniture was tasteful, clean, comfortable, modern. Our king bed had a fabulous red coverlet and upholstered to the ceiling headboard to match. Mmmm. We had a minibar fridge that had room for our stuff. Bed and pillows were great. And they do this window treatment that is difficult to describe but so lovely. OK, let's discuss the bar. We were out late, came in for a nightcap. The music was loud, the lighting was dim, the cocktails were a perfect nightcap. The feel was very sexy, and we had a great time. Asked for a late checkout, no problem at all,and they stored our luggage until our matinee got out. Miguel even helped me walk our stuff across the street in the freezing cold! Yes, by the way, there's a parking garage right across the street with a nice discount. Any downsides? I love when hotels have complimentary lobby coffee, and The Time does not, though the restaurant was happy to accomodate, and there's a Starbucks half a block away. All in all, a delightful stay. The Time is on our list for future stays!

Reviews.Title: “It's TIME to make some serious changes”
Reviews.Author: lanie1000
Reviews.Content: I checked in for a 2 night stay and it started off well. The front desk informed me I was upgraded to a nicer room. As soon as I walked in and put my bags down, I shuddered to imagine what my original room must've looked like. There were empty bottles of cheap wine from the mini fridge around my room. After calling to complain, they assured me I wouldn't be charged for the bottles, but didn't send anyone up to clean my room. There were vomit stains on the sofa, the room smelled like stale cigarette smoke, and the lamps and light switches were either cracked or completely not functional. When it came time to check out, sure enough I was charged for the wine bottles and a slew of other items I never took. Although they promptly removed the charges, there will have to be a LOT of changes made before I consider The Time again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Not Bad - Not Great, either.”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTraveler4
Reviews.Content: I bid on Priceline for a 3.5 Star Hotel in the Times Square/Broadway Hotel and "won" The Time for a very reasonable NYC rate. I did, however, upgrade the room to a suite once I realized how small the rooms were, as I was traveling with two teenagers. So I ended up paying $200/night + tax, etc. The suite was two separate rooms, with the pull out sofa bed only being suitable for my 14-year old son, who could sleep on anything, really. But, with the suite, you couldn't complain about the size of the room in NYC. POSITIVES: * Location, Location, Location - stayed on 10th floor. Very cozy and warm as we were in NYC for the 5th largest blizzard in NYC history! Amazing! With this location, weather didn't stop us from doing anything - just walked out the door with easy access to everything! * Kind of hip -- but drab for sure. Since I was only traveling with my two teens (and this was their first NYC experience) they loved it, therefore I loved it. NEGATIVES: * If you are used to more service, attention or standard hotel amenities - than you might want to pick the Hilton or the Marriett. If you can get a low rate, I would absolutely recommend The Time -- in fact, I would go back, simply for the location. If you pay a premium price, than I would suggest getting a little more for your money at a mainstream hotel. Use WI-FI in the lobby because they will charge your $10.60 to log on for 24 hours/per computer in your room Bottom line, we spent maybe 5-6 hours a day in the room -- it was easy to drop off packages, get warmed up, put on dry clothes and head back out to the most amazing city in the world. For that, we will always have good memories of The Time. Easy access to all Broadway Shows (Chicago is right across the street), Times Square and TKTS booth for discount show tickets. We used CitySights Tour busses to "hop on, hop off" which was awesome, even though we got snowed out the second day. Bottom line -- if The TIme can help you stay in budget for your trip, you will be very satisfied. If budget it not an issue, pick something more updated in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel let down worst reception staff experience in USA”
Reviews.Author: Oz_Roscoe94
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at The Time in late November 2010 after booking it on-line directly via the hotel's website at a very reasonable rate. Check-in and door staff were friendly upon arrival however we experienced various problems upon getting to our room including blocked toilet, in-room safe locked closed, no plug for bathroom sink, all compounded by the in-room telephone not working so we had to go back down to reception to report these issues (the hotel only has two lifts so this can be quite a slow process). To be fair to the hotel, the maintenance man quickly attended to each of these problems but the fact remains that they should not arise in the first place at a 4 star hotel. Any remaining positive sentiment we may have had towards this hotel was totally destroyed on the third morning when we awoke to find the carpet in our room soaking wet. I travel extensively for both work and leisure and never before or since have I experienced a situation where the hotel staff have comprehensively turned what was clearly the hotel's problem into the guest's problem. Upon reporting the problem, the maintenance man came to our room to inspect the problem - recognising that we had also had all the other problems on the first day, he was apologetic and advised that he would speak to reception and arrange for us to be moved to a new room. This was where the problems started as reception did not call us then when I went downstairs to find out what was happening they made out it was our problem and we shouldn't have expected them to call us. They then told us we had to pack up our room ourselves and bring all our belongings down to reception and we would be allocated a new room later in the day once one became available without a hint of an apology for the situation which ended up wasting a couple of hours of our holiday (who wants to repack all their bags mid way through a week long stay?) nor an offer for the hotel to move our bags for us or do anything else they could to minimise the inconvenience. I was absolutely dumbfounded by the treatment we received here - in all my travels in the USA I have always found the customer service to be the best in the world, however the service we received from the girl on reception that day was comprehensively the worst customer service experience I have ever had. I should note that when we were ultimately allocated a new room, we were upgraded to a suite but that was only after we had earlier spoken to the Duty Manager about our dissatisfaction with the relevant staff member. In the interests of balance, I note that the hotel was in a good location very close to Times Square and we had no issues with street noise in our 9th or 11th floor rooms, nor could we hear any noise from the on-site bar on the reception level which was very loud on Fri/Sat night. The housekeeping staff were also very friendly. As others have noted, the standard rooms are relatively small but I was expecting that in NYC. It would be helpful if the hotel had some accurate photos of the bathrooms on their website - whilst they are adequate for their purpose they are quite small and the shower cleanliness/condition reflects that it seems to have been a few years since the last refurb. The hotel also has free wi-fi on the reception level which is great although would obviously be better if this was extended to the rooms. Overall, I would have been happy to recommend this hotel on the basis of value for money and location but the chance of having to deal with the most unhelpful staff member in the world and the myriad of similar alternatives available in NYC means I would recommend looking elsewhere before staying at The Time.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty little W wantabe”
Reviews.Author: Tmill32
Reviews.Content: The tiny poorly maintained room would have been tolerable if not for the endless clanking noise of the heating system which sounded like 300 blacksmiths were working their way up to our room. The decor was pretentious and shabby at the same time. I particularly enjoyed how the shower door didn't close fully and the water poured into the bathroom floor. If you are hungry for a late night snack, 10:30pm, there is a Sabarro's up the street since their rude host recommended since they ran out of food!!!!

Reviews.Title: “When you need a little extra help...”
Reviews.Author: Marianne64_10
Reviews.Content: Four girlfriends from Norway had been looking foreward to a New York weekend in april. We arrived on the very day of the Icelandic volcano outbreak, and the weekend ended up being 13 days! During this time, one of us also was in the need of emergency medical care. We stayed at the Time Hotel, which is located right in the middle of everything. We first got two tiny rooms, but on request, we quickly were given two nice and comfortable rooms. During the entire stay the hotel staff was helping out in every possible way. This service made "the little extra" for the four of us these fantastic NYC-days :) If you dont need a big expencive hotel, and you want to stay right there at Time Square/Broadway district, with a sweet and caring staff, Time Hotel is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: KristyFin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. The room was small, but you don't really need a huge room when there is just the two of you... it's only to sleep in really!! The location was fantastic! 1 minute walk to Times Square!! I've heard people say they would never stay near Times Square because of the noise. I didn't find the noise too bad, and nothing a pair of ear plugs wouldn't solve!! The room was clean and the staff friendly. I think the concierge service could have been a bit better though and that bar room that is on level 2 had private functions on both nights we had wanted to go there, which I wasn't very happy about! We were paying guests after all! Despite any negative I have, the positives far outweigh them!!! Although one MAJOR negative was having to pay extra for Wi-Fi! Considering there were places all throughout New York that gave FREE internet, and the bar in level two provides free internet, to be charged in your room is ridiculous in this day and age!!

Reviews.Title: “The best location in town”
Reviews.Author: Travelerspainlavila
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located. The rooms are small and little clean. the personal very good and very polite.I'd recommend the hotel to my friends

Reviews.Title: “The Time in Red”
Reviews.Author: lvanwin
Reviews.Content: This was my first time planning out hotel accommodations for a NY trip, and I was pretty pleased with how everything turned out. The hotel is conveniently located near subway stops and Time Square. Had a little bit of trouble with the check-process b/c both of my cards were declined. The couple next to us also had their card declined, so it seemed as though it was their machines that were having difficulty, not our cards. Everything eventually got sorted out though. When we got to the room, it was pretty much what I expected from previously viewing others' photos on tripadvisor. We got a red room, which seemed relatively clean. Yes, it wasn't the biggest room I've ever stayed in, but considering it is Manhattan AND close to Time Square, that didn't bother me in the least bit. There was enough room for it to be easy and comfortable. Our room's windows faced the street, but I wasn't annoyed by outside noise. On the other hand, the room next to us seemed to be housing around 5 guys who enjoyed partying until 4am. Everything was eventually handled professionally by the staff. If I had to nitpick, the only other thing that wasn't A+ was the television. Although it was a nice big flatscreen, the cable wasn't the best and the remote gave us all sorts of trouble. Not a big deal though...I wasn't about to cry over poor reception... All in all, I would recommend this to others and would enjoy staying at The Time for other future visits. Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the total package for our vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Crystal005
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay at the Time was a very pleasant experience. After experiencing weather related flight delays and a 6 hour layover, we were exhausted upon our arrival. Nonetheless, we were greeted on the street when our shuttle arrived by the doorman, Miguel and another staff member, Chris. They ushered us in and we were checked in at the reception desk and in our room within minutes. The receptionist was very pleasant and gave us an immediate room upgrade as well. Everyone was friendly and pleasant during our entire stay. The room was clean and the bed slept like a dream! The location is great for whatever you plan to do in Manhattan situated near lots of great restaurants at all price ranges. My favorite was the Sosa Borella just around the corner. We needed an extra hour beyond the check out time and once again, that was no problem! I can't say enough good about this hotel and it's staff. Will defintely go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: mbrinton80
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at The Time for three nights during a leg of our trip back east. We booked through our travel agent and had told her what we were willing to spend to stay directly in Manhattan. We were so pleased when she found this little gem that was well under our budget! When we arrived at Penn Station we decided to take a cab since we had heavy packs and really had no clue where we were going. We were greeted straight away and checked in quickly. We stayed in a room with one bed and I'll admit, I was surprised by how tiny the room was. But this is New York and I'm told all rooms are small! We still weren't sure of our surroundings so the biggest and best surprise came when we walked less than 100 yards and ended up in the heart Times Square. My sister and I were giddy with excitement! We had such an amazing time in New York and a this hotel was a big part of it. It puts you right in the middle of everything. And despite being in the middle of everything, our room was so, so quiet! The bed was also the most comfortable one we'd come across on our whole trip! The only qualm I can think of is that the bathroom seemed a little dated and worn. The toilet was a little unstable. But it was a very small issue for us! This will be the only place I stay when I come to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: athomas33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Time Hotel recently and had a great stay. The staff was courteous and welcoming. The hotel has a great location and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: jd_three
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC frequently for short stays and finding a decent hotel at a reasonable cost can be tricky. After reading reviews of The Time and seeing how concerned the hotel's management was with ensuring their level of quality I decided to give it a try. I cannot say enough great things about the room, the ambience, or the location. Excellent all the way around. I will be back anytime I'm staying in the city.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: FelipeeKika
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Great localization Thanks to Howard from the reception, very helpful, respectful. The other guys should learn with him. Internet is an absurd to charge in the room. Nowadays this is a default for hotels like this.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pardesi007
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was pretty chic; however, the room did remind me slightly of a dorm room since the fixtures were a little cheap. For example, in the bathroom some of the items, like the trashcan, looked as if they came from Ikea. Also, the toilet kept on running so I had to manually make it stop every time. In the evening, they had an attendant go to each room to ask if you wanted something from the minibar (this was confusing since there was a minibar in the room). At 3AM I was woken up to a huge newspaper being thrown directly at my door. When I returned to pick up my checked luggage after my meeting, the lobby was filled with guests doing the same thing with only one bellman helping. I had to be really aggressive just to get my luggage out of their closet myself since I had a taxi waiting for me with the meter on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Fair Price! Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: AmyMiller1104
Reviews.Content: I wanted to let anyone know that The Time Hotel is a great place to stay if you are contemplating a trip to NYC any time soon. It is located right down in the Time Square neighborhood. Walking distance to everything. The rooms are really cool. The pricing is fair. But the best part are the friendly and helpful and hospitable staff. They are there to help make your stay at The Time Hotel memorable and great and that is just what they do.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location has everything you need”
Reviews.Author: sandygemail
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the time hotel. It was clean and employees were very helpful. And i love the thought of having resturant in the hotel which was open till midnight which you cant always find.The location was perfect, right in the middle of resturant row. Near all theaters and right around the corner from times square..everything need is right there and i highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: whensmyvacation
Reviews.Content: I just left this hotel. I would highly recommend giving this hotel a fair chance. Its in am excellent location if your driving in from the south. The staff is extremely friendly, the hotel is very clear with an upscale feel. The room I had was small but perfect. Since this was my first actual stay in the city I was Leary of the different hotels. I will def make this hotel my first option during my next stay. The doorman greeted us as we walked up offering to help with bags. Helped us find our way to the lobby and pointing out possible "need to knows" about the hotel. Checking in was a breeze, staff was great and willing to offer advice. The room had a small but comfortable feel upon entrance. The nice LCD TV, Bose radio and SUPER COMFORTABLE bed made up for the small feel. Across the street is a parking garage. These guys were def alot of help as well. Highly recommend giving them a shot if you're driving in.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, excellent staff, clean but a little worse for wear.”
Reviews.Author: leelaloo
Reviews.Content: We stayed four 4 nights in October. Our room was small, but quiet and the beds were very comfortable. NO bed bugs! We were in room 502 and there was NO noise at all from the street or the hall or other rooms. The room was clean, but a few things were tired looking- bathroom tiles, stain on carpets. The light was out around the window. There was no view as the room looks out onto an inner courtyard so it makes the room a little dark.The ironing board was broken, but replaced immediately by staff when I requested another one. When we requested extra pillows the staff accommodated us immediately. Overall an enjoyable stay if you don't mind a small room, which is typical in NY. Modern design, excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a so-so boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cup-O-noodles
Reviews.Content: Typical NYC smaller rooms prompted me to upgrade to a suite. The hotel is contemporary in decor, but carpet & furniture starting to show wear & tear. The celing in my bathroom was leaking from bathroom above. Also the drain in an otherwise large bathtub, was not draining effectively. Fold out couch was awful and uncomfortable, while bed was very cozy. No bed bugs! Bar open till 4am on premises, and garage parking located conveniently across the hotel was great... Not to mention that Time Square is a walk down street. Good place to stay a night or two, but definitely not for a length in time.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, enjoyed the room and the staff”
Reviews.Author: Se7en_1046
Reviews.Content: I had to be in Manhattan for business. It was a last minute trip and I was not looking forward to it at all. I was pleasantly surprised to walk into this boutique hotel in the heart of NYC. The staff was friendly, accomodating and very informative. I had the distinct pleasure of meeting with and speaking to Charlie Katz, the front office manager. Mr Katz was professional and courteous. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great boutique hotel in an ideal location of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price for the location”
Reviews.Author: sdiggy
Reviews.Content: The staff was very pleasent. The problem was the room. It was small, not designed well and noisy. The room was on the 9th floor and we heard and felt like street level. Every traffic sound was as if we were on the street. The lobby was sound proofbut not the room. We also had an issue with the small flat screen in our room that was never fixed even after we reported it before going to the theater. Bathroom was very small with the only full size mirror on the inside of the door. You had to sit on the sink to view the full size mirror. Very dissappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Only for tourists”
Reviews.Author: felixgeorge
Reviews.Content: Pushed on me by my corporate travel agency. Fine for first time NYC tourists I guess, Times Square Hell for anyone else. Rooms good size, coherent design but detail and finish especially bathroom lacking its overblown aspirations. Restaurant geared to showtime sprints and one time visitors with lack of attention to detail and personal interest in guests, which agian I suppose is fair enough for the location. overall, you wished you had stayed in the refreshed Paramount 2 blocks down regardless of the price or who was paying!. must try much harder to CARE.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: clarefd
Reviews.Content: I found The Time through Hotwire, looking for a room for a one night stay - treating myself to a show after an all day meeting. I couldn't have been happier - the location is amazing, the front desk staff was polite and efficient (and upgraded my room), the small room is well-designed with lots of adjustable lighting (that was a VERY nice feature), bathrobes and a big flat screened TV. Plus I opened my door to find The New York Times in the morning. It was comfortable, friendly - amazingly quiet and clean. I would highly recommend it for anyone who wants a theater district location without a lot of fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: KCRentz
Reviews.Content: PROS You don't go on vacation -to NYC to stay in the room, or at least we didn't. We had a King room that was the middle it seemed not the basic not the suite and it was still small but adequate. What we loved most was the location we were steps from being in the heart of Times square. Our room had a view of Chicago theater. We loved the egg shells below the elevator and the hotel restaurant Serafina was great we ate there twice on our week stay at the hotel. CONS Our week stay was over Valentines and we had to go the desk to get anything we were lacking but the hotel itself was full, the staff were preoccupied it seemed but we are not high maintenance guests, fortunately, and enjoyed our stay. The elevators were realllly SLOW! My husband is 6'2 and his feet literally were off the bed in the first room and they said it was a queen but felt like a double, then we moved to a KING room which was better. Overall would recommend to young people or maybe couples with only one child since the rooms are so small! Great location. Clean rooms. Modern.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, pleasant and charming”
Reviews.Author: rbswen
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel attractive and welcoming. The location was great for our stay in New York - Mid Town Midhattan is very accessible from the Time Hotel. The staff was very friendly and the room was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “If I had paid, I would have been severely disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: MyDime
Reviews.Content: I don't have much good to say about this hotel. The check-in was a mini drama session with one staff pregnant staff person who was so focused on her taking time off that we were obviously NOT her priority. The 2 elevators are sloooowwww. The room is tiny and worn. The mattresses were yellow. The TV volume was erratic, sometimes too loud, sometimes too soft. There was no dresser. You have a tiny closet with 10 hangers to store your clothes. The bathroom was just as tiny. The shower temp was hot and hotter. The toilet handle would stick and the water would run unless you unstuck it. The exhaust fan barely works but made plenty of noise. There was mildew in the caulk around the shower and the sink. They advertise turn down service, but there was none. They never came to clean the room or change the towels. The restaurant downstairs was condemned by the health department. Internet was not free. But my stay was free, so I shouldn't complain, right? Next time I'm going back to the Westin on 42nd.

Reviews.Title: “THE TIME IS ALL YOU NEED IN NYC”
Reviews.Author: sophs_w
Reviews.Content: We arrived in New York and our hotel we booked on the internet was discusting! We decided to change hotels for a few extra bucks (totally worth while). Myself and partner loved the time hote. It has everything you need. Perfect location! After long sightseeing days i can honestly say i was happy to be staying here. We had no problem with THE TIME. They have cute little bar downstairs. We even saw Keanu Reeves wining and dining there. Would defintly stay at the time again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at The Time Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anafeliciano
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Time Hotel was very good! The room was comfortable, clean, modern and very well organized. The view from our room was not that spectacular but we did not go to NYC to stay in our room! The bathroom was very roomy but I felt that the shower area was very dark. We would hear doors slamming through the night which woke us up from time to time, which was not great! Overall the hotel was good! The best part of the hotel was the location! Location is everything when you are staying in NYC, a few steps and you are right in the action. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good NY hotel, top location, nice room, great service”
Reviews.Author: irishwife1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel, which was recommended to us by friends. We had booked a family room with two double beds but when checking in we were offered an upgrade to a suite, room 606, for the same price. This room was well equipped, with a fold out bed for the children in the tv-room. This fold-out bed was fine for the kids, but would not be so comfortable for one adult, let alone 2 adults. Our kingsize bed was very comfortable indeed. Despite the location in the theatre district, we were not disturbed by any noises. The staff at this hotel is extremely friendlyl. In particular the bellboys and doormen are very helpful, not only with the luggage but also calling for cabs, helping out with the amenities in the suite, etc. The one thing that surprised us a bit: they charge $10 for 24-hr wireless internet, per laptop! A very pleasant hotel, we will certainly be back here. Oh, and if you do stay here: the hotel recommended a diner around the corner, which you must visit. Olympic Diner between 48th & 49th and 8t Ave. Very good!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: spykitten
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights last summer. It is close to Times Square, subway, etc. My room was TINY, which I did not really mind other than when it comes to the shower. It was a corner shower (triangular shape) with a shower curtain that was TOUCHING ME AT ALL TIMES because it was so tiny. EWWWWWWWWW. Out the window I could see brick walls and other windows of the hotel. I don't like that claustrophobic feeling. But at least the place was acceptably clean and most employees were alright. I found the cleaning staff to be intrusive. Like they were often in my room when I wanted to be in there. I think in most places they'd leave and come back later.

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Joe M
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at the Time for business on-and-off for the last 8-9 years. When I need to be near Times Square, this is only place I stay. The location is ideal because you have 8th Avenue access and can maneuver away from the tourist mess around 7th/Broadway. Since I'm there to work...this is a big plus for me, while still being accessible. Great staff and clean, comfortable accommodations...a great boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Luxorous stay”
Reviews.Author: hotelman55
Reviews.Content: The Time is an excellent establishment. The hotel is beautiful with a great location in NYC. The staff is extremely helpful and courteous. Very accommodating and clean hotel. I recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a nice hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Kashaia
Reviews.Content: We stood there for 3 nights when we were stranded for one week in New York because of the vulcano. Design. No window view at all (wall). Oldfashioned bathroom wich doesn't match the bedroom. Very unpleasant staff at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: DrLeeNJ
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with The Time Hotel. First, the location can't be beat. You are right in Times Square, within walking distance to theatres, comedy, jazz and restaurants. Second, great customer service. They offer parking across the street for $30, that is for 24 hours. They had our room ready early. They upgraded us. When they heard it was my wife's birthday, they gave us breakfast vouchers AND send up a bottle of wine to the room. When we needed help choosing a place for coffee and desert, they came to our room with recommendations written down. The room is very clean and nicely decorated. Betty was at the front dest, she is wonderful;. We would go back if visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel in New York City”
Reviews.Author: ladyastrosfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed a Friday & Saturday night at the Time Hotel. What a great place to stay in New York City! The rooms were nice, clean and spacious for New York City. Great TV also. The staff was friendly and very accomodating. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to New York City and hope to be able to stay there again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Small Conveniently Placed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: banbarian
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 night stay at this hotel, and it was conveniently placed to be able to walk anywhere in New York - we never used a taxi during our whole stay and only used the subway once. You walk around the corner and you are right in the heart of Times Square and the Theatre district, loads of Restaurants around, Central Park is no more than a 10 minute walk away and if you're up for a good walk, its easy and safe to walk even as far as Battery Park to see the Statue of Liberty. The rooms are very small and there were no Molton Brown Toiletries but that didn't spoil our stay - the bed was very comfortable with a huge TV at the end of it - there isn't much place to hang stuff so I suspect most people only stay 2-3 nights but the room is smart clean and has a contemporary theme so all in all very nice. What could they do better? Free wireless would be nice! Its available but its expensive. One tip though there is an Italian Restaurant next to the hotel you will be grabbed by the very affable gentleman who will entice you downstairs to the "authentic" Italian its very much a tourist trap and you will be automatically charged a service charge for bread, linen and toilets of all things! They also expect a tip! So buyer beware! (the Italian Restaurant in Hotel Lobby called Serafina is excellent)

Reviews.Title: “The three Cs...comfortable, contemporary and clean”
Reviews.Author: Londoncameraman
Reviews.Content: I'm a cameraman and I stay here whenever I shoot in NYC. With long days I just want a comfortable, contemporary relaxed stay. I've never had a problem and always sleep very well at The Time. The location is very central which is great as my shoots vary all over Manhattan, and the staff are always very helpful if I need to shift my lights or cameras.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: sbwindup
Reviews.Content: I was booked here for business travel. I was pleasantly surprised at how clean and well kept the Time Hotel was. I didn't have to travel far, being that The Time is located in the heart of Time Square. I walked to where I needed to go, and they even have a great bar on the 2nd Fl., so I didn't have to do much searching for a good lounge in the area. The GM - Kanvar Singh was particularly helpful in making my stay very comfortable. Thanks Time! We shall meet again. Regards, Mark

Reviews.Title: “...And they Celebrated with Me!”
Reviews.Author: Star2Shine
Reviews.Content: Traveling can be an adventure regardless of your choice destination. My boyfriend and I were thrilled to visit the Big Apple last week; unfortunately I can't say so for my luggage. As I spent the first 2 nights of our vacation without a change of clothes or makeup hotel staff at the Time Hotel was kind enough to understand and accommodate my needs. The friendly service was worth more (by far) than the esthetically calming atmosphere. Sure, it is a beautiful hotel, but remembering my name, suggesting local stores with great sales and celebrating with me when my luggage arrive made me want to stay longer. I will always go back when I am in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Awesome Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: I_love_pink_82
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend Surprised me with a Trip to NYC for my Birthday, and he honestly could not have picked a NICER Hotel. It is very Boutique -esque, chic and of Quality. I loved the decor of the Lobby and lounge. The customer service was impecible and the Location is Prime. I will Definitely recommend this hotel to all of my friends and family. You definitely will not be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for NYC sightseeing and shopping”
Reviews.Author: CMC777
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel to have as a base while you shop til you drop or take in the sights or a show. Perfectly located in the centre of the Broadway & Times Squaret and a walk to the main shopping or central park. The hotel staff are excellent and friendly. Don't expect much space in your room however. They are contemporary but small and if you have a lot of shopping to do or going to spend time in the hotel upgrade to their suite (which is about double the size, for a small supplement of about 40$). On the ground floor Serafino restaurant is good for dinner and as a hotel guest you will get a 10% discount.. Eateries are everywhere and you can get a good breakfast or lunch five minutes away in Pigalles or Juniors..

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in the Heart of the Theater District!!!”
Reviews.Author: jw0475
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good as far as convenience, location and decor. The rooms - as are all rooms in Manhattan - are very small but well laid out. The bathroom was clean, the bed was comfortable and - since I told them it was our anniversary - they sent up a complimentary bottle of wine!! Nice touch!! The only negative to us was that there were a few interruptions during our stay. First the gentleman who brought the wine knocked while we were taking a nap. We didn't hear him so he let himself in. A little creepy! But the wine helped. Second, on the morning of our departure, I was coming out of the shower and the cleaning lady just let herself in to start cleaning. We hadn't even checked out yet!!! Other than that the hotel was great and we had a great weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Time's location is just the best for the Theatre District”
Reviews.Author: voyager_b
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Time four times over the years since it opened and I will return. Although the size of room is pot-luck and you can be hemmed in if you need to sit at the small table to do some paperwork the bed is King Sized and comfortable. Space is at a premium and the post-modern decor sees no need to allow much space at all for a suitcase of clothes but I guess most ravelers are passing through and in no need of home comforts. There is no coffe/tea making facilities but there is a really good restaurant on the ground floor which offers 10% off to guests. I have eaten there several times and not been disappointed. There is a bar on the second floor and it seems to hop every night of the week. Try for a high floor. The staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay - Great Room and Location”
Reviews.Author: Minh_Cao
Reviews.Content: We just came back fro a 12 night stay at the Time in NYC and the overal experience was wonderful. The room was clear, comfortable and location was fantatsic.Definately wl be back.

Reviews.Title: “Stale hotel despite the good location”
Reviews.Author: nymelin1
Reviews.Content: I booked the Time Hotel because of the decent rate and great location, however, I found out quickly you get what you pay for. The rooms in this once hot boutique hotel are dingy and need work, and I questioned the cleanliness. The first room I was given did not have working air conditioning, so they finally allowed me to switch rooms, but the new room did not have a safe (which they eventually fixed) and again the air conditioning wasnt working and maintenance had no solutions. I slept with my window open for air flow, but it was incredibly loud, which is typical for the area. Nobody followed up on the issue until checkout, when I was given a small credit. My advice: you can do much better and enjoy a hotel that is a bit more updated and clean, and where there is service where you feel like they care about any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveltx
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 days. Room is very nice, and very clean. Guest services are super friendly. Great location, which is very convenient. Walking distance to Times square, Broadway (radio city Music Hall), Rockefeller Center and just about most of the sites. You definately want to stay in the higher floors, because of street noise (this is NY after all). Staff was very curtious, polite, and very friendly. Room is typical NY size rooms (small), but then again you are not there to stay in the room. Not much of a view from the room though. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: proudestjayhawk
Reviews.Content: i was very excited for my first NYC boutique hotel experience at the Time. the location couldn't have been better, but that's about where the satisfaction ends. the hotel advertises ipod hook-ups for the stereo (a huge selling point for me as my girlfriend and i are heavy music listeners)-- they have one cable for the entire hotel. despite calling the desk to request it everyday, we never received it. the carpets were nasty dirty and stained. nasty. the hot water was inconsistent at best. staff were not at all helpful-- not rude, just very apathetic. wifi was $10 per day (!) for the money, i'd recommend staying in a chain hotel or another property...

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: BelleCC
Reviews.Content: really small rooms, over-hyped. although clever use of color themes within each room.

Reviews.Title: “Great last minute deal”
Reviews.Author: JBUDAI
Reviews.Content: I happened to get a great last minute rate, and chose this place since my friends were staying here, and the after-party for the show we were going to was also here. Their rooms were NYC small--though my friends had a larger suite) but since I was staying solo, it was plenty of room for me. Clean rooms, good staff, accommodating and friendly. The space they had the after-party in was wonderful, and the restaurant was very good also. I'm not a fan of mid-town as a rule, but I'd stay here again if I have an event where this location is the most practical.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok, because we got it cheap”
Reviews.Author: UsAussies
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through lastminute.com (who by the way were excellent to deal with when we needed to change dates). We got quite a cheap rate for a hotel in a fantastic location. The rooms were clean, although a little run down. One of the staff took a half hour to fix the tv remote, also the shower only let out a dribble of water which was a bit ridiculous. The housekeeping staff and the guy who fixed the remote were friendly, the front desk staff were blunt and abrupt which left much to be desired. Especially when we let them know about the shower so that they could have it fixed they didn't seem too interested. Then there is the silly minibar which works on a sensor, i.e. when to take something out of it, a sensor records the item and automatically puts it on the bill. We didn't take anything out of the minibar, but we got a statement under the door saying we owed $9 from the minibar. Turns out when the guy came to fix the remote, he moved the cabinet that the minibar was in, triggering the sensor inside. The agreed to not charge us for these. Then on our last night we get another statement under the door saying how much we owed for the accommodation. We had already prepaid because we booked it through lastminute.com. They said not to worry that it was a glitch in the system and that they have recorded in their system that we have already paid. A few days later at home, checking our credit card statement online, we find the hotel has charged us $507.00. What for? Apparently for accommodation that we had already paid for. We have called them and are still awaiting resolution of this. Oh and apparently this amount also includes $9 from the minibar. What a headache!

Reviews.Title: “Great clean hotel, Times square is around the corner”
Reviews.Author: hanachris
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel at a great price! Room was clean when we arrived, very welcoming staff. Very comfortable bed. The air conditioning can be very cold, we had to turn it off in the middle of the night because it just got too cold. The phone rang a few times early in the morning when we hadnt requested a wake up call which was rather annoying. They have a brilliant restaurant underneath which we ate at a number of time because the food was great and after a long day walking through the city we didnt want to go far for our evening meal and it was just perfect to have a restaurant downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky hotel + prime location”
Reviews.Author: drillbittaylor
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is amazing. you literally walk 50 feet down the street of this hotel and are in the heart of Times Square. The hotel itself is beautiful and the room is nice and clean. The plasma tv's in the room are also an added bonus to a great stay. Easy walk to Central Park and other great places.

Reviews.Title: “Location . . . but not much else!”
Reviews.Author: icemonkey4
Reviews.Content: We arrived to be greeted by a friendly receptionist who checked us in and promised us a bottle of wine as it was our honeymoon. Good start but it was all downhill from there. The room we got was ridiculously warm and the heating controls were broken. I phoned to complain and they said someone would be up to look at it. Half an hour later I phoned to complain again that no one had fixed it and we got moved. This room had heating controls but the rooms are still very warm and stuffy resulting in sleepless nights. Calling down to reception that night we were told the wine would be in our room when we returned from dinner. . . . Never happened! A couple of days into our trip our safe wouldn't open and we needed our passports. It took 3 hours and constant phonecalls to get it opened. Overall the rooms are below standard. Taps falling off walls, dirty stains, beds that have seen better days etc. The only real positive I have is the location, which is fab. But I would rather stay further out and have a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: bulty1978
Reviews.Content: We had heard so many bad things about hotels so close to Times Square but we found a true gem. The interior has obviously been renovated and is very comfortable, neat, clean and so close to all the action. The hotel has a beautiful Italian restaurant downstairs and a gorgeous lounge on the 2nd floor that was delightful. Our room was quite spacious, great large screen tv and robes were also supplied. The only criticism would be that the bathroom is very small, but still usable and there was only a very small closet space but these things were not bad and everything else made up for them anyway. I would definately stay here every time I visited NYC and would highly recommend it to anyone. Great stay, great location, great facilities, what more could you want!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Time”
Reviews.Author: lazygreenie
Reviews.Content: we ended up in this hotel because I hadn't booked enough nights in the hotel we intended to stay The Edison. We found The Time to be much better, the staff were lovely and helpful and noticed I was pregnant and said they would give us the first room that became available because we checked in early. The room was quite well sized, clean with a big TV and e enjoyed the breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the middle of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: roughout
Reviews.Content: This is not a large property but it offered a pleasant stay for a business/pleasure trip. Location is about as central as you can get, 49th St. between B'way and 8th Ave. A,C,E trains are a half block west and the Times Square Station is around the corner and south. You can take MTA from JFK into Manhattan, around the city and back to JFK without ever having to take a cab, if you're up to it. The room aren't spacious and I would have like to have a chair to sit in but the bed was comfortable and the sheets were clean. Bathroom was adequate and the towels are in decent condition. The restaurant, Serafina, was excellent for both breakfasts and dinner. Bonus is that you get 20% off as a hotel guest. It get s very busy before the shows but at 8 it can be an easy seat. You won't leave hungry. The staff is friendly by NY standards but sometimes can be a bit rough around the edges. Housekeepers are wonderful! They are almost invisible until you need something and couldn't be more accommodating when you do need them. The desk staff could use some warmth and the maintenance staff needs a fine tuning. Word of advice: the televisions in some rooms have a small box attached to the desk that is the receiver for the remote control. We didn't know what the box was for and couldn't figure out why the remote wasn't working even with new batteries. The less than friendly maintenance guy came up and in a very brusk manner admonished us for placing something in front of the mystery box. In broken English he stated; You place bottle in front of THIS! Well, maybe a small note in the room identifying the receiver would help in the future! Hello? Management? Are you listening? Overall, it was a great stay and we would consider The Time again. Thanks to all for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel; fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: travelpassion789
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the time this thanksgiving, and the Time was a great location to be in the action during the holiday season. It's probably even better if you're a tourist because Times Square, 5th Avenue and Central Park are all within walking distance. The 49th street subway is also a couple of blocks away so getting around is very easy. If you're a broadway lover its even better because all the theatres are right around (Chicago is right across the street, and Fela is next door). The room service is Serafina, so it's pricey but very good. The hotel is modern and rooms are small but comfortable, though the view isnt really something to write home about. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MIKIBOS
Reviews.Content: After weeks and weeks of searching for reasonably priced accomodation in a convenient location, this hotel was a like finding a diamond in the rough. Amazing location, around the corner from times square, walking distance to 5th Ave, close to several subways, my husband and I were able to walk to many NYC attractions from the hotel including Central Park. The staff were so friendly and helpful, and upgraded us to the second highest floor of the building because it was our first time to NYC (I never get upgrades!!) The rooms were small but adequate. I am very fussy when it comes to cleanliness esp in hotel rooms and this was up to my standards, I always felt comfortable & safe there, it just made our trip to NYC so enjoyable. This is not a hotel where they will carry your bags upstairs or overly fuss over you, its NOT the Waldorf, its a small sophisticated boutique hotel with excellent value for money considering the rubbish offered at other places for almost double the price. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, without the attitude.”
Reviews.Author: BHL
Reviews.Content: Had been wanting to try this hotel after hearing good things about it, so when I was able to get a great weekend rate I booked it. Normally I don't like to stay in the theatre district and be in the middle of the tourists, but I made the exception to check this place out. I arrived about three hours before check-in, just wanting to drop off my bag, but they had my room ready for me already. The booking website I used had made a mistake with my reservation, booking it in my guest's name and not mine, but Jessica at the front desk took care of that with no hassle. I had a red room, with a spacious king bed. Everything was spotless. I was missing a light fixture next to the bed, which I reported to the front desk, but it was not replaced during my stay. That was the only blip. Everyone was very friendly but professional from the minute I walked in the door, even introducing by name the doormen and concierge. I wasn't there much, but I didn't hear any noise from the hallway or other rooms on the sixth floor, which was a big plus. Upon check-in I'd been given an ad for buy one- get one at the hotel's Inc. lounge, so when we got back after a night out we relaxed there. It seemed to be a pretty happening spot and got very crowded as the night wore on, but the service was good and the drinks were strong. I would stay again if I could get another $187 rate like I did this time, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It's New York baby, location location location, you are going to be so busy....”
Reviews.Author: HelenRomeo
Reviews.Content: Well New York is Expensive with a capital E, we won this trip from Australia but paid for 6 nights extra Accommodation, lucky we got the Sony Music corporate rate! We just wanted something comfortable and clean, we went out site-seeing that big old city for 9 days and nights straight, getting home very late and out very early in the morning. There is so much to see you don't won't be in your room much at all. Rooms are small (it's New York deal with it), clean, neat, staff were great to us and we were especially treated well by the doormen who did not want us to tip them. The Time was perfect for us to come and go, it's a boutique Hotel so all the rooms are done up in blues, yellows and reds - RED is my fave colour and we got the RED room, it was perfect for what we needed. We played pool in the trendy bar on some late nights and we had booked action packed tours - New York is not a place to go to relax! Highly recommend you grab the 48 hour hop on hop off Double Decker and get yourself orientated, we then went on a Liberty Helicopter tour over Manhattan and started our 3 Day New York Pass which I also highly recommend, this had us running all over that fabulous city seeing everything you could see, it was wonderful to have express entry into everything, have individual maps and details in our little booklet/pass. Make sure you organise yourself in areas, so do all the downtown stuff in one day, then uptown, etc. We took a beautiful Winter horse and carriage ride thru' Central Park, it was so romantic. As I said we won this trip to see Kings Of Leon at Madison Square Garden in Jan 09 and won 3 nights acccommodation, Airfare & tickets as part of the prize, and knew you just can't do New York in 3 days.
