The food is fabulous, you need to search it out, there is some great street food, google before you go and you will find where the locals hidden gems are. Highly recommend Carmines in Times Square - my husband Romeo is Italian and this was recommended to us by Italian's we know, the service was impeccable and the prices were low and great quality food - ask for Ralph from Brooklyn to be your waiter ha ha, he was a tripper! The Time is all about location location location, it was perfect for us, everything was close by, the Subway, the Port Authority (we went on a brilliant shopping tour), entertainment, food, shopping - get your little souvenirs downtown, much cheaper! So much to say about New York! See the photos for the best coffee in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Gillz79
Reviews.Content: As 2 single girls travelling to New York for the first time The Time Hotel is an ideal location as literally on Times Square. The room was comfortable with air con/heating, TV and safe, only down was the wardrobe is basically a rail behine the door so for 2 girls storage was a bit tight. Rooms are cleaned everyday with clean towels, robes and sheets. The concierge and door staff were extremely friendly and helpful in pointing us in the right direction. On check-in we received a 20%off voucher for the Serefina restaurant where we enjoyed the most amazing burgers and also a buy one round, get a round free voucher for the lounge which was relaxing and classy with friendly bar staff. We felt completely save entering and leaving the hotel alone and at night and would recommend for any first time visitors wanting to enjoy all the sights of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price/quality”
Reviews.Author: floridafanLuxbg
Reviews.Content: Friendly professional staff, clean rooms - some are a bit small for 2 people, not enough hanging space - do not open windows when room is situated on street side - could be very loud as dumpster trucks show up at 4 AM to empty trash bins - takes about 30 min -during that time no sleep is possible. That is the only complaint I have about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, friendly staff, good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: WorkingSenior
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Time Hotel. It is right in the heart of the theatre district, modern, clean and well staffed. Our room was not huge (no couch, but there is a desk) but it was well designed, quiet (except for the street sounds from our fourth floor window), very comfortable bed, and had good air conditioning. The flat panel TV worked very well once I understood how to work the remote. The lobby is somewhat inconvenient, being located on the second floor, but the door men and bell staff are all first rate and very helpful. We especially enjoyed the on site restaurant, which offers a 20% discount to hotel guests. We had three breakfasts and one dinner there, enjoying them all. The prices are fair and the food and service are good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: davis0056
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located less then a block from Times Square. Our room was just a little bigger then a postage stamp with absolutely no view. But it was clean and recently remodeled. Our brother/sister-in-law had a much larger room with a view of the ship we were in town to take on a New England cruise. The attached resturant had a nice italian fare and good service at a reasonable (New York City) price. The front door staff were great, the reception staff were mediocre at best.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: israelmor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Time for 7 nights in the middle of October 2009. Arrived at the hotel around 8AM and they already had a room waiting for me, I was very surprised since this is not common in NY. Got a Deluxe room with one king bed in 14th floor, the room was very good, clean and had a very nice design. There was no noise at all and the staff was friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommed the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Time”
Reviews.Author: miknei
Reviews.Content: I again selected the Time for a special occasion b/c of the great price, great location (near Times Square, short walk from Penn Station) and fine amenities. This was our third time there. We had a king-size room, on a high floor and it was neat, clean, and cool/hip. The staff at the front desk was lovely and helpful. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient clean hotel in the heart of the Theater District”
Reviews.Author: GHBoy
Reviews.Content: Recently converted older building into a modern contemporary hotel, one block off of Times Square and the Broadway Theater District. Hotel was clean and comfortable, but rooms are small. Staff was friendly and helpful, the hotel had a modern looking restaurant and bar and the rooms were quiet. Would recommend as long as the price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Funky, good sized rooms but appaling service in the Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MeisterLondon
Reviews.Content: I arrived a round midnight on a Friday. The bar, which is probably one of the features of this hotel, was buzzing with Yuppies. Couldnt hear my own voice when I checked in! Never mind, it gave it a distinctively different feel to most 'corporate' hotels and thus I actually enjoyed it. Thats what I call boutique-hotel. Rooms are OK sized and in modern-ish decor. Stayed in a Kingsize room-big enough for one but if it would have been two of us I wouldnt be so sure. A little dated and could do with some updating, including a splash of fresh pain in places. Only tried the hotel breakast (Serafina Restaurant) once- for Sunday brunch. Quality certainly wasnt the best I have had but sufficient. However, service was below par despite being nearly empty and only a few lost souls in the morning. Simply put: Slow and it was impossible to get a smile on their faces - and I am not American!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and great location!”
Reviews.Author: NYinATL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Time Hotel in Manhattan for our anniversary trip in April. I found a great deal and couldn't pass up such a great location. Just around the corner from Times Square and major subway lines. We arrived and there was something wrong with their computer system so we had to wait to check in. This was the only major issue with our entire stay at the Time. The room was very spacious (we got a handicapped room) and clean. The decor was modern and my husband loved the flat screen TV on the wall. Overall, this was a GREAT location for such a great price. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: JeanneHardwick
Reviews.Content: As all the reviews show, you might get lucky and get an updated room that functions pretty well or you could get a dump of a room. The staff was friendly and helpful, but did not seem to know which rooms were the better rooms. We asked to see 4 rooms before making a decision. The room we were initially given was not updated, the bathroom smelled of mildew, was very small and the bed was so soft it practically sank to the floor. After seeing other rooms, we got a room that is more updated. But you still may have to ask for things - like a luggage rack, hair dryer. The AC did not work but was fixed within 24 hours after 3 calls to the front desk. So if you have some patience, this is a good value. The location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let style overtake substance”
Reviews.Author: Shruggy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while working in NYC for a few days and the location is ideal as I always prefer to be near Times Square. The bed was extremely comfy and the room larger than most in the city. However the restaurant and reception staff let it down. The doormen were beyond friendly and helpful - and not angling for a tip (rare in the US!). But their counterparts could learn a lesson. I got the wrong breakfast twice. After requesting oatmeal, it came out as an omlette then YOGHURT! I have a British accent and am not difficult to understand. When the bill came I requested the service charge be removed due to this mistake (and for waiting 30 mins to eat). No apology. The night previous the bar staff were lazy and unfriendly. The front desk claimed to be unable to print an email due to lack of toner. The same excuse given a day before to a colleague. Surely that should've been fixed in 24hrs? I would recommend this hotel for a good night's sleep and access to shopping but avoid the restaurant and bar

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: stutravel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of places in NYC and this place was pretty good in terms of value for money and location. We'd just managed to escape being ripped off at another place in Chelsea and managed to get a last minute booking at the TIME. We paid about US$220 including taxes and that's cheap compared to everything else we saw. Great location, the rooms are a reasonable size and clean and the decor is pleasant. Short walk to Times Square. The staff were generally pleasant although we encountered the most misberable bar girl in history. . It was the only place however where we had to pay for internet access which was one disappointment.We were very happy with the TIME Overall

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, funky decor and in the heart of Manhatten!”
Reviews.Author: yngholiday
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 3 night stay, just a couple of days before we arrived. Having stayed in a number of New York hotels now, I can highly recommend this to anyone looking for a clean and modern hotel in a great location. Our room was excellent, 2 big double comfy beds and lots of space. The decor is all black, red and white and very retro and extremely clean. The bathroom had no tub but did have a big double shower, nice robes and lovely smelling toiletries. The only thing we didn't have was a view, not that it bothered me at all, I'd rather have a spacious room. The service was great, they even brought us a card with the weather forecast for the next day which I thought was a nice touch. They stored our luggage for us no problem and ordered me a car back to the airport, everything you'd expect from one of the higher rated and more expensive hotels in the city. There is also a nice bar and restaurant in the building, both were busy with non-hotel guests and the drinks were good :-) Location is perfect for getting around the city too, right off Times Square and close to all the main attractions. Very little noise at night surprisingly for the location. All in all, a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel stinks”
Reviews.Author: rstde
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at this hotel in New York City. I go to New York often and normally stay at a different hotel but thought I would try something different this time. What a mistake. The Time is expensive $400 per night, the room had broken airconditioing that failed completely the last night, a bathroom that smelled like someone died in it, internet that drifted in and out making work impossible and a Tv remote that required the patience of a saint. This hotel was disappointing in every respect and uncomfortable in many. There are many hotels in this area. Choose any of them and you will be happier.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: queenhotcheapsuit
Reviews.Content: You cannot fault the location. It is close to everything and very convenient. The rooms are tiny but the bed is big and the bathroom clean. Staff are not very helpful. Check your bill on check-out. Door man was helpful and nice. An ok hotel but if you are claustrophobic this is probably not the place for you. Good bar.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller11111111
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Time for the second time. Normally I prefer the Sheratons around the corner or the Hudson in the Summer. Rooms are good, bed is comfortable and bathrooms are clean. For a NYC hotel, this is pretty good since it is difficult to find a hotel in that price category. Restaurant is nice, and their pretty bartenders know how to make cocktails!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: andipet
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite at the Time, for three adults and a 2.5-year old. The staff is down to earth, friendly, and readily eager to accommodate the client's wishes. The rooms offer a modern atmosphere and not a cookie cutter image of most hotels. The location is excellent: the Theater District, Times Square etc. The adjacent Serafina restaurant, serving the hotel's guests at 20% discount, is quite good. (A slight complaint: the extensible sofa that two of us had to use has a fairly thin mattress through which one could feel the metal frame.) What counts a great deal in this review, however, is the following experience: we had forgotten a pair of large gold earrings in the room, fact of which we only became aware a few days after we returned. We called the hotel, they said the earrings had been found and they FedEx-ed them to us, for a decent charge. Overall, the Time Hotel is a place to which we will definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE EMBARRASSMENT”
Reviews.Author: elevin
Reviews.Content: I organized a group of 7 people plus myself for a week long business trip. Having stayed at The Time several months ago and had a great experience, this time was horrible and embarassing for me, being the organizer. Everyone had room problems which included one or more of the following: - broken TVs - Air conditioning not working - No water pressure - shower heads leaking and spraying water all over the bathroom - Internet service issues (service down for 2 days) - some of the rooms are so small there's only 12" between the end of the bed and the wall The staff is generally nice, but not very competent. They're very young and seem rather "green" when it comes to hotel customer service. They want to help, but not really sure what to do. There's potential here, but the management needs to step in and the rooms all need serious maintenance work.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room”
Reviews.Author: sla1965
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel and had a decent room for the price, This time the room was awful. Very small (Stress very) old, chipped paint, bathroom was barely big enough for one, hot water took forever and the air conditioning made alot of noise. This time we got the hotel through hotwire, perhaps that was the reason they gave us such a horrific room. The entrance and bar very retro and cool but it is a real gamble to book a room here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: lovedintexas
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to New York City and we found The Time online and saw the good reviews it had. The location is great! Right across the street from the Chicago theater, around the corner from Times Square, and within walking distance of the subway, Rockefeller Center, etc. With that being said, our experience with the hotel was marginal, at best. Our room was very small and we had a double size bed! I didn't even know those were options in hotels anymore! There was paint peeling/chipping on the walls, the bathroom had mold on the ceiling, and the AC rattled and didn't actually cool the room off that much.,,much to our dismay in the 95* heat! Also, beware that on Saturday nights, the club downstairs gets very busy and the hotel staff seemed more interested in making sure those guests were taken care of than actual hotel guests. Overall, it's a good price for a great location...if you don't mind getting what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Will stay there whenever in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: PMello
Reviews.Content: Good surprise. Friendly staff. Modern room interior, 2 full HD 32" TVs, BOSE stereo!! Two articulated lamps for good reading at bed. Very nice. Close to theaters and restaurants. We stayed 5 nights e will surely return to it the next trip. Congratulations to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok - shame about the staff...”
Reviews.Author: andik7
Reviews.Content: First night of honeymoon - had been travelling for 22 hours straight. Arrived at 1am, having rung the hotel to warn them of late arrival due to to air delays. Receptionist ignored our presence for nearly 5 minutes whilst chatting on his mobile phone until I said 'excuse me' in a very direct manner. He informed us the hotel was full and that we would have to re-locate to another hotel in another area. We remonstrated about the number of months we had had this booked (6) and the response we got back was 'too bad'... My husband then informed him he had requested a bottle of champagne to be put in the room and, miraculously, the room became available... Had he not requested that bottle, we would have spent our first night of honeymoon wandering Time Square... The receptionist was discourteous and put us off staying here again. The room was nothing more than alright - glad we were only there for 3 nights. Great to be so close to Time Square and was excellent for travel around Manhatten.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again & again!!”
Reviews.Author: steph543
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. It was clean, safe & in a great location. My husband said he had the best breakfast in his life at the Serafina. Staff was freindle except the girl when we checked in. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I ever imagined!!”
Reviews.Author: Beckers_9
Reviews.Content: I really would recommend you to choose Time Hotel! The interior was beautiful, the rooms where much larger than I could imagine for a New York hotel. It made us quite comfortable. The room was cleaned, the bed was made up, the bath room was always delicious - every day. We had lovely bathrobes at our disposal, towels, iron, hair dryer, newspaper every day. TV was very well and so also the radio. The room service did efficiently serve us lovely food from the restaurant in the building. Everybody who worked at the hotel was very kind and serviceminded. Always with a nice hello to us. Always with a smile. And they had service for everything from carrying our luggage, ordering shuttle buses, booking of tickets to events. Our AC went down. An hour later we were installed in a new, fresh room. And the location, so nice to walk to so many spots we wanted to see: Times Sq, Rockefeller, Circle Line, Central Park, the Metro, ... We are SO satisfied! Best wishes from Norway

Reviews.Title: “great location but not very clean”
Reviews.Author: tal15
Reviews.Content: my family & stayed here on an overnight trip to new york! great location...very close to time square! the hotel though is not very clean. probably would not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, miniature rooms”
Reviews.Author: ipetkov
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is very good - one block from Times Square, but the rooms are too small even for Manhattan. You can't even hang you clothes as there is no wardrobe. The rooms are showing some wear and tear buy they are relatively clean. No issues with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, slow service”
Reviews.Author: binaworldone
Reviews.Content: The Time hotel was a great place to stay because I was travelling with a 14 year old and 2 smaller dogs. For the price, the size of the room was great. There were two TVs, effective AC, and a resto and bar right downstairs. I liked the hotel because even though it was upscale, it wasn't ridiculousy stuck up. The staff was really nice and the location was pretty central to eveything I needed. The only problem I had with the place was that service was really slow. When it came time to check out, we called for someone to come get our bags and they never came. Eventually one of us went downstairs to check out and ask for someone in person after 45 min of waiting. We had a similar problem with our breakfast. We had ordered it the night before to come at a certain time and they barely made the timeline. Some of the food was wrong ( ie wrong drinks) and when they had brought everything up, there was no butter for toast, no ketchup, salt, or sugar for coffee/tea, no jelly/ jam (all of which were items said to have come with the food.). And when we asked for the items, it took them another 30 min to bring them up. By then our food was cold and we were in a rush to leave so no one got to really enjoy their food - an this was an $80 breakfast ( for 3ppl)!

Reviews.Title: “Location and Friendly Service at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: confplr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a number of hotels in the Times Square area of NYC. Hands down The Time is the best deal. It is udated with bright and moderm decor and amenities. The staff is very friendly and professional. The rooms are slightly roomier than most in the same price range and fairly quiet. The one improvement I would suggest is more visible security features including elevators to guest floors that require guest room keys to operate.

Reviews.Title: “Pay a few bucks more and go elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: pprabs
Reviews.Content: Except for the location, there isn't one redeeming factor to The Time. My room had a "wonderful" view of two huge metal pipes right in front of the window. And the tiny sink in the bathroom was all but clogged still. Plus my AC broke at around 8:30pm causing the room to reach a sweltering 79.7 degrees - the service guy took one look at it and told me that he had to change the whole unit before it would work properly. I called the front desk to get a different room and was told that they were all sold out. After a few strong words on my part, miraculously an available room was located. Of course, there had to be something wrong with the new room too. Another "wonderful" view of a dirty brick wall a few feet away from the window, and a TV that didn't work. I was so tired by the end of the night, that a non-functioning TV was the least of my concerns. Another person in my party had a suite - the couch in the suite had visible shoe prints, as if someone had stood on the couch with shoes on and housekeeping neglected to dust off the prints. Definitely not acceptable. My advice to Trip Advisor visitors - pay $20 more and stay at The W nearby. The Time really isn't worth the minor amount of saving.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was at a Hostel!!!”
Reviews.Author: weddingplannersd
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Manhattan and this was a favorite spot of mine for drinks after work. Thought it would be fun to stay here for once and the room rate was ridiculously reasonable for NYC. That said, I arrived at midnight from a long day of flying and was first struck but the tiny elevators with dirty carpeting. Then the poorly lit hallway that still did not hide the dirty carpeting. Now for the ridiculous - which I guess is what you get for a low rate (Room 301): 1 - Room was so small it would make a Ian Schrager hotel feel like the Taj Mahal 2 - There were NO pillows on the bed after an obvious turn down service had occured. When I called the front desk about this, they challenged me as if it weren't possible 3 - The window overlooked another building that was 10 feet away offering no light at all (I never opened my window shades as there was another window from an office building that looked directly into my room) 4 - The bathroom sink faucet literally was not affixed to the porcelain sink! 5 - The shower was like standing under a hose....heat was fine, but the water did not spray just poured 6 - On my last morning, I ordered a pot of coffee and waited about a half hour before calling to find out where the coffee was. The coffee arrived 15 minutes later in a porcelain tea pot covered in Saran Wrap. This was not enough for even 2 cups and then by the time I got to second, it was lukewarm. This was a $ 9.21 charge!!! All I can say is, I would never stay there again even if it were free!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but noisy and small rooms, otherwise OK”
Reviews.Author: bibr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Time Hotel (49th and between Broadway and 8th) in July. The location is fantastic. Just half a block from the end of Time Square and in the center point of most of the theatres. The staff was quite friendly, although one of the concierges seemed very uninterested in helping us out, the rest of the staff (including the cleaning lady!) were very nice. We asked for help with getting to the airport, and the staff booked a shuttle for us. Very good! I recommend dining at the Serafina, the cafe/restaurant in the 1st floor, as this place provided a very good breakfast at an OK bargain (20% discount for those staying at the Hotel, ~$10 per person incl. bread, croissant, jam, fruit, juice and coffee. There was free internet in the rooms! Yup, completely free wireless lan. For those who haven't checked in there's even free internet in the 2nd floor lobby / bar. The rooms are noisy. This is really my only negative point. There's an air conditioning unit in each room, and this unit is very noisy. When it hits its high note (approx. every 20 minutes) it feels like you're in an airplane at cruise altitude. So for those who can't sleep in a noisy environment, stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: x3x3
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel thru priceline and stayed in a room on the 15th floor. Horrible is the simplest way to put it. The room is very small and not safe (electrical is not stable, faucet keeps dripping). It looks like the hotel added these rooms to give to priceline buyers with no regard to safety. This hotel should be rated zero stars

Reviews.Title: “Won't come back again”
Reviews.Author: travelling_kitten
Reviews.Content: The one saving grace of this hotel is that is very well situated, right on Times Square and close to all the Theaters; but the hotel's appearance and their service are bad. To begin with, there's the doorman who stood outside all day and night smoking and chatting with girls, not only he doesn't bother opening the door for you but he just stands there blocking it! I thought it was very rude and unprofessional. The next thing you find when you go to register on their mini reception area is that is across from their restaurant/bar. We arrived at night and the music was so loud we could barely hear a thing! not to mention that the bar crowd look a bit sketchy. The room was small and the bathroom even smaller! I mean tiny. The view was the back of other buildings but I guess it's NY and not everyone can get a view, I understand that. The bed was comfortable, but whoever cleaned the room before we got in didn't do a good job. There was garbage in the floor! First impression was terrible and I just didn't enjoyed the place the rest of our stay. I loved NY but I will never come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice hotel and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: MilleOslo
Reviews.Content: We were really satisfied with the hotel. Location is excellent, right off Times Square and close to subways. We expected a small room, but were pleasanty surprised of the room we received considering it is in NYC. Even with two suitcases each, it did not feel crowded. We did not receive the two separate beds we'd requested, but the King Size bed was fine. Service was excellent, when there was an error on my bill at checkout, they corrected it without any discussions. Luggage storage was reasonable and very hassle free. They also helped us to the best of their ability when our shuttle to the airport did not arrive as requested (due to a flat tire). Would definately stay here again if I would be able to get a good rate. Booked our stay through booking.com which did not charge my credit card until checkout which also is a plus compared to other sites (hotels.com for example).

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely come back here again”
Reviews.Author: LalanRobbie
Reviews.Content: This place was great aside from a little issue we had upon checking in. Apparently they "hold" money in case of incidentals on your credit card. Of this, we were not prior informed and didnt transfer sufficient funds before checking in. Our check-in was held up, as we had to go find an internet cafe to transfer money onto our card. Apart from that, the hotel was really nice. Our rooms were great. We were there for 8 nights. Only one day, housekeeping didnt clean our room, which we didnt even notice until the hotel wanted to compensate us, and had arranged breakfast at the restaurant downstairs, which was lovely. The rooms are small, but very neat and appear to be quite modern. The location of this place is fantastic. After reading the other reviews, we also seemed to have had the radio turned on every time we came back into the room. We loved it. The hotel was professional, provided the amenities we needed and was really nice to come back to at the end of a big day. BIG THUMBS UP FROM US!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: BORIN29
Reviews.Content: We travel to NYC at least twice a year, almost always staying at 4-5 star hotels. This is a four star hotel were housekeeping comes in your room at anytime, things come up missing and we also kept wondering why our radio station was changed every time we came back to our room. Also, when making the bed housekeeping left the pillows laying on the floor?! There are cameras everywhere, yet when we reported our missing items to the concierge, they indicated an investigation would be initiated and weâ€™re still waiting for a response. The toilet was constantly backed-up. My husband had to wash his hair with shower gel as toiletries were not replaced for our second night stay. At the bar, my husband was in romantic mode and gave me one of the flowers from the small vases. A few minutes later a bar tender rudely asked me were I got the flower from and asked me to return it! (I guess it was my husbandâ€™s fault for not purchasing one for me off the street!) An $18 charge for the lily (1) was in our bill and then taken off as a refund.) At check in staff indicated there would be a $100 hold in our card, but it actually was a $300 (which was no problem) but accurate information should have been provided. Shoppers Alert! If you come back with your hands full of bags, no doorman on call on Saturdays! The public restroom for the restaurant/ bar area did not have toilet or towel paper. Comment cards not available. Hotel manager informed of our list of complaints, however these were cordially disregarded. If you want to receive the service you deserve whether on business or pleasure stay at W, Intercontinental or even the Holiday Inn! There are lots of hotels within the area that would definitely live up to their star rating!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay at all”
Reviews.Author: PunjabiNo1
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried when I first read reviews of this hotel but it was recommended by a friend and I managed to find a good deal so taking the plunge, I booked the hotel. First of all, the hotel's location in W49th Street is excellent. I was able to walk to many places of interest and some of the further tourist attractions (the Museum Mile, Statue Of Liberty) were all simple subway rides away. Broadway is literally on the doorstep as is Times Square and there is a large chemist nearby which is also handy. The rooms as expected were quite small but were clean and had all you would need for a short city break (iron, hairdryer, nice towels). The bed was very comfortable (though I had to remove the bolster pillows to fit on the bed and I am only 5'9"!) and the shower is also very good, easy to operate and spacious. The staff were polite but more reactive than proactive. However, when it came down to it, they did help as much as they could and remained professional throughout. The only problems I had were with the Do Not Disturb sign which is a switch on the back of the peephole. I accidentally switched mine on (one thing to note - i was not shown up to my room by a concierge and had an embarrasing episode trying to locate the bathroom light switch which was behind the towel rail!) and as a result, my room was not cleaned and it was only when I asked the cleaner that this was explained to me so if you do stay here, be careful of that! There is a restaurant attached to the hotel which is pricey and not the biggest portions but is fine if you are tired or can't decide where to eat. However, for breakfast, I discovered a branch of the Magnolia Bakery on 6th Ave which was only a short walk away and for dinner, there was an excellent Thai restaurant on 46th called Yum Yum which had amazing food at a reasonable price. If this is your first time in New York, i wouldn't necessarily recommend this hotel - that's not say it is a bad hotel but for a first trip, i think it can be quite overwhelming. However, if you have been New York before (like I have) and need a well located hotel, the Time is a very good choice, especially if you can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Who Could Ask For Anything More”
Reviews.Author: TravelHer
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days/3 nights with no complaints. Boutique style hotel that is clean, modern, comfy beds, good service and ideally located near Times Square and Theatres with easy access to anything you would like to see or do in Manhattan. Stayed in a room with 1 Full Bed and room was rather quaint (you would not be able to fit a rollaway for example) and not a ton of space to store your luggage, but it seems that is normal for New York City. Stayed on a high floor facing the back so did not hear city noise especially with A/C on. Slept like a baby. Serafina restaurant within the hotel has very good food and I ate there most of my stay. Only confusing thing is the lobby is on the second floor and there is no big flashing sign that says "The Time". We got a rate of $120 per night + tax so really that could not be beat and it was an excellent value for money. Would definitely recommend if you are able to get a reasonable rate (Check quikbook.com or travelzoo.com).

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean hotel for a low price”
Reviews.Author: bristraveler86
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for a week. It was a great price for NYC..the cheapest we could find..it was so cheap I was really worried about what the hotel would be like but we were pleasantly surprised. It was clean, had all modern features and the staff were friendly. It had a modern decor and flat screen TV which was great to come home to. Highly recommend for ppl traveling on a budget..for us it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints for the price!”
Reviews.Author: swa
Reviews.Content: Nice NYC Time Square area hotel - booked on priceline for $100. Ask for 2 double beds when we arrive and they were able to accommodate us - no extra charge. Parking garage right across the street--only $30 if u stay at the hotel - a bargain for NY! The rooms are small, bathroom very tiny, the "gym" is very old equipment but overall this place is well worth the price! there is also a market across the street - get your water/etc there the mini bar prices are out of control! (5.50 for water!)

Reviews.Title: “Ewww....bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: craftyToronto
Reviews.Content: Bed bugs?! When I complained to the front desk they sent up an inspector who said it was fine but I was covered in bites!

Reviews.Title: “Location is good, but not much else”
Reviews.Author: fournickels
Reviews.Content: Good location for theater, central to subways, restaurants and entertainment. Many problems with rooms. First room was on a low floor, noisy day and night, with a broken bathroom window which allowed easy access into the unit from the roof next door. Second room was on a higher floor, with an A/C that rattled like a freight train. Third room was quiet and sufficient, although the rug and sofa were stained, and the plumbing did not work well. Staff is nice and very friendly, but slow to respond to requests (such as requests for ice and plumbing repair). There's business center and the concierge was unable to access airline websites to print boarding passes, so bring a laptop or be prepared to go to the cyber cafe down the street for any online needs.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: snmal
Reviews.Content: This is a grate hotel for young copuls traveling to NYC. We spened 5 nights. It was clean, had a helpfull concierge. Small rooms, but we did not go to NY to stay in a hotel so it did not matter.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Time!”
Reviews.Author: Dks_34
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I stayed at the Time April 26 - 30 and I would definitely recommend this hotel. Let's start with the location. Being located at 49th between 7th and 8th - you couldn't ask for a better location. The area was quiet at night, which surprised me for the location and you are so close to everything. We went to see Billy Elliot (which was great) and the walk back to the hotel was only a few blocks away. Within only a few steps you are within Times Square and it was great for being able to go out at night and take pictures. The hotel is just down the street from Grayline tours location, so when we wanted to book a tour it was just down the street (I don't like booking from the guys hounding me on the street). To find this hotel look for the Yellow Serafina restaurant sign. It's right next door to the O'Neil theater. Price - I got a deal through Priceline - and couldn't complain about the price. I would use Priceline again and try to get the Time. Room - we stayed in a King Room - Yellow. The room was bigger than I thought (still tiny but you're not in NYC to stay in the room). The room was very clean and we didn't have any issues about the paint falling off, mold etc. The room had a Bose Wave radio and a flat screen tv. We used the safe and didn't have any issues. I didn't buy anything from the minibar as those things are crazy over priced in all hotels. You have to be careful because the fridge is weight censored so it might think you've taken something if you move things around. I can see having an issue if you have large suitcases for storage, there isn't any drawer space (at least in our room) but our suitcases were carry on size so this wasn't an issue. The bed was comfortable, my mom didn't like the pillows but I didn't have an issue. The bed itself was comfortable, I know someone reviews have said the bed is too hard but I didn't notice. Bathroom - the room came with housecoats, which I thought was a nice touch. The products they supplied were nice and replaced as I used them. I can't remember the name of them but were were given everything needed. Our towels were replaced daily even though we hung them back up ourselves. I recall reading one review saying their towels weren't replaced everyday. There is a sign in the bathroom that says they are trying to be "green" and only replacing the towels when requested. If you hang the towels up, they are not replaced. The one complaint my mother had was the temperature of the water in the shower.....it went from HOT to scalding HOT!! I could handle the coldest temperature but my mom still found it too hot. The thing that I liked, the hair dryers were real hairdryers...not those stupid things attached to the walls that take an hour to dry your hair. Staff - staff at the front desk was nice. We didn't have any issues with them. I didn't have any problems where I needed help so my review of the staff is limited. the guys at the front door were helpful and pointed out the Olympic Diner for breakfast on 8th ave. They make a mean French toast. YUMMY!!! We didn't eat at the hotel so I have no idea what the food is like. I never saw a lot of people in there. I would stay at the time again in a second. I didn't have any complaints, the location is great and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: oliviarosa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here April 20-23, booked through priceline. I was nervous because I'd never heard of The Time. The location was excellent, Times Square, Theatre District, Rockefellar Center....The rooms were very small, okay for two people--how much time do you spend in your hotel room in NYC??!!! The rooms were clean and the staff were very friendly. The restaurant was always busy, food looked good, but we never ate there.

Reviews.Title: “warm & friendly staff make this place stand out”
Reviews.Author: nearly
Reviews.Content: Ditto to everything the positive reviews have already said. Great location, lovely decoration, excellent beds. PLUS, the staff were so friendly. They really look like they enjoy working there, and it was a joy being their guest. Everyone from the front desk, concierge, cleaners an doormen were so helpful. Went out of their way. I really felt like a 'guest' there. I mentioned as I checked out- that I wondered, it must be such a great place to work and they must enjoy it alot, and the front desk staff people said yes, it really was a beautiful place to work. Looks like a very well managed and maintained place. So nice to visit there. Was quite expensive, but hey- it's the theatre district. Don't be tempted to eat at 'PAX' down the street (unrelated place cafe down the road). Woeful coffee, horrible service, dirty... we started calling it POX.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great!”
Reviews.Author: MilesAltaLoma
Reviews.Content: We had great service. I requested an upper floor got it. Requested an upgrade got it. The bar was great. The service was wonderful and our room was just like the web site. Would stay there in a New York Minute. Location can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “The best you can get in a reasonable NY Hotel”
Reviews.Author: noiva_princesa
Reviews.Content: I changed to the time hotel two days before my departure to NY (I had booked Murray Hill Suites before), and it was an excellent last minute change! Usually people say average and central hotels in NY are old, noisy, sometimes dirty and usually they donâ€™t worth the price. If you try something slightly better than a three star, you are already paying the double for it. This is just what you will find in the majority of the hotels in NY, but not at the Time Hotel. The Time Hotel is right in front of the Chicago Musical Theatre (in the Broadway District). It is located at a street and not in an avenue, so its much quieter than those located in avenues. It as (only!) 14 floors, so it is not a truly skyscraper! Than, itâ€™s a quite new hotel! Itâ€™s modern and cosy, comfortable and fashion, its perfect! During my stay, I notice that guests were mainly low profile artists, and some tourists, too, of course. I believe there is no better average hotel in such a central area of NY! Iâ€™ve just found the food at the restaurant a bit expensive for what weâ€™ve eaten. And through booking.com, Ip aid the same I would pay for a three star hotel. And believe it or not, I' am usually quite critical in what concerns hotels! Honestly, I think that the majority of the critics made here to this hotel are not fair at all!

Reviews.Title: “The Great Location is what makes this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunflower2009
Reviews.Content: The Time hotel couldn't really get much closer to Times Square, great location. The rooms were nice, but the mini bar was really overpriced. I also had a really bad experience with the mini bar because on my last night i got a bill of $60 for drinks that I had NEVER taken from the mini bar. On arrival they make you give your card details so they can resereve $100 in case you run up a bill, I wasn't best pleased about this because obviously this meant that that $60 was automatically taken from my bank. I was really angry and when I went to the front desk they told me that the mini bar was sensored, so everything I had picked up and then put back I was charged for on this bill. They told me I would be refunded once they had checked everything was still there, and they did refund me the costs of their drinks but I never did get back the overseas card charge which was something like Â£5 (not the point). Another strange point is that a ladies jacket just appeared in our room one day, it was a evening wear blazer and we still have no idea how it got there???? I got a good deal on this hotel so overall I was happy. The location makes the hotel, so despite the stupid mini-bar bill I have looked to go back in November. I do however refuse to pay $700 for a 3 night stay, it's not worth that much so I'd reccommend you to go if you get a deal, if not look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “the WORST service in NY..no the WORLD”
Reviews.Author: donny_007
Reviews.Content: Internet constantly down, phones never answered, packages/faxes never delivered, food OVERPRICED, just seems like anything you ask for JUST doesn't get done. Very unfriendly staff who just don't give a damn. Unfortunate, i cut my 3 month stay to 2 weeks, i couldn't bare it anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - hotel just a”
Reviews.Author: RosalynA
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location for getting EVERYWHERE in New York whether walking, bus, taxi or subway. Friendly helpful staff. We have stayed at this hotel before but this time things were just a bit off. Phone and TV required maintenance, computer needed different connection, amenities not replaced unless asked, etc. Just a little more attention to upkeep and ensuring standard service expected of any hotel is required. Would stay at hotel again as it is very comfortable but just wish we hadnâ€™t needed to keep asking for things like more shampoo/tissues, replacement phone, etc. Extra tip: Try Cafe Groppi on West 49th Street which is about 4 mins walk from hotel. Fantastic food all day (breakfast, lunch, dinner, late) at reasonable (for New York) prices. Lovely people too.

Reviews.Title: “It takes more than a good location to make even a decent hotel...”
Reviews.Author: mblt
Reviews.Content: Mold, paint peeling off the walls, bathroom and heater unit held together with caulk, nasty stains on carpets and furniture, failure to vacuum the floor even once during my 3-night stay, and trash and housekeeping supplies left in the hallway for my entire stay were just some of the frustrating, even disgusting, "amenities" of this hotel. The first room I was given was so small (and not New York hotel room small, but closet small) I could not roll my suitcase between the bed and the furniture on either side. When the thermostat did not work (room was at 80 degrees when I entered) they offered to move me to a different room -- on the third floor right above the loud bar/lounge. When I insisted on a room that was comfortable from a temperature perspective where I could sleep, I was told my only choice was to upgrade to a suite. The management of this hotel obviously cares nothing about quality or respecting their guests, and [-] clearly has a major hole in their ratings process to place this poorly maintained property at 3.5 stars. Even given the Times Square location, this is a two-star hotel at best. The fact is I have stayed in Motel 6 or Days Inn rooms that were cleaner, more pleasant and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: DLTravelingMan
Reviews.Content: I was here for several nights in December. Really enjoyed my stay. The room was pretty small, but the way it was arranged made really efficient use of the space. It was immaculately clean - nice bedding, clean bathroom. I had two minor issues when I was there, and both were addressed promptly once I brought them to the staff's attention. This isn't a hotel with super-mega frills - wi-fi is extra - but it's in a great location. It's near a lot, but not in the midst of it, so if you want to steer clear of the hectic parts of Times Square you can. I'd stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Right place at the right time.”
Reviews.Author: MissWisc
Reviews.Content: I was booked here by the Broadway League for a business event. After reading the reviews here, I wasn't certain about staying there, but I thought if the League is recommending it, it must be OK. We found it to be delightful! The rooms are small - this is Manhattan and if you want a big room, you're gonna pay huge bucks for it. But, it had everything you needed and some nice perks too. The Bose Wave radio (it's not an Ipod dock as one reviewer expected... it's a radio!) has a great sound. Our room was toward the back of the hotel and overlooked rooftops, so we left the curtains down. A windowbox light made it appear that sunlight was streaming in, even though the drapes were closed. The TV remote has a sensor that is not attached to the TV so if you place things on the desk that block the sensor, the remote won't work. (Another problem cited by a different reviewer.) There is an expensive mini bar - typical. WIFI was iffy, but the in-room ethernet connection worked great. We had a "red" room which felt vaguely "Japanese" to me with clean lines, black furniture and no wasted space. Bathroobes to lounge in were fluffy.The huge shower had plenty of hot water and pressure. Everything was clean. Maids were wonderful about coming in when it was convenient for us. There is a parking garage right across the street. The hotel is about 1/2 block to the very top of Times Square and about 2 blocks to the heart of it. The play "Chicago" is at the theatre right across the street. They were loading out "Spring Awakening" from next door and "Mamma Mia" is just out and around the corner. There is a Food Emporium across the street and 1/2 block down - upstairs is deli food and basement had a grocery store great for families watching their $$. Lots of cool sidewalk vendors on 9th ave, just aroudn the block. Subway, shopping, theatre, it's all within easy walking distance. Everything was clean. The staff was wonderful. The door isn't well marked - look for the yellow signs for Sarafina's - so I'm glad I knew the lobby was on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Cute Hotel,, cuter price!”
Reviews.Author: papendick17
Reviews.Content: Great Boutique Hotel.. safe area. Gym -was very clean, medium to newer equipment. Ultra modern feel though.. Clean room. VERY simple... Again. great ultra modern feel. FANTASTIC location. Employees were rarely seen (not a bad thing) but when they were, very pleasent. Quiet hotel, never wakened by the hustle and bustle of times square. Flat screen tv was beautiful. Downside was that the room was very small... Along with the bathroom. Not much room for your things.. (and i dont have that much for a bussuness trip).Bar/lounge was impressive! great decor... All in all.. for a simple traveler who likes luxury with not alot of $ to spend, it was VERY comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: ABLer
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter, my nephew and I stayed at The Time for 4 nights including New Year's Eve. I found it to be central to everything (mostly shopping :). The staff were extremely helpful and eager to please. I will agree that the doorman was absent a fair bit. I found the room to be clean and spacious (we had a suite) and the kids loved the tv's and the funky atmosphere. Housekeeping was helpful (there is actually a button above the peephole on the door that allows you to set it to Do Not Disturb and, if set, the doorbell won't ring and they won't make up your room--didn't figure that out until day 2.). Overall, I found it to be a great value and great location. The staff were warm and friendly and always rushing to help. I would definitely recommend The Time.

Reviews.Title: “Party time at the Times”
Reviews.Author: JohnDJrX
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice for the most part: clean, friendly service, convenient location, adequate lounge and restaurant. The rooms are on the small side, even for New York standards. We did have one major problem. A group of 20 people (head count provided by the front desk) held a party in a suite on our floor that raged on from 1:00 AM through 6:00 AM. The noise was tolerable when the party was contained to the suite, but when the crowd spilled out into the hallway, the noise was unbearable. The night was a comical cycle of calls to the front desk, security chasing the party back into the suite, only to have the halls filled again minutes after security left. Finally, at 6:00 AM, security escorted the unregistered guests from the hotel. I suppose I am a bit jealous that I was not having a good time with the crowd, but we planed to checkout at 8:00 AM to catch a train home. What was most disappointing was the hotel manager had very little sympathy for us the next morning when we lodged our complaints. She was more concerned over her inconvenience caused by the ransacked suite than the fact we got no sleep. I guess it was silly of me to expect a good night sleep in the hotel room I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “OK for New York”
Reviews.Author: georgiaadventurer
Reviews.Content: This is not a typical hotel room. We stayed in a suite since there were three of us. Here are the issues we had: 1.The sofa beds are horrible and we had to ask someone to come up at 11pm to make the sofa bed up. 2. Remote control on TV's didn't work even after telling the front desk about it. 3. Luggage took 45 minutes to get to tthe room. 4. No ipod/MP3 hook up to the Bose system as advertised on their website. When I asked about it there was no apology and a denial that the website indicated such. 5. Hallways are very dark. 5. No dressers - just a closet and a leaning ladder rack. 6. Lack of character - tried to be minimalist, but the place comes off very cold and uninviting. Good things: 1. Very spacious rooms. 2. Great amenities and space in the bathrooms. 3.Good lighting. 4.Starbucks on the corner. 5. Great location - two blocks from the NWRQ line. Probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed but overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ASLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good but avoid the third floor. Us and some friends stayed 1st night on 3rd floor but were kept up by bass from bar below. Our room also stank of smoke and safe didn't work. We complained and were moved to 14th and 15th floors... much better. Nice rooms. Restaurant downstairs was excellent and as guests you get 20% off. Great location just off time square.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: kwilk
Reviews.Content: i wouldn't stay here again. the hotel staff seem overwhelmed - our room was not ready at 3pm when we checked in, and one day after being out since 9:30am, we returned at 3:30pm to find our room still being cleaned. they need a system to tell housekeeping when you are out - they don't even have the "service please" door knob hangars. the doorman was missing more than he was there. the staff were nice and tried to accomodate us, but the hotel just seemed to busy for the number of people working (or something). to be fair, it was the weekend after Christmas - so maybe that does not happen normally. it's also not very secure - anyone can walk in on the ground floor and take the elevator up to any of the floors without even being seen by the front desk (which is on the 2nd floor). on the positive side, they did give us a room on a high floor, which we'd requested and made a big difference in terms of noise. it's pretty clean and the room is a decent size for the price and location. bed is comfy and shower has good pressure. if you are going to broadway shows, it is the perfect location - right in the middle of them - anything else, it isn't great because you have to cross times square to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “More Good than Bad”
Reviews.Author: Krak
Reviews.Content: We originally picked this hotel because they allowed us to bring our dog. After reading some of the reviews (very recent ones) I was a bit nervous about what we would find. Soon I discovered my worries were unnecessary. Here's the good: convenient parking across the street, GREAT location one block from Times Square.. everything is here, a clean room, an awesome shower which is so warm it's hard to leave, a comfortable king bed, and an inviting place for our puppy. If you are looking for something swank or spacious, this is not the place for you. However, if you are looking for a good deal in a fabulous location (and if you happen to have a dog) I would definitely recommend the Time.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: jewa1221
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in town to see a Broadway show, and stayed in a room on the 3rd floor on a Saturday night. All we heard until 3 am was the bass from the nightclub/lounge on the 2nd floor. We had the bathroom fan, the heater fan, and a white noise machine all running, but they weren't able to drown out the sound. The room itself was fine, but old. There was mold in the bathroom, and the carpet clearly hadn't been shampooed in years. The staff member who checked us out the next morning didn't bother to ask us how our stay was, probably because he knew we wouldn't have good things to say.

Reviews.Title: “Hot/Cold”
Reviews.Author: babibirdee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is labeled a "boutique" hotel although it lacks character. The hotel hallways are exceptionally small and slightly crowded. BUT the hotel was very clean and the room service was excellent. The Inc. Bar in the lobby is EXTREMELY loud on the weekends - has a "club" feeling. (good nightlife!!) If you are looking for a unique boutique hotel, I wouold recommend the Night Hotel in Times Square over the Time Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: SGStuart
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 great nights at the Time Hotel, in NYC. This hotel is great for anyone looking to explore New York as the location is fantastic - literally walking to the end of the block leads you directly into Times Square, and all of it's attractions. The rooms in the hotel are small but are comfortable and clean and fully equipped. Also, I arrived quite early in New York on a flight from Chicago and was expecting to be told that I will have to come back as it was still too early to check, but the friendly lady at reception checked me in immediately! New York was an unforgettable experience. I didn't spend much time in my room as there was s much to see and do but it was really a great place to be based while exploring all that NYC has to offer.. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to prospective visitors to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute hole”
Reviews.Author: Travellerboy_1978_Hi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute hole and was really disappointing after it was recommended to us by our travel agent. The rooms are incredibly small, the bathrooms are extremely filthy, the service as a whole was terrible (except when we checked out), the air conditioners are so noisy you need earplugs to sleep, my wife has been bitten to death by bedbugs, the shower curtain and tiles were mouldy and black, the room smelt mouldy, the bed was not made up in two days, the towels are small and so old you can see through, the power sockets were falling out the walls, the mini bar sucked, you have to wait on average 2 mins for a lift, the staff walk around with loud blearing walkie talkies which wake you up in the night (unless you wear earplugs), the bed was radiating heat all night (PROBABLY THE BED BUGS), the thermostat in the aircon didnâ€™t work, the TV reception and sound was dismal, the front desk is chaotic all the time, no one offered to help with our luggage, the Internet service didnâ€™t work (thank god for StarBucks), our toilet was broken and did not flush, we found cockroaches in the bathroom over two consecutive days and experienced cold showers. Overall this ruined our arrival to New York and we found cheaper accomodation with far better service and facilities at a cheaper price 4 streets away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic New York”
Reviews.Author: katehow85
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from 3 fabulous nights at The Time. This hotel is great for anyone looking to explore New York as the location is fantastic - literally walking to the end of the block leads you directly into Times Square, and all of it's attractions. We booked bus tickets via Grays Line tours and the main stops for both the uptown and downtown loops are within a 5 minute walk. The rooms in the hotel are small but are comfortable and clean and fully equipped. Be warned though, the wardrobes are tiny! We did eat in the Serafina restaurant, which is attached to the hotel, one night and to be honest it was not the best meal that we had; however if you show your room key you do receive 20% discount. Make sure to collect your complimentary drinks - you are given vouchers for this upon check-in. New York is fantastic, and if you are anything like us, you will use the hotel for sleeping only! I would recommend The Time to anyone looking for a central base to explore The Big Apple. If anyone has any questions then please do not hesitate to get in touch. x

Reviews.Title: “terrific time at the time”
Reviews.Author: lovinlifecanada
Reviews.Content: recently spent 4 days in nyc and stayed at the time hotel. i was there with my long-time friend as well as her 2 daughters,one who was shopping for her wedding dress. location of hotel could not have been better. time's square was practically on our doorstep! mamma mia was a short walk away. the hotel was clean(and i'm very particular when it comes to clean), service was good, doormen were kind and serafina restaurant was lovely for breakfast even if a bowl of oatmeal was $10.95 !! it was a fabulous stay. oh, by the way, she got her dress at klienfelds.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but good”
Reviews.Author: diana555
Reviews.Content: My husband was in New York on business for a week, and my 8 year old daughter and I came along. We booked a suite, and found it to be a great space for a family. She slept on the pull out couch in the sitting room, and we still had a large king bedroom & bath to ourselves. Great location too, and the staff were friendly and helpful. Small wait to check in as they had just changed their reservation system, but no problems after that. Our room was on the corner facing the street, so it was a little noisy would be my only complaint. Restaurant had great food too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice colours - small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Flyers_8
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Rooms were clean, with nice colours, but - typical of NYC - very small. Organization somewhat chaotic, you have to place requests 2-3 times at reception, and it took a while until they found all our suitcases to bring to the room - but all really make big efforts to please you. Location excellent, on Broadway near Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot with children”
Reviews.Author: Patricia82
Reviews.Content: My daughter in law and I took two young children to see Little Mermaid on a Thursday night. In looking for a hotel for the night, we were interested in convenience for the children and safey. I looked at a lot of hotels on line and picked The Time from the reviews written. We were pleased that the hotel was as advertised. Clean, new bathroom, adequate space, and very helpful desk people who knew the subway system, etc and advised us. The price was moderate as far as NYC hotels go. This is a great spot for tourists to be in the heart of the theater district. Thank you. Susann Hoke

Reviews.Title: “Reservations do not matter...”
Reviews.Author: MarketingMan1594
Reviews.Content: I would love to review my stay... but there was NONE! I booked this hotel with a late checkin, and when I arrived I was informed that there were no rooms available. They had given away my room!! I was later told that there had been a mistake in one of their MULTIPLE reservation systems. YOUR CONFIRMATION/RESERVATION has NO meaning at this hotel... TRAVELER BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel 1/2 block off Time Square”
Reviews.Author: AbbyTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at 49th and Broadway. The signage for the hotel is hard to see because it is up so high like 2nd floor. I was directed to the 2nd floor for check in and it was very smooth and we were handed complimentary cocktail tickets for the bar in the hotel. The lobby was white black and red. Very cool fish tank there as well. Elevators to the lobby are glass. We stayed in a standard room king size. The carpet in the hall to your room has seconds of a clock in Roman Numerals. While waiting for the elevator there are tiny T.V.s in the glass wall to watch~ The rooms are in Blue, Red or Yellow- you can choose if available. Furniture in black and huge flat screen. Rooms are sort of small but thats N.Y. bathroom was nice and shower only in our room. Safes and refridge in room. Beds were comfy and linens were nice. Location was great for Time Square. The hotel was directly across from the show Chicago. Over the top friendly staff. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: esico11
Reviews.Content: Think twice about staying at this hotel. They do NOT care about their customers at all. My daughter and I booked two nights at this hotel. We informed the hotel that we would be arriving late. I booked a "deluxe king bed" room. We checked in at 11pm. They made small talk to us at checking in. We were sent to room 1615 on the 16th floor in a dark corner of the hallway. To our surprise and dissapointment, it was a closet sized room with a full bed. Not a king size, not even a queen. It was a full size bed pushed up against a wall. I immediately called the front desk and they informed me that I booked a queen. Well, if I did, then why did they give me a full? So, I said that I had the printout from the internet and re-confirmed it before I left. So, the girl shut up, but the proceeded to tell me that they were fully booked! My daughter had to sleep on the floor because the bed was so small. She is a size 1 and I'm a size 12, so it wasn't because we were large people. It was so tiny in there. The bathroom floor didn't even close. We had to prop it closed with a phone book. It stunk in the room as well. The sink was all cracked and it was a horrible place. They took 70 bucks off of my 250 dollar room. BIG DEAL! I was moved into a deluxe king room the next night. It was a little too late. It was what I should have gotten in the first place. And, even if they did give my room away and were sticking me in this full size bedroom, why didn't they tell me this when checking in?? They apologized, but nobody got the manager for me. It was not a good place to stay. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Every Respect”
Reviews.Author: jon072
Reviews.Content: I spent three wonderful nights at the Time Hotel at the beginning of August. This is the first time i have written a review, but always read Trip advisor before booking a hotel, and to be honest, given the rather mixed reviews The Time had received, i was really hesitant about booking it, in the end the good value for money was the deciding factor. I travel to new york at least twice a year and have stayed in 2,3,4 an 5 star hotels and have to say that the Time didnt disappoint in any respect. Its in a great location, the room was large, colourful and comfortable with everything you would want from a good 4 star hotel. The staff were fantastically helpful and polite and i will definately stay there again next time i return to New York. The gym has everything you need for a good workout-they should publicise it more on their website, and the restaurant is good-although slightly pricey. Reading the other reviews on this site about the hotel i felt compelled to write this review as i found the Time Hotel to be amazing value for money and a FANTASTIC place to stay. I would recommend it to anyone in the strongest possible terms.I cant wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “not the best”
Reviews.Author: whatthewhatthe
Reviews.Content: This is a copy I sent to the manager. Aside from this it was cheap - around $200 a night and the same price as 2-3* bigger hotels in the area that are of the same standard or maybe better. Dear Sir or Madam I am writing to let you know of my bad experience at your hotel. I am from Australia and came to visit Washington DC, Chicago and New York. In DC I stayed at the Renaissance Mayflower, and in Chicago at the Sutton Place. Both hotels were of a VERY high standard, with amazing service and a good overall experience. They both fall into the same category as the Time Hotel. However my experience at the Time was at the other end of the spectrum. I have never written to a hotel before but wanted to share my experience with you. On entering the room, I noticed a strong smell â€“ an unpleasant smell almost like a bad musty smell of mould. I thought it would disappear but it remained over the 3 days stay. The room was small (OK, that I can put up with given that itâ€™s NY and a lot of hotels are like this). On entering the bathroom, I noticed horrible black grime along the shower door (see photos attached). The shower leaked too. I notified reception later that night, hoping I would get used to the smell and asked if I could change and was told it didnâ€™t matter, as all the rooms are the same and none were available, so I put up with it. The airconditioner was rattling all night. So it was either a situation of â€˜stay awake but be a good temperatureâ€™ thing, or â€˜try to sleep, but be hotâ€™ due to turning it off. Checkin staff were friendly but when I went to ask for my room to be made up at 1pm and for my toilet to be unblocked, it seemed like I had asked for the biggest request possible. I came back at 3pm, it was still not done â€“ so I phoned down â€“ asking again, but of course returning after shopping at 5.30pm it had not been done. THREE times I had to ask and after the third time the housekeeper was sent right up and did a great job. The housekeepers were VERY friendly as were the bellboys. The reception staff on Friday 8th August though were rude, uncourteous and rather â€˜offishâ€™. In fact, going down for a third time to ask for my room to be made up and toilet unblocked I didnâ€™t even receive an apology. Iâ€™m not asking for a grovelling apology but a courteous â€˜Weâ€™re sorryâ€™ would have gone done nicely! Aside from this, smaller details like no shower pressure, my TV remote not working and no replacement sent up when requested, and small things like this made it feel more like a 2 to 3 star hotel. I would appreciate a reply back, if only to know you have read my concerns and hopefully improve the hotel for future guests. Kind Regards Me

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: EveGlos_UK
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at The Time at the end of a 2 week touring holiday.This place is awful and we were upgraded to a suite!Unfortunately we had paid upfront or we would have moved to a different hotel.Our room 8-12 was dingy,tatty and grubby.In fact after my husband found a toenail clipping in the drawer we did not dare look too closely!The furniture was worn and chipped,and the carpet looked in need of a good clean.There was very little storage space and overall the room was depressing!There is no way this is a boutique hotel-I have stayed in better youth hostels.The Time was the sixth hotel of our holiday and the other 5 were excellent.There is no way we would ever stay here again!Please avoid this place!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs live here!”
Reviews.Author: Renee25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June of 2008. While I was there, for one night, I didn't notice any problems. But when I got back to my apartment in DC, I woke up the next day with a horrible rash all over my legs. I went to see a doctor a few days later who diagnosed the rash as bed bug bites, which are becoming a big problem in NYC. She advised me to wash everything I had brought in hot water and throw my luggage out. I did all of that and had a bed bug outbreak two months later! Now they are living in my apartment and I have to have an exterminator come. Please do NOT stay at this hotel, you don't want to go through this nightmare!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!!”
Reviews.Author: nyclover77
Reviews.Content: This place was a huge dissapointment, we stayed there for two nights and the second night we had classic bite marks (three in a row) very typical for bed bugs. I inspected the room but found no bugs (but a new mattress with tags on; a typical sign of a previous infestation at hotels). The receptionist admitted that they had preivously had bedbug problems at the hotel, but the manager did not yield and claimed there was no proof etc. We ended up having to move to another hotel and treat all our luggage with washing, freezing for a couple of weeks etc to be sure we did not bring this problem back home. All in all a terrible experience and even worse that the manager deducted a full charge on our credit card for the stay. I would warn anyone against staying there after our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and service”
Reviews.Author: CiincinnatiRick
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at The Times, the staff was so friendly, the concierge was great, I emailed him a couple times before we got to New York and he responded promptly with the answers to my questions. The cleaning staff was excellent. the room was very clean, a bit small room but that is what you expect in New York. I highly recommend this hotel, espeically if you want to be close to Time Square. Just watch the cash bar etc in your room.. if you move any of the ideas for over 20 seconds you get charged for it,, though they will take it off your bill very easy jus something you might like to know.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: LKC07
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I've ever written for Trip Advisor, but I had such a terrible experience at this hotel that I feel compelled to share it. I was traveling on business from the West Coast, and had to be up at 4:30 a.m. the next morning for a TV shoot. When I pulled back the covers to my bed, there were several long, dark hairs in the bed - enough to indicate that the sheets were not cleaned. When I called downstairs and requested a new room, I was told they were sold out, so I had to wait 20 minutes for someone to come change the sheets on the bed. Also, the internet did not work in the room (a large problem for a business traveler), and maintenance never showed up when I called to request it to be fixed. The minibar was broken, too. The "gym" was tiny, dirty, and half the machines didn't work. And RIGHT NOW I have been sitting on hold for 25 minutes and counting, trying to get a charge moved from my client's credit card to mine. This is the sixth time I've called. An absolutely abysmal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had THE TIME of our lives in NYC!!!”
Reviews.Author: sazza121
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Time in December and found the hotel to be a great base for our first visit to New York. The hotel was chic, modern and very clean. The best thing about The Time is its location. It really is in the heart of Broadway (with Chicago across the road and next door to Spring Awakening). Time Square is just minutes away and the hotel is really close to the subway if you want to use the metro (which we found to be great and completely safe!) Only glitch was having to change rooms because our safe wasn't working - but the helpful staff upgraded us to a king room which was far more spacious than the standard room - so well worth it!! Can't comment on the food as we took advantage of the numerous bars and cafes nearby. Defintely recommend !

Reviews.Title: “It's time to look at THE TIME HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Gamxiated
Reviews.Content: One thing about NYC I can not stand is being in Time Square. It's full of people and tourist awed by feeling like being in the center of the Earth. However, I was one of those people awed by the lights and fast pace of Time Square. I try not to book any hotel near this area, but to my surprise my company booked it at the Time Hotel. Hoping it was a few blocks north of Time Square, when we arrived it was right next door to it. NYC is full of hotels, but I would not reccomend staying at any chains like the W, Holiday Inn, Crowne Plaza, etc. It is best to venture out and try some of the great boutique hotel NYC offers, such as the Time Hotel. Although this hotel was next door to Time Square, it was actually away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The Time Hotel was suprisingly in a quiet street next to two broadway shows: Spring Awakening and Chicago. Arriving in NYC, our shuttle driver dropped us off at the Crowne Plaza Hotel just to walk us a few feet to the street where the Time Hotel was located. Walking into the hotel felt like a high end boutique hotel. An elevator takes you up to the lobby where a friendly staff greeted you. We were early for check-in and could not get a room until 3 pm, as a rule with most hotels in NYC. However, we had to work that day so it wasn't an issue. The lobby at the Time is really not a lobby at all, but a BAR/CLUB as returning to the hotel that night, the music was playing loud. This would be a surprise to anyone checking in at night, especially for those not keen to hip hop music. However, our room was on the 14th floor so this was not an issue. I was amazed by the bed we ended up getting, which was a king size bed. We seem to have been upgraded free of charge or was it my Trip Advisor hat that made a difference :) Anyways, as with most boutique hotel the room was small. However, it was comfortable and clean. There was not much view, except for the room adjacent to yours where you can see everything that went on in the other room through the window (Corner Room). The bathroom was fully stock with necessities and clean. The use of storage space shaped as squares was a nice touch. They were trying GO GREEN by asking for guests to request for towels when needed and to re-use towles. However, it seem like we got new towels anyways without having to request for them. The mini-bar was expensive, as with most hotel, but well stocked. However, the fridge could only open halfway based on the layout of the room. The only negative thing I have to say about the Time Hotel is questioning how secure the room is when you are out in the city. When we left our room one morning, the cleaning lady was on our floor. Having left my umbrella in the room, I came back to find our room door open wide with no one in it. It worried me since anyone could have came in the room and stole all our belongings. However, the positive side to this story is that cameras are on each hallway to ensure safety and security of the guests. I still feel the room should have not been left alone with the door open for anyone to come in and steal something. The Time Hotel is another amazing boutique hotel offering access to all of NYC and centrally located where all the actions is happening. It is literally a few feet from Time Square where all the madness and mayhem happens. The location is definately worth it for first time visitors of NYC. Tour buses are next door and the subway (blue line) is only a block away. There is a great grocery store/deli/bakery adacent to the hotel where you can get anything and everything (The grocery store is downstair). Rockefeller Center and 5th Avenue is 3 blocks away. In conclusion, I would reccomend the hotel to any first time visitors in NYC only to be in a centralized area where all other tourist tend to meet at the point called Time Square.
