Don't be surprise at how small the rooms are since many boutiques hotel don't offer suites, but 1 or 2 penthouses. Be mindful that you are going for an experience and most of all just to sleep. When visiting NYC, you spend all day walking, hailing cabs, and hauling shopping bags around that by the time you get back to the hotel you are ready to go to sleep. BTW there is a restaurant downstair called Serafina, pricey, but good breakfast. I never had a glass of orange juice for $6. My friend enjoyed their bagel and lox and I enjoyed their waffle. I may have had issues with the location of this hotel, but I am glad to tell you that I did not hear one noise from the people visiting Time Square. BON VOYAGE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at The Time”
Reviews.Author: twgator
Reviews.Content: I was there on business for three nights, and thought I must've been on Candid Camera! Forget about the fact that the rooms are tiny (even for Times Square), have no dressers, no counter in the bathroom and you don't even have room to turn around in the shower... I'VE NEVER STAYED AT A PLACE WITH MORE PATHETIC SERVICE., and lack of caring about their customers. In one room, I had two lights, a TV, a minibar and a most importantly, a thermostat that didn't work. Didn't really care about the lights and the minibar...and it took all day, but they finally fixed the TV. Despite repeated promises, though...could never fix the thermostat and get it below 78-degrees in my room. Even speaking to "the boss" was a complete waste of time. I spoke to the General Manager (Christopher Mallon) who told me that he would make sure the room is fixed immedaitely, told me I would get one of my nights complimentary, told me I would be invited back, etc. He never made good on any of his promises to rectify the situation...and since I left, has never returned a phone call of an e-mail. Needless to say, in 3-days, the room was never fixed, I couldn't switch into another room...and certainly never got the credit that I was promised. Even room service was horrible. It took three calls and 45-minutes to get a bucket of ice, and ordered dinner one night that was cold by the time it got to my room. It was really like a bad joke. There are some great hotels in Times Square. This place isn't one of them...and obviously they don't care about taking care of their customers, either. Simply put...I feel like I was blatantly screwed...then lied to by the General Manager. I hope this review will prevent somebody else from having the same experience I did.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: FrankWeho
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the first 'tme' in March 2008. It's an excellent hotel that really makes an effort on the details. I was in a king room which was reasonably sized, had excellent lighting, nice decor. Housekeepers were extremely nice and good, all the staff I encountered were good in fact. Location on 49th St/8th Ave. is terrific ... near Times Sq. and theaters, one block from a subway, half a block from an excellent supermarket if you want to buy your own breakfast. I've already made a reservation for my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marylouise30
Reviews.Content: This was our frst visit to New York and my husband and I were very nervous about choosing a hotel because we did not have a clue about New York. When we arrived the receptionist wished me a Happy Birthday (the trip was a surprise 30th Birthday present!). The hotel had left a bottle of wine and a platter of fresh fruit in our room for my birthday so that was a nice surprise. Our room was lovely, we had a living room area with a really big TV, plenty of storage for clothes and a sofa and other seats. The bed was very big and comfortable and the bathroom had a good supply of toiletries and was clean. The jacuzzi bath was lovely after a hard day's shopping although it was a little bit small! There was also a large TV in our bedroom area as well although with all the great things to do in New York you dont want to be watching TV. I would recommend that you ask for a room on a higher floor because there is a very loud disco on the second floor some nights. If you intend to go down there for a drink dress up a bit because we didn't and everyone else there was really well dressed!! I would recommend the hotel because of the very good location, we found it really easy to find a lot of major attractions (Macy's, Empire State Building, Tiffany's etc) within walking distance so it is good if you have never been to New York before. Also the hop on hop off bus tours are very close to the hotel and we found it useful for getting your bearings in Manhattan and seeing some of the sights that were a bit further away (eg. Ground Zero, Statue of Liberty). We found all the staff very pleasant and helpful and if I ever went to New York again I wouldnt hesistate to stay in The Time again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: htravelbug
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good, particularly if you want to be close to the theatre district, as it is centrally located. However, the room was very small and the bathroom even smaller. While the interior design is very pleasant, the space was not comfortable if you had to spend any length of time in the room. The room carpets could also use a clean, but the room was tidy and the bathroom clean. There was no Wi-Fi, which I found unusual, given the hotel positions itself as hip and up-to-date. While there is broad band, it is $9.95 a day. The staff were friendly and helpful for the most part, though the service was a bit hit and miss. Given the many other options in NYC, I think it is unlikely that I would stay at the hotel again. However, if you found a very good rate and do not intend to spend most of your time in the room, then I think it would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and great value”
Reviews.Author: cass1410
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit to NYC. Wanted a central hotel but not too expensive. Was slightly concerned after reading the reviews, however..... Got to the Time at 1430. Was advised the room wasnt ready but wouldnt be long. 5 minutes later the bellboy took our bags and we were off to the 15th floor. As this was a special occassion I had arranged the Romance package which was a bottle of champagne, rose petals and Godiva chocolates. They had put the petals on the bedspread with the chocolates in the middle - very impressed. The room was bigger than I was expecting - bed extremly comfortable, nice bathroom, big tv. The only criticism would be the lack of storage, there was a wardrobe but no drawers. The hotel was just off times square and approx 5 minutes from times square subway. Great location. The housekeeping staff were very thorough. We loved the fact that the Do Not Disturb sign was part of the doorbell - very original. Also different to another review we thought that the fact the beds were turned down, the blinds put down and chocolate and the weather report left a really nice touch - especially for a 3 star property. We had a problem with our mini bar making a noise. We advised reception and within half hour it had been fixed, apart from that no problem at all. We used room service, thought the $5 delivery charge was a bit cheeky as this wasnt mentioned anywhere but the food was good and was with us within 15 minutes. Overall the hotel was lovely, the room good value for money - the room rate was $229 a night - compared to $400 at other hotels in the area. If like us you are coming to NYC for the sights and dont plan on spending a lot of time in your room then this is definately the hotel for you - foget the negative reviews - I wouldnt hesitate on coming back. Room 1518 from 27/2 to 2/3

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: sachahuista
Reviews.Content: I chose The Time because of its location - close to Port Authority and subway stops, and right next to Time Square which kind of compromises for shopping, Central Park, food and Harlem - and its relatively good price. And to be honest, location is faultless if you're looking for all of the above: subway is five minutes away by foot, whilst Port Authority is an easy 15-minute walk. The room was ok - small but well-furnished, and the bed was incredibly comfortable - possibly the most comfortable bed I've slept in for a while. TV was ok - remote was a bit slow, and heating/AC was a bit odd: wasn't sure if it was working or not but I didn't feel too cold eventhough it was minus whatever outside. The shower was very hot as well though the bathroom was on the small side. Now the problems: the staff were ok. However, I did have a particularly non-responsive woman who didn't take kindly to my comments about the hotel cleaners being overly-efficient - they have a habit of going into your room and taking away the complimentary New York Times if it's just left on the table. I just couldn't understand why the cleaners would do that. They also have a habit of cleaning my rooms eventhough I asked them not to. But the thing which baffled me the most was why someone insisted on barging into the room late afternoon, turn on the light, the radio, and then leave two pieces of chocolate on my pillow with tomorrow's weather forecast on a small piece of paper beneath them. I have nothing against this kind of gestures - I just don't see the point, particularly when I see a sign in the hotel room urging us to save energy. By leaving the light and radio on are not environmentally friendly!! This brings me to my next point - why is there no 'Do Not Disturb' signs on the doors? My other concern was that late every Friday and Saturday night, the hotel bar is very noisy and packed, which must be a concern to those of us who need a bit of attention then because, well, the front-desk was empty. Plus the noise level is quite high. I stayed on the 9th floor so didn't hear a thing but I would worry if I lived anywhere lower. In addition, everything seems to be charged - from internet to leaving your baggage. What I hated most was having to pay $1 to make a tollfree call from my phone. That said, I would stay there again if I have to but I might think twice about the price, however. And for god's sake, eat out!

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms but they have problems”
Reviews.Author: filmrisk
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC for eight days on business. The Time was selected by the production company I was advising. It would not have been my choice as I prefer the Millenium. This is an old old hotel that was renovated as a semi-boutique hotel with a them about time. The small rooms, typical of NYC, are decorated with grey and black patterned carpeting, bright red bedspreads and wall panel behind the bed. I understand they also use green or yellow in some rooms. The place tries to be hip and cooler than thou. Living in L.A., I know the vibe but you can really only get away with it if you have great service and The Time fails in this regard. The desk staff and doormen were great. But other aspects of the hotel fall apart badly. First, maintenance problems were apparent. My first room, 1608, had an HVAC problem. Despite being in the 20s and 30s outside, the room could not be cooled down below 78-80 over a preiod of four days. Even with the windows left open, the temperature never came down. They sent a maintenance engineer to work on it. He could not fix it and suggested I leave the windows open. Try sleeping in Manhattan in the theatre district with your windows open with street noise, loud drunks and shouting clubbers on the street at all hours. The room safe also would not work, so I resorted to locking my laptop and camera in my luggage every day. Other apparent maintenance problems, wobbly toilet and seat, lights that sometimes flickered and even shocked slightly when touched. After three nights of poor sleep due to heat and noise, they moved me to another room, 1105. This one had a different thermostat system and the hvac worked well. The most apalling service problem was with room service. Because I was working extraordinarily long hours (shooting a tv show), I was often returning the hotel after 14 and 18 hour days and would just want a simple meal before bed. On the thrid night of my stay, I ordered dinner at about 8pm. The phone attendant said it should take about 40 minutes. OK. An hour later I called to check on the order as I needed to get to bed early due to an early start next day. The attendant said she forgot to enter the order so it would be another 45 minutes. Two hours after ordering, finally got the meal and went to bed an hour later than I would have liked. I mentioned this problem to the front desk. They asked if I was charged for the meal (I was) and the desk person said they would remove the charge. On the final night of my stay, after having been up for 30 hours due to a 24 hour live broadcast we did, I was way too tired to go out to eat. I ordered, was told 30-45 minutes for delivery> After an hour, I called to check and amazingly was told they had again forgotten to enter the order!! I asked for the manager and the flustered attendant told me that as they were busy he would have to call me back. Aftter not hearing back for a while, I went down to the restaurant and discussed the problem with the restaurant manager. He was apologetic and said the meal would be complimentary. Never got a call from the room service/guest services manager. That an order could be forgotten due to an error is not that big a deal - things happen. But for two orders to be lost in three days shows me that there is a serious failure in management and service personnel. Given the overall issues of maintenance and service, I would recommend travelers avoid the Time. There are better hotels in this category in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, Comfortable and Stylish”
Reviews.Author: andrawatkins
Reviews.Content: We normally avoid midtown hotels when visiting NYC, but the Time Hotel was really a find. The room was clean, comfortable and hip. Some might find the rooms small, but we did not mind the room size one bit. The "do not disturb"/doorbell feature was a completely cool, quirky touch. The hotel was convenient to everything and was quiet, especially considering its proximity to Times Square. We were disappointed that they did not have wireless internet in a hotel of this caliber, but we were able to find a nonsecured connection close by. The staff were all very helpful and efficient, with the concierge helping us check into our flights online and the doorman hailing a cab in rush hour traffic. Look in the bottom of the elevator shaft on your visit. You won't be sorry you tried the Time.

Reviews.Title: “The Time Hotel in NYC really delivers!”
Reviews.Author: Mistiza3
Reviews.Content: The Time Hotel in the heart of Times Square in NYC delivers, yet again! I was greeted at the front door, brought up to the reception desk, and politely escorted to my room. All the staff were extremely courteous and very prompt to attend to all my needs. I even mentioned to the front desk that I was tired from travelling and would be napping in the afternoon and they put in a call to housekeeping to do not disturb. This was not expected and definitely very appreciated! The room was unbelievable!! The king-size bed and comfy bath robe were a much appreciated comfort in the room. The hotel lounge had been renovated and the new look is quite impressive. This time I dined in the hotel restaurant, Serafina, and had some of the best Italian cuisine I've ever had while in NYC. (Try the Sophia pizza, you won't regret it!) I cannot say enough good things about The Time. The hotel is in a perfect location (close to broadway shows, restaurants, and shopping) and I would never stay anywhere else while visiting NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: nwhiteiii
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. our room was clean and had a 42" plasma on the wall in the sitting area and the bedroom had 20" LCD in it! The decor was nice as well. They had free post cards in the room that you could mail back home to remember your stay in NY which I thought was nice. The parking garage was directly across the street and you can get a discount by having the hotel validate your ticket. Theaters were very close as well as Time Square. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your TIME! Better hotels in the area!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationgirl77
Reviews.Content: Expedia should not list this as a four star hotel! We had a horrible experience at the Time hotel. Although the location is good for those wanting to be in times square, that is about all it has to offer. Once entering the building you are confused about where to go, no real signage with the name of the hotel and you must take the elevator to a small lobby on the second floor. The lobby itself is very tiny. The actual rooms are just as tiny. The chair was very run down and looked like it was pulled out of the curb and put into our room. There were mysterious red stains on the bathroom walls, and a very narrow stand up shower with mold and cracked tiles. By the window we noticed a huge hole in the wall with chips of the paint/wall still laying on the carpet. The hotel also offers internet but for $10 a day and does not offer any sort of business center. We were so disappointed, we checked out the first night to stay at Park Central which way better! And it was only a 3-star hotel and cheaper!! I would not be so critical of the Time hotel if Expedia did not list as an upscale hotel. If it was a 2-star rating I would consider it decent, but when you are looking for a 4-star hotel it should be represented as 4-star quality!!

Reviews.Title: “For a good time in the Big Apple, don't try The Times!”
Reviews.Author: VWMAYER
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great time in New York, check THE TIMES off your list! For $315 a night (1 bedroom suite), this hotel was a major ichhhhhhh! During a January stay, our room registered at a balmy 82 degrees. Hotel maintenance came up to fix it while we went out to dinner. When we returned, we found that the door was left "propped" open with all of our belongings ready for the taking. The hotel management's response was, "Oh sorry. Maintenance was just up in your room a few minutes ago." To top it off, the room temperature was never correct during our 4-night stay. Then, as if this wasn't bad enough, our room did not get cleaned one night. When we came back to find a messy room, we were told that it was too late for Housekeeping to take care of things. Housekeeping missed our room the next day, too. After two calls, though, our room did get cleaned at about 5:30 p.m. From the moment we encountered the surly front desk clerk, I knew that prepaying my hotel stay was a BIG mistake!!

Reviews.Title: “Really convienient”
Reviews.Author: lneary
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff very friendly, had a late drink in bar, eva the barmaid was really nice and friendly. Great location, really central for everything, shows and tour buses. Walking distance of rockfeller centre, saks and fifth avenue. Subway is right down the street just a short walk. Had a blue room and it was nice, no tea and coffee facilites in room but didnt mind that as we didnt spend that much time in room and some lovely coffees places everywhere in New York that you would not be bothered by this. Would stay here again and have recommended it already to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel in a great Theater District location”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasOrchid
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one-bedroom suite plus an adjoining room with double beds during a six-night trip with our family of four (two teenage girls) plus my mother-in-law. Our primary objective was to find a hotel with a good location for walking to theaters that had a room with double beds available. Since we were in New York post-Christmas and through New Year's hotel availability in the Times Square area was very limited. On the plus side, the hotel is in a good location on 49th Street just off of Broadway. Restaurants and theaters are within easy walking distance as are the yellow line subway stop and Rockefeller Center. The hotel is small and the street is relatively quiet so we were never bothered by street noise nor did we hear anything from other hotel guests. We were half a block from the BellyDelly Deli on Broadway, which made morning stops for muffins and coffee very convenient. The beds were comfortable although the pillows were the hardest I have ever seen in a hotel, despite the fact that I like firm pillows. Although we would be willing to stay here again if we were unable to find a better hotel choice, there were quite a lot of negatives especially since we were paying a high price for the hotel due to the holiday. The rooms were clean but every piece of upholstered furniture was significantly stained and ratty looking. There are no coffee pots in the rooms. The door mechanism was broken on the suite's bedroom door so that it wouldn't stay closed. The sink stopper was completely broken in the suite's bathroom so that it stayed closed all the time, and there was no stopper at all in the bathtub. None of the remote controls worked for the three flat screen TVs in the rooms, but the hotel did replace the batteries at our request and then they worked. Closet space is extremely limited even for a New York hotel. It would be sufficient for a two night stay, but not for six nights. The suite had a small dresser with six drawers but there were no drawers at all in the room with double beds. The desk staff was reasonably friendly but even after discussing the fact that we were in adjoining rooms with my mother-in-law (who checked in before we arrived), they put her in a room that didn't have an adjoining room at all, much less a suite. When we arrived and went to our room (after the desk clerk again told us that we were in adjoining rooms), we discovered that they had put us in rooms that were on different floors. We had to move my mother-in-law who had unpacked and moved into the room and there was no apology or offer to help. There was nothing terrible about this hotel but there was nothing great either. The hotel's strong points are its location and the quiet rooms. Everything else is adequate but needs more attention.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: TheWander3r
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we were given a room that hadn't been cleaned -- The shower had open bottles of shampoo, the trash cans were full, and the linens were questionable. We asked to be moved to another room, but were told they were booked for the evening. When pressed, they finally said they had a larger room available -- Not sure why they didn't offer that option immediately. The shower curtain didn't reach all the way to the floor, so the bathroom floor was flooded after I took a shower. The closet structure didn't allow for hanging anything longer than a shirt. The front desk staff seemed distracted and disinterested. The location was good -- quick walk to theaters, and I liked the lounge, however I would not stay here again due to the apathetic service and bathroom flooding tendency.

Reviews.Title: “not such a nice experiance for a Holiday stay”
Reviews.Author: aloe78
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Dec 23rd and checked in with no major problems. I was actually surprised that the room was pretty big. We booked a king size bed and we chose room with a bath. Since we had friends coming over we really did not spend much time there. When we got back the room spelled like a cigarette smoke and my partner went to change it, it was 1am and I really wanted to sleep. They offered us room next to our on the 16th floor, I did not like it, because it was smaller, but after checking out two more rooms we stayed there. The other rooms as well smelled like cigarette smoke and the floors were more dirty compare to our 16th floor. The heat did not want to work for us and he wind was blowing and the windows did not seal, so we had kind of chilly night. At least the water was warm in the morning. I was thinking to change the room, but I had no energy to do so. We needed the internet, the connetion promised was boradband, but the speed was a snail one and luckly the charge for it was taken of the bill. Next dissappointment happen on Boxing Day when we order a room service for breakfast and it did not arrive and the reception was looking ofr excuses instead of taking care of it. We were very happy with concierge and bellboys.

Reviews.Title: “expensive, but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: markymark999
Reviews.Content: booked this direct with the hotel, as it wasnt any different from online quotes (we are just back and obviously it was a busy period in the run up to Christmas). We received a very warm welcome from reception and were informed that we had been upgraded to a king-sized room (though i think they just meant the bed and not the room) None the less the room was clean and the bed very comfortable, toiletries were luxurious and restocked daily. We were at the front of the hotel on the 12th floor, and were not disturbed by traffic noise at all. The room was expensive at $450 per night, and when you add occupancy tax and sales tax and all that other kind of stuff, it does turn out quite pricey. Sunday nights the price does drop though by 50%. Overall a good stay, we had a meal in Serafina the hotel restaurant the same as a much more popular one of the same name downtown. Food was good and not unreasonably priced. Location was good, right across the road from where Chicago is on show. But there are plenty of other hotels in the area to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible cesspool”
Reviews.Author: MonsieurBon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Time Hotel for 7 nights last week. The first indication of a problem at the Time Hotel was when I arrived around 11pm. The counters in the lobby were covered in papers, and two people were working behind them. I stepped up, and stood there for five minutes as they shuffled papers around. These papers had people's personal information on them, I noticed, which I could read. Eventually, one of the men, without looking up, asked if he could help me. I checked in and went to my room, 1202. I went to my room. There was mold on the ceiling in the bathroom, the shower door would not close completely, the floor was dirty, and it was quite warm (78F) in the room. Also, one of the reading lights for the bed was broken and held together with plastic zip ties. I discovered this when I cut my finger on the broken, jagged edge of it. I turned the A/C on and opened the windows. The climate control unit did not really seem to respond to the settings that I made on the thermostat, and even with the window open, I was only able to get it down to 73F. This was pretty warm for me. I called the front desk and they said an engineer would take care of it, which never happened. Since the shower door didn't close, water would get everywhere when I showered, which probably didn't help the mold problem on the ceiling. The shower itself was dingy, as was the rest of the bathroom, with peeling caulk everywhere. The minifridge was warm and smelled terrible inside. There was also an orange fluid dripping out of it. After two days of the hot, dirty room, I went to the front desk and complained. Christine was quite pleasant and apologized, offering to move me to another room. She gave me a room key and asked me to check it out. I went to the room and looked inside. It was much like the room I was currently in, with a couple differences. One, there was what can only be described as bodily fluids or mucus smeared on the coverlet, and a good 30-40 hairs of various lengths and varieties on the pillows and sheets. I went downstairs and asked to see another room. She gave me another key. This time, the key opened the lock, but it was locked from the inside and I heard voices from within. I went downstairs and Christine asked a bellhop to escort me to another room. I went to the room and looked around. It seemed clean and with no mold. I moved my stuff into the new room and thanked Christine for her trouble. That night was very cold and windy outside. despite the windows being closed tightly, I could feel a very cold breeze coming through them. I set the thermostat to 70F and turned the heat to high. The night seemed strangely cold. Upon waking, I discovered that the room temperature had dropped to 59F, which is pretty cold. I called the front desk and told them that I had no heat, and they apologized and said they would have an engineer look at it. When I returned home after an 18 hour day at the office, it was 58F in the room, which was colder than before! I went down to the front desk and explained that I was sick of moving around from tiny, dirty, broken room to another. The man apologized and took me to a suite, room 906. We inspected it together, and it seemed OK, if not still a little dirty. This was a nice corner suite, with a lot of windows. The bathroom had the first shower I had used where the shower curtain was long enough to prevent water from getting on the floor. The toilet was loose, and clunked from side to side when I sat on it or moved on it. The climate controls in the rooms seemed not to function at all, yet it stayed at about 70F, which was acceptable, although without the ability to turn a fan on, I still had to sleep with earplugs, as the street outside was quite noisy. About every 45 minutes there was a loud ka-chunk from something that I think was on the building right outside my room. Not sure what it was. My internet service went out in the suite while I was using it. I called the front desk, and the engineer was there in a few minutes. Such fast service on the internet but nothing for heat?!?! He tested it and made a phone call from my room to tech support. He then played with my cable box, which fixed the static on the TV, but still no internet. The next morning, my last, my bill had the charges for the internet that didn't work and a phone charge for when the engineer made the call from my room. I called the front desk and asked them to fix it. I came back from breakfast and checked out. The bill had not been corrected. I tried to explain it, but they didn't seem to understand, as they had already reversed a double-charge for internet when I had moved rooms the first time. Finally, they understood and adjusted the bill. I would never, ever, ever, ever, stay at the Time Hotel again. It is dirty, unpleasant, broken, and not worth your time or money. Every fixture and piece of furniture is splattered in paint from hasty repainting jobs. Light switches are broken. Things are poorly thought out, such as the closets whose hangar bars stick out, but not far enough to actually access anything but the first item on the bar. I would compliment the staff on at least trying to respond to my concerns, even if the hotel is so far gone they have little control over its quality.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Exceeded”
Reviews.Author: EGS11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Time week-end of Dec 1, 2007. It was our first visit and our expectations were exceeded. Our suite was lovely and provided ample room. We were very impressed that the room was stocked with extra pillows and towels (we always have to request them). Staff was friendly and courteous. Room service was the quickest we've had in all our travels. Had dinner at the hotel restaurant Serafina. Food was delicious and prices reasonable. One of the best features of the hotel is the location to theaters, Times Square, etc. We would definitely stay at the Time again. It is WELL-MANAGED and we HIGHLY RECOMMEND it.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the rest in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMark
Reviews.Content: I cringe when this place costs $350 a night, but when you realize what everything else costs in Manhattan this time of year, it's acceptable. I think of it as the "best of the rest" (of mid-tier hotels in Times Square). The rooms are clean and amenities are nice. Mine had windows that looked out onto nothing. The furniture and decor is supposed to feel modern, but it's really seems sort of cheap and dated. It certainly isn't a space you want to spend much time in (the room or the hotel). I've stayed here many times, yet the staff always asks me if this is my first time staying at the hotel. Everyone is efficient, but doesn't really convey any sense of the hotel itself. They seem to be content with doing their job.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Ideal Location, Loved It”
Reviews.Author: sar86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week the beginning of November. Ideal location, is located right on Times Square but from the hotel rooms you wouldnt think so as it is so quiet. Rooms are spacious enough, very well decorated. Loved it, when i return to New York again i would definately stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Harrassed 3 times before 10am on morning of check out”
Reviews.Author: nybluesguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the Time hotel, it is fine, fairly average for New York, small rooms but clean and great doormen. Not worth a review in either direction until the morning of check out when we were DISTURBED THREE TIMES BEFORE TEN AM We knew that they were booked at full occupany and needed a prompt check out at 11am as stated, but we were not prepared for the rudeness with which we were treated that morning. 8.15am telephone call - "did we have a problem with our safe?" "no" 8.30am knock on door - "had we asked for someone to be sent up from downstairs?" "no, definately not" 9.30am second knock on door - "when did we think we might be checking out?" "please stop harrassing us, we're awake , packed and leaving alright!!" This is an unforgivable strategy to ensure our prompt check out. They started 'accidently disturbing' us nearly 3 hours ahead of the scheduled check out time. The first two time I could have considered an honest mistake, by the third time I was suspicious and when I asked a fellow guest who was leaving the hotel at the same time as us... suprise suprise, they had also been disturbed twice that morning. We ended up checking out an hour early (which I am sure they were pleased about) but will NEVER stay there again (which they should consider when they next try this tactic.) and were so angry about this treatment that I have written a review for the first time ever (which I hope will mean they really reconsider this tactic) This ruined what would have been a perfectly reasonably stay, unless you have an early flight out I would not recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Time For TheTime..........”
Reviews.Author: northnash
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Time November 18-19. I got a great rate by booking thru TRAVELZOO for $151 a nite. I arrived at the hotel around 11am not sure if my room would be ready. I was told no rooms were clean as yet--that was fine. I went back at 2pm and rooms still not available--so i told the desk i would return after my matinee show. I returned about 7pm and was given keys to my room. I was put in one of the hotels red rooms. The Time uses red, blue or yellow as the room colors. I was pleasantly surprised at the size of my room. It was a fun decor and really comfortable. The room had windows but looked into another builidng. They had been covered with blinds but highlited by decorative lighting that was cool. The bathroom was nice wtih a great shower. i liked the turndown service with two Time chocolates and a card telling me the weather forecast for the next day. Only a few suggestions--each time i approached the front desk-agents were not quick to acknowledge me. They seemed to be engaged in personal conversations. But once they saw me they were helpful. In the room, the bathroom faucet was broken so the handle came off in my hand--yet i was able to get water. Also, the toilet seat was not properly tightened. I let the front desk know of both of these issues. The Time is a great Times Square location. I definitely will stay at The Time --time after time.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: mfg7102
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay in NY about every 7 weeks for a weekend. I have stayed at this property before and would have told you it was wonderful, but boy have things changed. First I understand the property is under new management so that may explain some of the problems. On arrival we were told that their once very lively and entertaining lounge was closed down by the BD of Health. Next the phone in our room was broken, the television was broken, the computer modem was broken and last but not least the air conditioner was broken. In order to call the front desk I had to get an outside line and call the hotel directly to get any help with these problems. The television sensor was broken and it took an engineer to actually figure it out. It then took an engineer to install a completely new modem and the engineer was never able to figure out the a/c. Bright spot the engineer was a great guy we became fast friends as a result of all our contact. Also Kevin the doorman was great and should probably leave for a better gig. At over 400 a night this is certainly not the place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Super Time!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaGirl02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Time again this past weekend. Kudos to the hotel - the staff were so friendly and helpful, and the vibe was fun and hip. Thought the fish tank was really cute and the apples at turn down was a nice surprise (and the chocolate yummy!) The front desk said they are opening a new restaurant and I look forward to coming back and trying it. Thanks for another great stay~

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bastou60
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Time for 2 nights for business. Finding a hotel last minute in Midtown is hard, I was a bit anxious about the Time by reading the reviews but was only positively surprised. I have never found an hotel so calm, you can't even hear one car honk. The bed is comfortable, with good linens and pillows, service is good. I had a king size room, the size was just big enough. The only negative thing is that the shower pressure is not high enough. The gym is definitively not high end (only 1 cardio machine works out of 3), but since there is no one using it, it's not a problem. would go back for the location, the bed and the tranquility.

Reviews.Title: “Serious problems - bed bugs, restaurant closed by health dept.”
Reviews.Author: RHIA0
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was extremely disappointing. We were greeted upon our arrival by protestors outside the hotel with a giant inflatable rat. The restaurant under "renovation" had actually been closed by the health department because of a rat problem. There was a health department closure notice posted inside the hotel. By the third day of our stay (our departure day) I had started to break out with red itchy welts all over my legs. When it finally dawned on me that they were bed bug bites I attempted to contact the manager on three different occaisions. He was gone for the day, at lunch, and in a meeting. I can only assume that the management of this hotel is totally indifferent to the concerns of their guests. I just wanted some assurance that the hotel would take care of the problem so no one else would have to experience the misery of these bites. The hotel is in a great location but I would not recommend it to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite luxury boutique, but great value in Theater District”
Reviews.Author: BCrump
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for its great location and because we like small, service-oriented luxury boutique hotels (e.g. International House in D.C., Madison Hotel in Memphis, etc). At the Time, our King room was small (to be expected) but nice. Front desk staff was polished and helpful, but the rest of the staff was pretty rough around the edges. They didn't have the level of formailty and courtesy we typically expect at hotels like this. (Housekeeping, for example, was carrying around the fresh linens in giant, black unsighly Hefty bags which filled the narrow halls each morning.) And unfortunately, the kitchen was closed for renovations during our stay and the hotel put on a free daily continetnal breakfast on the rooftop to compensate. Pulling off the breakfast was too much for the poorly trained staff, who let the coffee pots sit empty for long periods of time while they relentlessly asked people for their room number. All in all, we did enjoy our stay. The location is right in the middle of all the Broadway theaters and the rooms were quiet and well equipped. The service level wasn't top notch, but pretty much what we expected for the very attractive price.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan_Peeters
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Time over the weekend and it was LOVELY - very centrally located to some of the best sights in Manhattan like Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Times Square, Broadway Theaters - also also close to transport which was great since there were lots of other parts of the city I wanted to explore outside of midtown. The rooms were totally modern and very nicely decorated - the beds were SO COMFORTABLE and the hotel staff were more than helpful in suggesting sightseeing tours and restaurants and were also amazingly friendly! There is a great bar/lounge which was perfect for nighttime drinks after a long day on the town! Best part is that even over the weekend our rates were totally reasonable - I would definitely stay at The Time again and would suggest you to do!

Reviews.Title: “A glorious nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: MosiacArtist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very hip' with a perfect location. I found the staff to be knowledgable and courteous starting from the door man then leading up to my room. What more can I say! Oh yea, I had a very dreamy nights sleep with the fluffiest pillows and down comforter, my friends had to drag me out of bed!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Time Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dawnny123
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the Time Hotel...the rooms are beautiful and the staff is very nice and helpful. I also love the location, in the middle of times square...close to everything

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blubery79
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with a group of girls for my bachelorette party. What a great location right in the middle of NYC what more can you ask for. Walking distance to Time Square, great restaurants and bars locally. The hotel has a great modern atmosphere and the rooms are decorated in bold colors. My room was BLUE!!! The staff at the hotel was great anything we needed from ice, toothbrushes, to wine openers. Very pleasant. The bar located in the lobby is a great place to meet with your guests and have a drink. While your there check out the seahorses they are soo adorable..even when they are sleepin at 2am. I would definitely recommend this hotel to all girls looking to stay at a hot spot in the city. Thank you Time Hotel for making my bachelorette weekend one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: ksoldati
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel. We spent 7 nights there. The location is fabulous!!! It is in a central location. It was very quiet. We never heard a sound from anyone around us. We were on the 4th floor. I loved the way it was decorated. The room was small, but cozy. The staff was very helpful with everything from directions to reservations. I can't think of one bad thing to say about this hotel. We loved it and will stay there again next time we're in NYC! :o)

Reviews.Title: “Just okay...”
Reviews.Author: ipolani
Reviews.Content: I was at The Time for a couple nights while on business in Times Square. Although the experience was okay, I probably will not be returning. The service was, again, just okay. Very nice at the front desk but slow. Room service very slow. The room itself was a typical small NYC hotel room but I was shocked to see a full-sized bed when I had specifically requested a king (my husband was with me). We ended up moving hotels because we just couldn't get comfortable in that bed and they could not move us to another room. The decor is minimalistic, which is fine, but it didn't feel very comforting.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuruGomez
Reviews.Content: We booked our holiday in New York on Expedia. We like the pics of The Time hotel and were just as pleased when we arrived. The room was a nice size for NY measures. The bathroom was nice with walk in shower with TWO shower heads..one in the back and in the front!!! The decor was hip and contempoary. The flat screen HGTV was 32" ...very nice. Dislikes: LOL the window in our room could be opened all the way with no safety feature!! Anybody ,after a few stiff drinks could jump right out and land face first in the street. Breakfast at the hotel was continental and mediocre at best....they charged us 15USD!!!! How silly were we?! Likes: My guy and I wanted to go to Fire Island for a day and we had no clue what the ferry schedules were...the hotel manager did a google search and printed out the ferry schedules and sent them with us she even gave us a LIRR map. Staff was very friendly and if you asked a question they did not know they looked it up right away. Overall this hotel was a great find and very well decorated at a very nice price.....OH and LOVED the eggs under the elevator how clever!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: GT_Marketing
Reviews.Content: Good stuff: Great location! Convenient to subway stations and Times Square. My room was tidy, mostly clean, and most importantly QUIET! Staff was courteous and friendly too. Semi-bad stuff: I paid for a Queen size bed, and they even confirmed that when I checked-in, but the bed in the room was a double bed. My husband is a tall man so it really cramped his style. Not sure what happened there. We werenâ€™t in our room very much and we did not have time to complain about it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a fun stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: brinkleyc
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this is a perefect place to stay in New York. Anyone who has issues with the room sizes is crazy. They are small, but who actually spends their day in New York in their ROOM????? A city with tons of places to eat and things to see and do, you aren't spending every second in the room. But, the time I did spend, was perfect and all we needed. My boyfriend and I stayed in a double. It was all we needed. Close to the subway and the concierge was sooo helpful. They helped us get around on the subway, offered us a complimentary umbrella when it rained. We were also going to Long Island and the concierge helped us with trains and the Long Island Transit schedule. ALL YOU NEED FOR A GREAT STAY IN NEW YORK AT A GREAT PRICE.

Reviews.Title: “Please Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Sussman79
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a stay at the Time hotel and this place is truly horrendous. Upon arrival, I learned that they did not have my reservation and I had to wait 20 mins for them to figure out what's wrong. The room at the hotel was small and dirty. My carpet had stains on it. Worse was the bathroom which is so tiny that you have to shower in a little corner of the bathroom with a curtain to hide you. The Time is not a luxury hotel; it is the same as a cheap motel except for the fact that it has a nice lobby. Do not be fooled by the fancy lobby and lounge, the hotel is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the Broadway fan”
Reviews.Author: Melanie_from_Chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Time for a long weekend in June and it fit our needs perfectly. Room: We had a standard room and it was tiny, but who goes to NY just to hang out in their room? Modern decor, nice large plasma TV, great toiletries, nice robes available in room. It was kept very clean and that's the important thing. The cleaning lady was great and super friendly. Service: The lobby staff was courteous. No complains here. Location: It's perfect for the Broadway fan. We ended up seeing 5 shows in 3 days. The hotel is actually located right next door to "Spring Awakening" and across the street from "Chicago"...just a block or so away from Times Square. Overall: This is a great hotel, nicely converted from what I'm guessing was an old apartment building. 2 elevators are available for the 14 or so floors, which were tiny and somewhat slow. It wasn't that big of a problem, but sometimes the elevators can get crowded at certain times. They were still doing some renovations by the lobby when we went. However, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: travelingtg
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, fantastic location, helpful and friendly staff, modern rooms--a fantastic spot for a stay in NYC. I will definitely stay there again if I get the chance, and will recommend it to friends visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: leavinguk
Reviews.Content: The Time was the second NY hotel we stayed in on a trip to the US late last year. We also stayed at the Hotel Chandler, also a small boutique hotel and one that it has to be said totally outclassed this one. LOCATION: Superb, right next to TImes Square and all the hustle and bustle. HOTEL: Swanky and shiny. Modern. SERVICE: Arrogant. The atmosphere was cliquey and had an air of "you are lucky to be staying here." We had one reason to call reception which was being unable to get any channels on our very flash plasma screen. No-one ever turned up to sort it out, and we found out in the moning when we found a lump in the bed that there was in fact a seperate cable remote. Someone could have pointed out that there were two remotes when we called with the problem. ROOM: This is where the problems are. It was TINY - I know all Manhattan rooms are small but these really are, and they are poorly designed. Everything looks too big for the room, especially the plasma screen. Indeed it is nice to have a Bose Waveradio to play with, but it took up nearly all of the bedside table, leaving no room for the phone, which was shoved on length-ways. Petty I know but it made an incredibly small room look untidy before you rolled your suitcase in. The room just said "crashpad" and not "boutique hotel room." The bathroom was nice and very clean,and actually seemd quite spacious compared to the room itself. There were Molton Brown toiletries as I recall which is always nice. BAR: Very shiny and sex in the city, with expensive but reasonably well made and strong cocktailsl. Very quiet though even on Friday night. Loud hip-hop playing (DJ) but no dancing. RESTAURANT: We had a superb meal, and being our last night, pushed the boat out and had oysters, cocktails and some awesome red wine, on which we spent twice what we had intended (very good friendly waitress had polished sales skills!) Although very well cooked everything was rather heavily salted - but we are quite fussy foodie types and the meal was still excellent. OVERALL: There's nothing hear to worry about and it is a funky, central place, but it just didn't feel like true quality behind the pretentiousness. If you are young and plan to be out all the time you may well like it, but to us this wasn't a true boutique hote.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: talpal
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Time b/c of it's location. It's is right across the street from the theater where Chicago is playing. The Gershwin is right down the street and Time Square is right around the corner. It's a few blocks over from great shopping and Rockefeller Center and short walk to Central Park. The room was very clean and nicely appointed. The room had an awesome flat screen tv and very nice updated bathrooms. The staff was extremely accommodating and offered great recommendations for eating and night life. They offered turn down service complete with a chocolate on your pillow! Great value, awesome location, paired with a friendly, knowledgeable staff - what more could you ask for! I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: covcat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the time hotel twice in the last 2 week once for 3 nights and also for one night on both occasions found the hotel to be great. great spot near time square the hotel was quiet at night with great facilities in the rooms flat screen tv etc. the rooms were spotless clean and all the staff were most helpfull the lad on concierge was great helped us with directions many times. got a good deal via travelzoo will return on my next visit to ny

Reviews.Title: “Still Sexy In The City!!”
Reviews.Author: Mistiza3
Reviews.Content: The Time Hotel in Times Square fails to disappoint!! This was my second stay at the hotel and The Time still leaves me feeling sexy in the city!! The courteous wait staff, hip lounge, and comfortable room were very refreshing after a day in the city. The suite was super roomy with a very comfortable bed and great jacuzzi bath tub. I won't stay anywhere else when I travel to NYC. If you want the royal treatment, then come to the Time Hotel, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Don't spend time at the Time, and you'll have a good time”
Reviews.Author: jddssc121
Reviews.Content: Location location location. that's what this hotel has going for it. It's right off Times Sqaure, and for the price, it can't be beat. PROs: location. competent staff. clean. safe Cons: Microscopic rooms (welcome to NYC), hotel itself is tiny. bar downstairs looks cool, but has poor service. Stay here, but don't stay here........drop your bags, be thankful you're in the heart of Manhattan, and get out and see the sights. If you're looking for a hotel to spend a lot of time IN, this is not the place for you. If you're looking for a place that you can just use to sleep and shower, then this place works great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - better if they'd sack housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Ulster_Tripper
Reviews.Content: The first impression we got of the Time was absolutely fantastic. I had read some of the reviews and was a little wary about the level of service. However, we were met at the door by a great doorman who took care of all our baggage and directed to reception to be met with equally friendly and efficient staff who processed us very quickly and within a few minutes of arriving we were in our room with the baggage delivered. Again the bellman who delivered the bags was very helpful and answered any questions we had. The room wasn't huge, but in New York none of them are, but it was fairly well appointed, and the nice touches such as the Bose radio are very good. The bathroom was small also, and the only problem I found in there was that the shower leaked somewhat and needed towels down to soak up the water. We didnt bother complaining about this as it wasnt so bad as to affect our holiday and we just put down used towels to soak up the water. The nice cosmetics provided were good. If I did have to put down one complaint it would be regarding housekeeping. On at least 2 of the 6 mornings we were staying there they knocked the door to come in, despite us having turned on the 'do not disturb' sign. Even on the other mornings housekeeping were extremely loud in doing their business and we could hear them talking loudly and banging doors. Maybe we should have got up a little earlier, but I didnt feel it was so late that they should be making the noise they were. Also one evening there was a disturbance outside the door with people talking 'very' loudly into walkie-talkies - after a little panic, wondering was the hotel being evacuated we discovered it was housekeeping again, just checking if everything was ok. I asked for some more towels as there had only been 3 left that day and I wanted another. The person obviously didnt speak english so i pointed to a towel and was told that one would be coming, however none arrived. The problems with the housekeeping though were minor enough not to have affected our stay. The hotel is in a fantastic location and I would recommend to anyone else going to New York. Its really only 2 minutes from Times Square and close to anywhere you'd want to go. I was also pleasantly surprised at the prices in the mini-bar, we bought several items, and a beer was only a few dollars and other snacks were cheap. The hotel looks really good, the service on the doors etc is great and if they had managed to keep housekeeping quiet then I would have no problem giving them 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “A Fun Time At The Time”
Reviews.Author: facchino
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a Saturday night at the Time on a visit to see the broadway show '110 In The Shade'. It would be easy to criticize the Time based on the fact that the toilet overflowed and the batteries for the remote control were fading when we first arrived. Likewise, the front desk was hectic and confusing like a youth hostel opposed to a boutique hotel. Some of these small problems could be fixed with better management, but the positives of the hotel far outweighed the negatives. The Time is a boutique hotel and as such, they get the most important aspects right. Many of the previous reviews were critical of the small rooms. Noting that, we stayed in a king size deluxe room which wasn't large, but was roomy. The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept on - and I'm a frequent traveller. And the large flat screen t.v. placed on the wall in front of the bed actually made the smaller room more pleasurable for snuggling with my wife and watching television. Finally, the shower and toiletries were excellent. Above all, the room was very clean and functional. The Time is a fun hotel for the adventurous traveller who is looking for an alternative to boring chain hotels or the Grand Dame stodginess of old New York hotels. I would definately recommend the Time for a weekend getaway - I'd just advise upgrading from the smallest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: soccermom51
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Time with two teenagers. Since we were there to see Broadway plays it was the perfect location. Staff was fine, rooms seemed a little dated, great TV. Best thing was the location, near all of the theaters and Times Square. Got a good deal contacting the website with a discount code from Travelzoo. Overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Water Problem / Indifferent Service”
Reviews.Author: Lovestotravel56
Reviews.Content: Wow, I just read a couple of review from folks who stayed at the Time around the same time I did and our experiences were pretty different. I was awakened one night at midnight by water cascading from the vent in the ceiling of my bathroom. Maintenance took 15 min. to get to the room for clean-up. It happened again the next morning. Each time, I was given a different explanation for the problem. I had to ask to be moved to a different room and it took the front desk all day to make one available for me. A promised call to my cell phone to tell me when I could move my things never materialized. The most frustrating part of the situation was that NO ONE apologized for the problem or the inconvenience. Overall, I found the staff unfriendly and indifferent to the guests. The common areas of the hotel are a little scuffed up and just this side of shabby. The room was nicely laid out, not too small for Manhattan, but again, the furnishings could have used some buffing and refreshing. The location is great if you want to be in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Times Square; otherwise, you're better off choosing a location a few blocks north, south, east or west. It was too crowded an area for me. I won't stay at the Time again.

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous Time at the Time”
Reviews.Author: Travel1076
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Times Square and the Theatre District this awsome hotel treated me like royalty. From the moment I arrived and the bell man opened the door, I knew this hotel was going to be luxurious. The room was decorated in vibrant colors and plush linens on the bed, and the bed was so comfortable after a long day of sight seeing. The staff was so friendly and wanting to help with anything I needed. The bar downstairs was soft and inviting, to make you want to sit down and have a drink, never intimidating. I definitely will return to The Time on my next visit to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed The Time”
Reviews.Author: JessRM
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay at The Time was good. It was in a fantastic location, just off Times Sqaure and we were there for New Years so we just walked straight out into all of the action! It was in midtown so we could get everywhere really easily. The bar was very nice and so was breakfast although it was a tad overpriced. The room service food was not so great and we got charged after we left for some room service we had paid for in cash. It seems as though the room service man must have pocketed the money and said we hadn't paid for it so that was a bit annoying. Apart from that the staff were very nice and there were always two people standing outside ready to help with bags or call a taxi. The bed were very comfy (very important!) and the bathroom was nice (moltan brown toiletries!) and the room was always cleaned very well every day. Overall, nice hotel, great location, I am still annoyed about the bloke pocketing our money though!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: MarketingMom
Reviews.Content: I made an error and booked my room one day earlier and the hotel was sold out on the day I showed up. They did everything possible to get me a room, checking their sister hotels, etc. The staff at the Times & their sister hotel, The Night, where absolutely incredible. I showed up late, they found me a room, did NOT gouge me on the price and the room was fabulous. I am a Hilton Honor & Westin member, and will stay at this family of hotels on all my trips to NY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dead cat test!”
Reviews.Author: TravelcatsSF
Reviews.Content: Stand in the middle of this $400 room and swing a dead cat by the tail and you could hit all four walls! The 'hotel' is a dark, rabbit-warren, of mazes, hallways and rooms. My tv barely worked, no music or DVD, NO CLOCK, and a tiny window looking at a wall of another building. Based on the line of people, including a colleague of mine, standing in line at the reception desk with complaints of reservations being dropped or lost, I'd say I wasn't alone in thinking this place is a HUGE RIPOFF! Oh by the way, they should force the 'designer' of this place to live in this dump as punishment for his sins.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: totalblamblam
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to NYC and my mom and I were quite nervous to visit this grand city. When we arrived to the hotel, very early in the morning by the way, they didn't exactly have our room ready which was understandable. They set our luggage aside and gave us tips on what we could do during the day. They were helpful on directions. When we got back to the hotel our room was ready and I was amazed to see little tv's in the hallways. It's a modern hotel for sure. Our rooms were small, but comfortable. On our last day my mom and I were discussing how we didn't run into the stereotypical "rude New Yorkers" and as soon as we said that two taxis were fighting with each other on who gets to take us to the airport. This made us very uncomfortable and the staff saw this and told them that it was settled that we had our own transportation. We were thinking "huh?" and they had a car service(don't know if it was theres) take us to the airport. The driver was very friendly. They saved the day. I enjoyed my stay there and would stay there again the next visit I have to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Defnitely a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: QCInspector
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel is over rated and nothing but hype! The quality and service definitely do not measure up to its "reputation". My partner and I arrive at the hotel after a 18-hour long flight at 8am. Despite our request through email for an early check-in, we were told to come back at 3pm. In their own words, "it's only a request". Can you imagine that we had to comb the streets of new york looking like zombies?? The receptionist was not helpful at all. The hotel was not well kept. The carpets (along the corridor and room) and the place just look OLD! When we finally got the room, it was not the colour theme that we had requested for (if they can't get this right, why bother to ask us in the first place when we did our booking?). But that was the last thing on our mind since we were both dead tired. The first impression of the room was BAD! Carpet is dirty (I wonder how often do they vacuum clean the carpet!). Necessities such as the bedroom slippers are also missing. The toilet door is faulty. The sheets are not even neatly pressed. The gym is pathetic! The treadmill's really old and they have limited equipments. It's okay if you just want a quick cardio exercise and get out of the tiny room or gym . Don't bother about the in-house breakfast! It's US$15 for a continental breakfast... way too pricey. Thank goodness, we didn't pay for the over-priced meal. My recommendation is try the deli around the area. Starbucks, Food Empire and McDonald's are just round the corner. I wonder how on earth does the hotel justify its rates?? There are better hotels in that area. The only consolation is that the hotel is located in a prime area and is near to the subway. The asian doorman is really helpful and friendly (the rest of the staff does not even know what does good service entail). Frankly, the review would have been better if the room rates were at 3-star prices (or even 2-star). Unfortunately, it's not the case. Having stayed at better hotels around the world, the Time DOES NOT offer good value for money. We will defnitely not return to this hotel. A hip hotel? Definitely far from it!

Reviews.Title: “NIce Time”
Reviews.Author: sgbslo
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for a couple of nights in NYC and found a decent rate at The Time. We stayed there once before several years ago. The first time we had a queen room which was pretty tiny. This time we had a king room which was a bit larger. The room was fine with a comfortable bed and nice linens. The bathroom was also fine with nice toiletries. The closet space is pretty limited. There is one sort of hanging area which has a fabric cover and is difficult to deal with. There is no restaurant at the moment but they offer a continental breakfast for $15 and it is not very good--we had it one morning because we were in a hurry but would have been better off getting a muffin from a bakery. The staff is pleasant but a little unpolished. Overall, it's a good place to stay if you're going to the theatre and if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: firsttimenyc
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip as a surprise for my partner's Birthday - our first trip together in New York... We had a fantastic time and we loved this hotel!!! I was concerned after reading reviews, regarding the size of the rooms especially as I booked it as a surprise. I was pleasantly surprised when we reached our room on the 15th floor. It wasn't huge, but we didn't expect it in New York City, it was definately bigger than what we expected. There was plenty of room, it was spotlessly clean and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was once again, very clean, had a small bath with a shower (which admittedly wasn't very powerful but ok). It was certainly not tatty as in other reviews, everything was in good order. The staff were all really helpful and friendly, especially the doorman. The location is brilliant, right around the corner from Time Square, only 15 mins or so walk away from Central Park and 10 min walk from the Empire States Building. We had a fantastic time, in an amazing City in a great hotel. We'll definately be back to New York and the Time Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great design and location”
Reviews.Author: dlelondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Time Hotel with my boyfreind, parents and my sister's family (including 2 kids aged 4 and 1) over the Thanksgiving holiday. It got off to a terrible start as I'd phoned in advance to book a cot for my 1 year old nephew. When we arrived on Thanksgiving we were told they didn't have any cots as they were a boutique hotel and my nephew would have to sleep on a sofa bed which was totally unacceptable for a baby. The staff did not seem concerned about this and did nothing to try and help. After unpacking my dad went back to reception to ask if there were any shops nearby where we could buy or hire a travel cot - it was a different woman on the desk and she immediately said they did have cots (cribs in America!) and fetched us one straight away. Aside from this bad start the hotel was great in every other way - fantastic location (a couple of minutes walk to Times Square), brilliantly designed rooms (and pretty spacious for New York - although not great views), very clean and no noise at night time. We didn't try out the bar as there were so many others to choose from nearby but we did buy breakfast there one morning which I wouldn't recommend - very pricey for a basic continental (plus we found it much more fun - and cheaper - to eat breakfast in the new york delis for that true NYC experience!) I would definitely recommend the Time for it's fantastic location and sleek design, but service did leave a bit to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “over priced!”
Reviews.Author: carotpa
Reviews.Content: We have have just returned form a brilliant 5 night stay in NY and stayed at the Time hotel for 2 nights. The location of the hotel is brilliant if you want to explore the more touristy areas. Its just off times square so you feel you are in the heart of it. However the hotel itself is only average. Our room was small (queen room) though not a problem BUT really in desperate need of a revamp. It looked really worn and grubby. The blinds were broken and torn and it needs decorating. We didn't have a view as we were at the back of the hotel and there was quite a noise coming from the generator but it didnt bother us too much. We didnt use the bar in the hotel as there are much better places to go. All in all a very average hotel, small tired rooms, no special details in rooms and expensive for what you get. We would not return.

Reviews.Title: “niceeee”
Reviews.Author: hunnykanaya
Reviews.Content: very nice nice hotel (dont touch the mini bar) i stayed in a king room ... nice design.. but small ish room.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for Location, Staff and Quietness”
Reviews.Author: bootykay
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just returned from a 5 nights' stay at this hotel. The overall experience really good. We had a superior room with a Queen size bed for an average 180 EUR per night ( = 225 USD total). I checked various travel metacrawlers - quotes were more or less the same, so we ended up booking via Sidestep. The deal was not available on the Time Hotel page, though. GOOD Location literally off Time Square. Our room on the 9th floor was pleasantely quiet (backside of the building). The room was small, but sensibly furnished, with a neat bathroom (Molton Brown supplies generously refilled by great housekeeping) and a large flat screen TV. We tried the continental breakfast once (15 USD), which was totally ok, again very nice staff. The restaurant on the Ground level was still in refurbishment, but getting a quick bite nearby (Food emporium etc.) is easy. Take away from Pongsri Thai on 48th and 8th highly recommended. The toilet's flushing broke once, but the manager send someone to fix it within 10 minutes. NOT SO GOOD Noise from the corridor can be very loud. Our neighbour for 3 nights apparently "ordered in" some female company at various times of the night(s). The ladies had difficulties getting into the room, but once inside, it got pretty quiet again. We informed the management about this upon departure - they seemed not suprised.

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: firsttimer123
Reviews.Content: Just back from our second stay in this great hotel. Rooms are small but spotless,with a safe and T.V Bathrooms are small no tub but a great shower.Hairdryer ,iron and ironibg board are all provided.No tea/coffee maker being the only drawback. Staff are friendly and willing to please and every request was met promptly. However what sells this hotel its its location. Right in the heart of theatre district,with everything close by. Can be expensive at times but we booked our stays through Quikbook.com and got good rates. Will be back in Ny in Sept and will definitely stay here if the rate is right

Reviews.Title: “good find in NYC”
Reviews.Author: AW07
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Time twice this month for work, and it was a great find. It's literally a block off Times Square, which depending on what you're in the city for, is either a great thing or a terrible thing. The rooms were very clean and big enough. It's a sort-of chic hotel, or a trying-to-be-chic hotel at least. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. My first visit I was in a handicapped room and there was no separate shower, so the water leaked all over the bathroom floor and into the bedroom. The second visit my room backed up to the elevator and it was fairly noisy all night. But both times I checked in rather late, and it wasn't bad enough to ask for a new room, just a minor inconvenience. If you've ever stayed in NY, you know to expect tiny rooms and expensive rates. My room ranged from $199 - $250 a night, plus $50 or so in taxes. All in all, I'd say the Time was a pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “best ever”
Reviews.Author: shopaholicScotland
Reviews.Content: this was the perfect location for our first time in nyc. the staff were most helpful and friendly. we had a one room suite and it was very spacious. the bathroom had a great shower over the jaccussi bathtub. plenty of Moulton Brown products available. would recommend this hotel to any of our friends or relations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ipumkin
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. The newly refurbished rooms are great. My one and only problem was that I had a corner room, directly above their bar/lounge/club. It was booked for a function on my last night, and the music did not stop pounding until 3 - 4am. Management compensated me appropriately, so I ended my trip happy, if a little tired. So make sure you get a room on a higher floor. (5th or above) The location, pretty much directly on Times Square was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “great location for 1st time visitor”
Reviews.Author: melaniee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Time for 5 nights. The rooms were small, but we expected that with the location. Located literally a block off of Times Square, a great area for someone who has never been there before. Its right across the street from where Chicago was playing. The staff was friendly and helpful whenever we had a question. We got some great reccomendations on food. Wouldn't recommend for family with younger children, but great for a young couple or friends traveling together. Also, you can't beat the price!!!!

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel, friendly staff and cool rooms”
Reviews.Author: charlie_dog
Reviews.Content: have stayed at many nyc hotels and know that they are not the largest rooms in the world. This hotel room was adequate, we were upgraded by a lovely receptionist. We were given a room with 2 king beds as the lady thought me and my sis in the same bed for 5 nights would begin to get uncomfortable. All this for free. Waiting to take us to the room was the lovely bellboy, very friendly, talkative (ok of course we tipped him) and helpful. Loved the hotel decor and tv on every floor in the wall. However, we were given a room next to this tv and discovered at 1am, severly jet lagged that the tv outside was blaring the news. Reception were extremely helpful, even though i was all confused and kept telling them there was a radio playing in the hall. They turned off the sound for the rest of our stay. The rooms have weird dimmers, you press the line in the wall and the lights dim, a nice touch i thought. The bathrooms were nice a double shower ie one shower on each corner of a double cubicle. Nice molton brown toiletries, but they were a bit sparse considering we were 2 sis wanting to use them (why use basics when you can have creme de la creme). Anyway asked the maid for some and she was happy to oblige with a handful of what i wanted. Very kind... I dont understand why previous reviews have said staff unhelpful as we did not find this at all. Really close to theatres so a bit packed on the sidewalk at times and the restaurant and bar filled up quickly. Very close to times square, this was handy as it was minus ten degrees and very COLD. Internet cafe a few doors away to left. Lovely italian restaurant out of hotel to LEFT and at end of the block cross the road (straight ahead on the corner) very cheap and lovely food. I would stay here again and thats surprising for me as Ihave never returned to same NYC hotel twice. They even had a turndown service and this was lovely after hard days shopping to come backto dimmed lights and the bose radio playing.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Time!”
Reviews.Author: wendybeth31
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel! The hotel made our trip! You will love the location. Everyone was so nice. We have stayed at many upscale hotels and this is now my favorite in NYC. I enjoyed the intimate feel and the modern decor. Book your tickets for the theater before you go it is the perfect location for dinner and a show. People that complain about the room size have not spent much time in NYC. A lot of New Yorkers live in rooms that size. We are just spending the night. Hope you have fun. We did!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: skowtowner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our first real trip to NYC. Our three night stay at The Time Hotel was a highlight of our trip. I have traveled widely and stayed at every level of hotel imaginable , but I can't recall being more surprised by the hospitality and kindness of a staff of people in the service industry then what we encountered at the Time. I had never heard of The Time until I ran into a wInter promotion deal they were running and did the necessary research and found the hotel to be intriguing, so we booked a King room for around $200.00 a night. While scanning other reviews, I was struck by the description of the hotel as eclectic, funky , and hip as well as the many references to the staff as being stiff, rude , or reserved. My experience was , yes the hotel is quirky as has been noted in previous reviews, but the staff was outstanding from the doormen to bellmen, front desk personnel to maid staff, from managers to bar staff. These people could not have been more welcoming or willing to please. An example. I drove into Manhattan on a Wednesday afternoon, found the Time, was greeted by the doorman who helped us unload our car , and then directed me to the parking garage across the street. While I attempted to park , my wife and our baggage were taken to the second floor reception area waiting my arrival.
