One problem, being a Wed. afternoon, the parking garages were filled with theater goer's cars for the matinees . Every parking garage in a two to three block area was filled, and as I proceeded to ride around the block for about twenty minutes the staff of The Time and my wife were becoming concerned for my whereabouts. Eventually , two of the staff were out on the street trying to wave me down to sit my car until a spot opened up. However, just as I pulled around for the third or fourth time I spotted a car leaving from across the street and secured a parking slot. On my arrival at the hotel, all were relieved I had survived my first adventure in the city. But I was really struck by the caring attitude the staff showed to me and my wife. As the week proceeded the staff would demonstrate this same attitude in a myriad of ways. They all enjoy their jobs and it showed. We were very impressed, and are glad that the New York stereotype was dismissed in our first hour in the city. Thanks to a great staff for making our trip special.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: rachc146
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for 4 nights with my 10 year old daughter. I paid $199 per night plus taxes which I thought was great value considering the excellent location - steps from Broadway, very close to subway,taxi rank outside,wide choice of restaurants, near to theatres and it was quiet too (7th floor). Yes the room was on the small side but adequate as we were out most of the time - clean and functional although not much space for unpacked clothes - only a few shelves - no drawers. Staff were very helpful - I couldn't work out how to change channels on the TV so reception sent someone straight away to help ( I was using the wrong remote !!). The floor in the shower was very slippery so take care! We liked Art Diner for breakfast - turn left onto Broadway - and also Backstage Deli was excelllent. Don't bother with the little underground Italian Da Marino (or something) nearby - it's nothing special. There is a great internet cafe a few doors down. The hotel cheerfully stored luggage after checking out until we were ready to go. On the whole a fantastic location - good hotel if you can get it for the right price. Value for money at the price I paid. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Small, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: DocJeff
Reviews.Content: I jumped at the opportunity to stay at a 4 star hotel in NYC when booking for a cheap rate on Hotels.com (roughly $99/night if memory serves). I've stayed at the Millenium Broadway (also 4 star), and this seemed to pale by comparison. Overall, the biggest flaw was not with rude staff or cleanliness but with the microscopic room. Literally, there is a queen bed that allows for about 2 feet on each side & a small bathroom right when you walk in. Some of the decor was... interesting... with eggs & eggcartons at the base of the elevator shaft. The design is quite modern, which suited me ok but not my wife. The staff was pretty responsive overall, but I'd have to say No to this hotel again if you actually enjoy staying at a place for more than just a bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: khamilton00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Time hotel for three days during Toy Fair in Feb 2007. While the room was EXTREMELY SMALL, I expected this. After all, it is NYC! The hotel is very hip and modern, and the location is GREAT! (walking distance to everything!) The bed was comfortable, pillows were soft, shower was great. We did not spend any time in the lounge or restaurant, but they both looked nice. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: librarygin
Reviews.Content: First, anyone who is expecting a spacious room in the city should be prepared to spend upwards of $500+ per night. The rooms at this hotel are typical of 90% of the hotels in the city and that's just how it is. We found our room to be clean and in a good state of repair - no weird smells, stains, frayed rugs, etc. The bed was comfortable although the pillows were a bit lumpy and uncomfortable. The website currently states that color coordinated candy and a scent are placed in the room but our room didn't have this. When we asked at the front desk, we were told that the service was discontinued and that the new website would be up in 5 weeks. this isn't a big deal and it's certainly not why we booked this hotel, but it would be nice to have up to date information.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay because...”
Reviews.Author: WorldwideTraveler001
Reviews.Content: ... if all of you who read this will book at The Time, the price will go up and I can not afford it anymore ;-) It is a great experience comparing to ordinary hotels like the boring Crowne Plaza next door. It is purely a designer hotel with good value for money when you see the NY rates; best location off Time Square; only 2 min walk to subway. The doormen and beel boys look more like secret service agents and are connected via head phones. Some female receptionists have their own way of communication (NY slang?), but if you see it as part of the whole concept, it is fine and can get used to it. The lounge-bar is next to the reception and busy with outside guests on weekend. Great atmosphere; they don't have a menue for drinks, so order what you like. Personally I didn't like the breakfast style, it is more something for busy travelers; very small choice on the buffet; but eggs etc to be ordered (and paid) extra. But that's the only thing what is better at Crowne Plaza. Room: Either in red, yellow or blue fabrics; flat TV with great sound and Bose radio are in the room, Molton Brown bath amenities and modern post cards as well as bathrobe but no slippers. Make sure to get the electric Do Not Disturb sign explained. It was on since the previous guest but not recognized. When the maid rings the bell it remains silent and she did not clean the room; had to call in the evening to get it done. Also the outside line was not working but could be fixed after 1 day. Overall I can recommend it to get a new experience in a great & modern atmosphere - but nobody is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyDiggs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Time a few weeks ago and had a great stay. We had booked the hotel thru Expedia. The Front Desk staff was excellent during our entire stay. The room was modern and looked good. Overall the only problem we had was that we found hair in the bathroom. We found this really disgusting and left a complaint at the desk. The Manager at the desk in the morning was great and he upgraded us to a large suite. The doorman was pleasant and the restaurant was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: TheatreFan2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 days at The Time. Very good service and excellent location for going to the theatre. Close to everything. Walking distance or one stop away on the the subway. Also great places to eat from "NYC good and cheap" to "very special and very expensive" very close by. The room is on the small side but comfortable, clean and kept that way daily. Didn't really use the lounge or bar; was a very busy place at theatre time. For what we paid for the room it was great...a few little things like the shower light going on and off (we called it the shower ghost) and had to check to see the door fully closed; other than that, a very helpful and friendly staff willing to take the extra few steps to get you what you need, or lead you in the right direction. Could have stayed in a hotel with a bigger room and paid twice the price, buy why? If your in NYC and staying in your room or eating at places that they have in your home town, you might as well have stayed at home. Have a great time, get out and see it all!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, clean room”
Reviews.Author: kleef
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from Dec 21st to Dec 27th, and found it to be a very good experience. We chose the king bed room and while not being large, was more than adequate for us. The room was clean and very quiet. The bathroom, while not spacious, was modern and clean. The shower was a bit funky though: There was no partition between the shower floor and the bathroom floor, and it could get wet and quite slippery. Also, there is a lack of storage space in the bathroom. When we checked in, we were informed that we would be charged for any items removed from the mini-bar, so we left it alone. That is common sense anyway. The room did not have a view. I don't know if other rooms have a view. The common areas and lounge are nicely kept. Obviously some thought has gone into the design concept of this hotel. We found the staff to be attentive and pleasant. It would have been nice to have wi-fi service available however. We would stay there again, and if you plan to see shows, the location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Forgot to make up the bed!”
Reviews.Author: Traveleur2006
Reviews.Content: We had booked a suite for three people in mid-December. The suite had a king size bed in one room and a pull out sofa in the other. The furniture has seen better days, but the room was okay other than that. When we returned to the room later that night, the king size bed had been turned down, but the sofa bed wasn't made up. We had to open it up ourselves to discover that the thin and sagging mattress had no bedding on it. We called housekeeping to have the bed made up. After several rings, the phone eventually went to the front desk. Someone from the hotel staff, but not housekeeping, eventually arrived with two sheets. He was very nice and did his best, but didn't bring a comforter or blanket. He said he would bring one, but then a different and considerably less friendly man brought a blanket that was filthy and had several holes in it. when we unfolded it. We called downstairs again for a replacement blanket and got one in about the same condition. The night reception desk man told us this wasn't his problem in that he was not housekeeping. We told him we wanted to speak to the hotel manager the next day but the manager never contacted us. Also, we wanted to have a quiet drink in the hotel before going to bed that evening. Although we had been told that the lounge would be open until 2am, the hotel turned the lounge into a night club on Friday night, with music so loud you could barely hear the rude man at reception, which was on the same floor. The restaurant downstairs was closed by 11pm on a Friday night, but they suggested we go out again and try a bar a few blocks away. We ended up using the mini bar in the room. Be forewarned that the hotel uses some strange system that charges you each time you remove an item from the floor level minibar refrigerator. Also, there were only two glasses in the entire suite. Obviously, we weren't calling housekeeping for another glass that night! Also, there was no coffee maker in the room, and the TV in the living room wouldn't change channels or turn off after we turned it on on Sunday morning. The very nice day staff at the front desk removed the excess mini bar charges and said it was a constant problem, but our complaints about the difficulties we had with the night staff were not addressed beyond a very sincere and friendly sorry. I travel a lot, and while the Time wasn't the worst place I've ever stayed, it would take one heck of a low rate to get me to consider giving them another chance. If I did ever end up there again, I would scour the room for problems at check in and plan to spend a couple of hours getting them straightened out while the day staff is still around.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly + Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Fredflint
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel to be greeted by friendly, efficient + helpful staff. Went to the room, 1616, to be greeted by a smell of vomit! Informed maid who cleaned carpet + sprayed airfreshner around. When we returned to the room it still stank! Then we noticed the noise.......the kind of noise you hear when you close your eyes on an aircraft, this went on 24 hours a day so we had 4 sleep deprived nights, not able to move rooms as hotel was fully booked and never found out what was causing the noise. On the 2nd day found vomit that I had been assured was cleaned up, got some cleaning materials and cleaned it up myself.......end of smell! As for the rooms, small and unimpressive. Great location but very busy, would stay in hotel away from Times Square next time. Loved New York and it's people, hated the Time Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on W49th Street”
Reviews.Author: all1an
Reviews.Content: This hotel is run by amateurs. Booked an online package that included parking and taxes. Only trouble the package was a mystery to the staff who was rude and argumentative when we tried to get the terms of the package applied. Of course, the parking garage did not want to honor the "free" parking and the manager of the hotel had to accompany me to the garage to straighten things out. Rooms were small and poorly maintained. Plumbing was substandard, for example, and carpets were worn and frayed. The king bed was soft and lumpy. Overall, a lousy experience and pricey to boot. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel, Room So Small You can reach the door laying in bed”
Reviews.Author: Trm420
Reviews.Content: I had to pay 500 dollars for the room, and when the bellman opened the door, I asked where the room was! This hotel located near Times Square in NYC is so small you can touch the door from your bed (I did!) If you can live with a shoebox sized room for 500 dollars, then there's the bathroom. The sink is the size you would find in a recreational vehicle. There is NO shelf in the shower for soap, shampoo or other amenities, and in the room I stayed in the smell of MILDEW permiated the entire bathroom. Oh yes, I almost forgot there are no washcloths in the bathroom and the only soap from the shower is a shotglass sized bottle of bath gel that is left on the floor of the shower. Ok, you still are sold with the location and can deal with the bathroom and the room. Don't pick up anything in the honor bar you don't want to buy. The thing is rigged to charge you if you pick something up.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: lindsey381
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 5 night stay at The Time. It was fine for what we wanted, it was clean, with good service, and a great location. Barely any closet space and very little room to stretch out made it hard for us and our luggage to fit into the room comfortably. Our room was small but we expected that. The hotel overall was about average. On Friday and Saturday night the lounge downstairs had some kind of party that we thought was going to ruin our night's sleep, but we were pleasantly surprised when we got off the elevator on our floor (the 9th) and couldn't hear a thing. I would stay there again if I was stopping in on a short trip, but if staying for a while I would opt for another more spacious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints Here”
Reviews.Author: fireball47
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife and infant son, and we had a very pleasant stay. It's in a great location, the rooms were very reasonably priced compared to the competition, the room was perfectly clean, and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Of course, the room wasn't large, but we didn't expect it to be. The staff basically fulfilled all of our needs and did so promptly and kindly. They provided us with a pack-and-play for the baby to sleep, and they replaced it hastily when we found the first one to be broken. They answered all of our questions, gave us ice and other anemities on demand, and let us keep our luggage there hours before checkin. We would definitely stay there again, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a great location for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in Penthouse for 1 Nite!”
Reviews.Author: Eddymo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a weekend getaway w/ an american express offer (15% off a nite for a king bed). Although it was still pricey at over $300 a nite, it was worth the money. The location cannot be beat as it is situated within walking distance to Times Square, subway, Moma, Rockefeller, Central Park and many decent restaurants. Service: Upon our arrival, the desk guy seemed a bit preoccupied at first but eventually checked us in. Due to overbooking and our late 2am arrival, we were given a substantial upgrade to the Penthouse Room for one night. The next morning, despite arriving late we were allowed to sit for breakfast in the hotel restaurant/ lounge (which was ok, however i would recommend nearby french bistro Pigalle on 8th). Rooms: Our first night was in the Penthouse. Overwhelming at first, the room is 3 levels and equipped w/ bar, sauna, two bathrooms with jacuzzi tubs, exterior terrace on two levels and plasma tv's everywhere. Although very nice, it seemed a bit beat up in some areas and mechanical noises could be heard throughout the night coming from next door. Also, the lighting is tricky. The standard king room was NY small but clean and well equipped w/ refrigerator, comfy bed and enough towels to dry you for a week. The bathroom was also small but clean and nicely fitted with modern fixtures, shelves and magazines for those who like to read in there. Cons: Im all for cool design elements, but the fancy light dimmers in both rooms were at times difficult to operate. The only full length mirror is inside the cramped bathroom and guests have to step out to the mirrored elevator area to fully check themselves out. The Time was a very nice stay. The look is sleek and contemporary and may appeal to the traveller who favors that over traditional hotel design. The lounge seemed like a happening place on saturday nite w/ people lining up outside.

Reviews.Title: “Horrifying”
Reviews.Author: NYCtoSV
Reviews.Content: Having moved out of NYC 5+ years ago, I find myself traveling back for work constantly. I think I have stayed in the majority of NYC hotels that bill themselves as 4 & 5 stars. I have never before been tempted to write a review, mostly because my experiences ranged from good to outstanding. This time, I just can't help myself. I arrived this past Sunday and was greeted at the desk by a woman who could not be bothered to look up from whatever it was she was doing. I stood there for a few minutes until she finally acknowledge me by snipping, "just wait a minute." I did. And then 5 more. Eventually she spoke to me, found my reservation, ignored all my questions -- she literally did not respond to simple inquiries like "where is the elevator?" -- and handed me the keys to Room 1416. Now I knew the room was going to be small, but small combined with dingy and dark does not begin to capture the gloom that awaited me in the (open) security-gate-windowed nightmare. The first thing that came to mind was the scene in the movie "Big" when Tom Hank's and his friend walk into the flop house room that he has been forced to take because he could not go home suffering from his newly-minted grown-up condition. I tried to turn on the overhead light only to discover that the switch was broken. When I called down to ask to have someone come up and take a look, the woman who answered could not have been nastier; I decided that rather than dealing with her, I would rely on the two lamps on either side of the bed. (I can't actually report if the overhead light would have worked if I managed to get some current to it.) I took the two steps from the door to the bathroom to discover that the bathroom door knob was detached. Managing to make it past that obstacle, I tried to turn on the sink to find myself holding whatever it is you call the thing that lets the water flow. The sink faucet leaned sharply to the left, which was amusing more than anything else. (I had to wait until Monday AM to find out that the tub did not drain.) The sink itself was separating from the wall leaving that nice black filth that tends to fill up spaces like this. Did I mention the badly stained carpet? How about the depressing hallways? On second thought, never mind. On the bright side, there were plenty of towels. This can all be yours for the low-low price of $350+ a night! Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location and great beds (Traveller from Nova Scotia)”
Reviews.Author: jub6620
Reviews.Content: Located on 49th and Broadway, if you are going to see shows, this is a wonderful location. Subway nearby as well. We were within 1/2 block of 2 theatres we went to - "Wicked' and "MamaMia". I took my 16 yr old daughter and felt very safe at all times in the area and the hotel. Rooms are small (if you get a corner one), but we moved and I was quite satisfied with our accomodations. We had a king room (1010) and it was ample. Beds extremely comfortable- rooms have an European feel. Everything very clean and staff very helpful. I would normally stay at larger hotels but for the price difference I would stay here again. We never ate a meal in the restaurant so I can not comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Time Out and disappointed”
Reviews.Author: caribart
Reviews.Content: After doing exhausting research online, I finally settled on The Time Hotel 16-19OCT during my visit to New York City. I usually fly into/out of LaGuardia as it is closer to midtown and always stay in the Time Square-Columbus Circle Area. I chose the Time based on good reviews here and fo the same price as other hotels in the area, I booked a 1 bedroom suite so I can have more space as NYC in general offers tiny rooms. NYC trademark yellow cab dropped us off at The Time's glass canopy entrance on 49th Street and a doorman took our bags up the glass elevator to the second floor reception area. Our first impression was that the Reception area was small and minimal to the point of being styrile and cold. We have previously stayed at other "designer/boutique" hotels (Paramount and Hudson) whose lobbies are ambient with lots of good energy. The Time lacked this feeling. Upon arrival, the check-in staff were robotic and performed their tasks, but offered zero personality or warmth. The bellman took us up to our room and briefly showed us around. On looking around our two-parlour suite, we never got the WOW factor as we did at Hudson or Paramount on previous stays. The Living Room was stark and cold. The Bedroom was in Blue (one o f the primary colours offered-but we were never given the choice to choose) Our opinion about the first impression of the room is: The Designer tried but "missed" we felt disappointed about our hotel selection. First night our sheets were "loud" to the point where I had to leave a note for house-keeping the next day to supply softer bedding as ours was starched to "thy kingdom come" . Street noise was noticable from as early as 4am with trash collection trucks. No attempt was made by the designer to use noice reducing windows or glass and I understand it is a city, but there are other options. Our first morning I visited the concierge to arrange certain reservations and/or meal recommendations. Our concierge was the most dreary individual. Did not seem connected to the city in any way. I asked about relatively new restaurants I had heard about and he was clueless. Of the restaurants he recommended nearby, I knew them already and won't consider them a place I would revisit. I stuck with my original pre-planned restaurant visits from research I did online at "gayot" and "nymag" and made reservations prior to my NYC arrival via opentable's website. The only useful thing the concierge was good for was to hand me a map of the city. He was the only one I ever saw for the duration of our stay at the Concierge Desk. We also secured excellent seats at the last minute via ticketmaster for the Broadway show "Wicked" at the Gershwin Theatre starring Ana Gasteyer. It was fantastic as were our seats 9 rows from Centre Stage. The hotel offers a basic (hot) breakfast off the lobby in the lounge (not the dining room). It was basically a fold open table, a white table cloth, three food warmers one with dried bacon, one with greasy sausages and the other with soggy hash browns. There was also a limited selection of fruit and baked goods. A server eventaully appeared from the kitchen and brought coffee and offered an egg, done to our taste. As I signed the cheque for 39.00 for breakfast for two, I felt this lame breakfast and the high cost of the room (478.00) should have been a complimentary feature. For breakfast, either go to any coffee shop nearby such as Cafe Europa or to Balthazar. Our overall hotel experience was disappointing. I would not stay here again as the are much better options available who offer the full New York City Experience of style and sophistication while providing charisma and comfort in their rooms. So for the hotel I say TIME OUT. Other than checking in and checking out we never encountered other staff and when we tried we got the dreary concierge (sounds like a new broadway play: "the Dreary Concierge-a comedy) The hotel's decor is stark and cold and has zero personality. Accoustically, you hear all the chatter between staff. We shared elevators many times with service staff clearing bags of laundry and trash. Anyone can enter the lobby and take the elevator directly to the floors of the guest rooms. This seemed to be a security risk. The doorman was not there many times of my ins and outs and anyone could have followed me in. The doorman was always pre-occupied chatting with his mates, colleagues or people in the street and often did not even acknowledge the people were entering the hotel. This bothered me a great deal. We certainly do NOT recommend this hotel for your NYC experience. We consider ourselves well travelled and in the 36-40yr old age group and we like the WOW factor, value for money, service, personality and comfort. This hotel failed at offering this to us. We did get this from other NYC experiences on this trip. For example we ate dinner at The Buddha Bar which opened in the Meat Packing district in April. Excellent food and service was great. Got the WOW here. Also try Buddhakhan, which the concierge had no clue about. The best dinner we had was at Kittichai located at the fabulous 60 Thompson in Soho. The intimate Dining room exuded a overall feeling of well-being and the meal was fantastic. Cant wait to go back. For lunch try Spice Market, L'ecole, and Balthazar So my short list for NYC is: *Fly into LGA-LaGuardia or Newark if you can *Use a NYC Cab and not a private taxi *Choose a hotel from: Paramount/Hudson/the Maritime or 60 Thompson (new hotel soon to be opened at 6 COLUMBUS too) *Breakfast at Belthazar (french) or Cafe Europa (economy) *Lunch at Spice Market, L'ecole (at the French Culinary Institute) or Gramercy Tavern *Dinnert at Budda Bar, Tao, Buddhakhan and definitely at Kittichai and maybe SUBA....to go more up-market try Per Se or Danube *Broadway shows: Wicked/The Chorus Line and Buckley (with Nathan Lane) Hairspray was fantastic when I say it with Harvey Fierstein (spelling??) One final note: If you like IKEA, there is a dedicated IKEA bus which leaves from the Port Authority Bus Terminal on 8th Avenue and takes you directly to IKEA in Elizabeth, New Jersey There are also great hot-dogs at Grays Papaya in the village Enjoy your next New York City experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Experience at The Time!”
Reviews.Author: brooklyn24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Time September 1-4, 2006. When we first arrived our room was not yet available so they took our bags and we went and had lunch. When we returned our room was available and they had upgraded us to a King Superior room from the Queen. Our room was just what we needed. The beds were comfortable, the shower was great and the decor was very fun! The plasma TV was a plus. The overall look of the hotel is very chic. The location can't be beat. You are literally one block from the heart of Times Square. And there are subway stops right there. It is also directly across from the theater that "Chicago" is showing and right next door to another popular theater. If you want tickets to either just talk to the concierge and they will arrange. We even spotted a celeb getting off the elevator! We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to be in the midtown area. The only complaint is that the 2nd floor lounge was closed at 9pm on Saturday night, which was very odd to us.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room and a Wonderful Location!”
Reviews.Author: Susan_from_PA
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 2 nights at The Time. We had a newly renovated room which was extremely nice but smaller than other hotels I have stayed in in NYC. The room was very clean and housekeeping was efficient. We had a red room on the 9th floor (there was a red scent vial in the room but no jellybeans) Our view was of the building next door (but we didn't go for the view). There is lighting around the window which gives the impression of daylight coming in the window since there wasn't much coming in naturally. The flat panel TV had a good variety of channels. Some came in much better than others. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The bathroom was small but you could move around in it fine. The amenities in the bathroom were awesome. (Ask how to use the thermostat before adjusting the temperature or your room may get very warm. If you adjust it properly, the room stays very comfortable) The fan on the AC was loud but it was white noise so it didn't bother us. We didn't hear any sound from the neighboring rooms while in the room but in the hall you can hear every conversation in every room. The only inconvenience we had was on the day we checked out only one of the two elevators were working. We booked on the internet and got a great deal. We were going to shows so this location was ideal! We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We Love NYC”
Reviews.Author: taxford
Reviews.Content: My wife won a trip to see the black eyed peas at Madison square Gardens and this was the hotel we stayed at. I found the staff very friendly and the rooms very clean. I made the mistake of putting my own beer in the bar fridge in the room. I didnt realise it is automatically charged to your bill when you remove things from the fridge. The staff were very helpful and i was never charged for my mistake. When in NYC the hotel is really just a place to sleep so the size of the room doesnt really matter. The beds were very comfortable. The location was awesome every thing is walking distance. I wish I was there right now!!! I love New York!!!!! I would definitly stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Gadgets don't beat basic cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: alfiev
Reviews.Content: Hotel has lots of gadgets in room :fax, internet connection, massive tv etc - but the room was not clean and the shower curtain stank,the bathrrom seemed to have been cleaned with a ditry mop. Staff didnt do anything about this and only offered me another room when I was changing hotel (way too late!). Stylish but tiny rooms,but a terrible lack of maintenance with bits of gunk on the walls( dont ask,dont tell) and a filthy carpet. It could be so much better if they kept it clean and looked after the rooms. Another gadget is not what they need.Great location but it is not enough and I moved after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic”
Reviews.Author: jonathanhealy
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at The Time, although itwas some time ago and I've heard things have disimproved a little since. I booked a twin room for my mother and myself (her first time in the USA). The rooms are beautiful - I chose yellow - and ours was relatively spacious. The en suite was superb, especially the twin-jet shower heads which were a novel experience for me! It's certainly not cheap, but this is "downtown" NYC in a good bustling upper west-side location. The reception desk staff could be friendlier, although the concierge couldn't have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay at The Time”
Reviews.Author: et-toronto
Reviews.Content: I was relatively disappointed with our stay at The Time July 21-23 weekend. The room was nice, but there wasn't enough space to put clothes - no drawers! Also, there was no where to sit, other than a single well worn desk chair and the bed. The room had space for a couple of small swivel club chairs. The shower room was fine. My disappointment was that there was nothing outstanding about this experience. When I stay at a boutique hotel, I expect a couple of outstanding things. Here are a few observations: When we booked (a couple of months ago) we were not made aware of renovations in the hotel (restaurant was down). Maid service was OK (bed made, bathroom tidied), but the room wasn't thoroughly cleaned, for example dirty glasses left on the desk. And the jelly beans weren't replenished! The TV was amazing (gigantic flat panel) but we had to shake the cords around to get it to work (electrician came and he did same!) We called down for wine glasses and they brought up to totally different sized glasses! It's all in the details. All in all, I probably won't stay there again, or even recommend it. It just fell short of my expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay to Feel New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and were highly impressed with this hotel. You cannot find a better location. Our room was ready when we got there, everyone was nice and helpful to us. Not what I have come to expect from New Yorkers. There is a great breakfast place just around the corner called Pallegio's. Again good food and very quick service. The rooms are not large but we didn't stay in the room that much. We could walk to just about everywhere from this hotel. We will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2LITravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Time for only one night, a Sunday, but I felt compelled to write after reading so many average reviews. We requested a deluxe room (about $25 more than the regular superior room) on a high floor after reading that those rooms had been renovated. Our room was filled with clever trendy new furnishings and a very large flat screen TV. The room was spotless, and was a normal NYC sized room with a full tub and shower. We were greated at check-in by both a very pleasant doorman and front desk attendant. As we were leaving in the elevator, we were asked by a hotel employee if we enjoyed our stay. So, although my review is based only on one night, it was a very positive experience... great location, inexpensive price, clean modern room, and a pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevie8
Reviews.Content: As a travel professional, I've placed quite a few of my corporate clients into The Time - so naturally, I was a bit dismayed to find a few negative reviews of this property. I decided to book a room there for a weekend and see things for myself. I'm happy to report that the negative reviews seem to be a greatly exaggerated. The Time is a perfectly fine place to rest your head. Our room on the 7th Floor had not yet been redecorated, but was in fine shape. Yes, the rooms are small - but no smaller than some of the cabins I've stayed at aboard various cruise ships. Much like those rooms, The Time tries to compensate for the lack of space with some fairly well thought-out storage nooks. The bathroom is definitely small. It took a while for the water to heat up, and the pressure was not what I am accustomed to, but the shower stall was roomy enough and in spite of what some previous reviews say, there -are- shower curtains, so you -won't- be splashing water all over the place! The Moulton Brown amenities are a nice touch, too. The hotel staff was cordial and most attentive - not stand-offish like others have reported. The restaurant is not serving dinner these days, but a light (and very limited!) menu can be had in the bar. The bar was actually rather dead, too - which is a shame, since it's a great-looking room and the staff seemed to be rather bored. That's not to say they weren't attentive - but I hope some of you who will be staying there will pop on in and give them some business - they deserve it. Location-wise, The Time can't be beat: right off of Times Square, in the middle of the Theater District. If you've got tickets to a show, this is an ideal place to hang your hat - and price-wise, it (normally) can't be beat. I'd check out the hotel's website to see what deals they are offering: we were able to get a much better rate through the hotel than through some of the other online sites. There are more expensive hotels in New York - and there are certainly other hotels who "out-boutique" the Time - but at twice (or thrice!) the cost. If you're looking to hang out with celebutantes - look elsewhere - but if saving money while staying in a room @ a centrally-located hotel that's slightly edgier than most of the others, you'll be perfectly happy here. Pleasant dreams!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not Great.”
Reviews.Author: MTL1969
Reviews.Content: The main reason I would not stay here again is the location. I realize most people here LOVE the fact that it is so close to Times Square (which it is). I however am of the opinion that Times Square is the most unappealing part of Manhattan, a tourist trap and for me not what visiting NYC is all about. The crowds of overweight, white-sneakered mid-westerners are simply too much for me. The hotel itself is fine, yes rooms are small (this is NYC after all), and at USD 309 per night for a weekday I'd probably try something else next time,. But the rooms are fine otherwise, big flatscreen TV, nice design (a tad worn but not too bad). staff has been good and responsive (our sink leaked and was fixed pretty rapidly). As a frequent traveller, I appreciated the duvets (i hate dusty blankets), the gym (small but enough for me and in good shape) and the in-room broadband internet ($10/day). A hopping bar on the ground floor. (unfortunately my caipirinha was BAAAD) and pleasant entrance. If you like your hotels modern AND you want to be near times square then The Time is not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “The time. & kids??”
Reviews.Author: maybebailey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "Blue" suite for five nights, 2 adults a 15 year old and a 2 year old. Having done no prior research we soon realised this was not the best choice of hotel for a family. The rooms are on the small side for a family and a little on the tired side for a 4* hotel (we were on the eighth floor). However they were exceptionally clean and well equipped. The staff at the hotel are very helpful and understanding. A cot/crib was bought to our room within 5 mins of requesting, along with extra towels and bedding. We had to have our mini bar emptied as our toddler loved "playing" with all the very expensive contents, again our request was dealt with within minutes and a smile!!! The only real problem we had was our air conditioning didnt work, an engineer came to our room, again quickly but coudnt fix it. We were offered a room change but declined (after all we had just unpacked and it wasnt really too warm) and instead we were given breakfast vouchers. My husband and I returned to the hotel at 11pm and ordered a very nice bottle of wine in the bar, We were disapointed to find the bar to be closing after 5mins of arriving. We took our bottle up to our room, which was fine but $100 botttle i did expect a little more customer service! All in all, This is a great trendy boutique hotel ideal for couples. Location Is fantastic, staff are gorgeous in every way!

Reviews.Title: “A really good (not great) hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Time is a very stylish, hip hotel right in Times Square. The hardware, furniture, design, elevator, etc. are all very cool and a lot of thought went into the design of this hotel. The Bad: This hotel looks as if it were a great hotel about 5 years ago and has had only a minimum of maintenance and upgrades since. It looked really good if you squinted your eyes, but upon closer inspection, some ares are worn. You'll notice the wear mostly the walls and bathroom. For example, the shower was very cool looking but it leaked like a sieve all over the floor. The walls showed lumps and bumps, and the touch up painting looked like they hired the blind. It's not a bad hotel, it just needs some serious TLC. The Good: Having said that, I WILL be going back to this hotel the next time I am in NYC (I am there on business a few times a year). The location CAN NOT BE BEAT! You are litterally 1/2 block from Times Square, yet this hotel is quiet and cozy. The staff was great and very helpful, although I must admit I had very little interaction with them. You are a short walking distance from nearly all Broadway shows, shopping, sight seeing, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the time”
Reviews.Author: Travelersrus2
Reviews.Content: We liked the Time hotel...Nice room (yellow). Only problem was that we had to wait for some time in the afternoon for our room to become available. We were told the girl on the desk left and forgot to tell anyone we were waiting. It happens!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel. Employees need to be taught customer satisfaction.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms are incredibly cramped... but that's to be expected when staying in Time's Square NY. What's not to be expected is the dirtiness of the rooms with horribly stained carpets, stained sheets, hair all over the bathroom and room, a cracked sink, low class clientel, horrible service response time (it took 3 hours for an "engineer" to come look at my air conditioner and he couldn't fix it any way). Absolutely horrible Management team. I was able to get the name of the front desk manager Kanvar Singh, who would not come out of his office to speak to me. I wasn't asking for a discount, because it was my poor decision making for picking this hotel, I just wanted to inform him of all my troubles during my stay there at the Time. Kanvar Singh would not come out to speak with me, instead one of the front desk girls had to keep running back and forth between me and Kanvar's desk. After going into the back 4 times she took some mini bar charges off of my bill which I did not even ask for, there wasn't any problems with the minibar and I didn't see why she did that. Basically my main gripe is with the front desk manager Kanvar who seems to be too important to speak to guests. If I could have gotten to voice my opinion to him and gotten a simple apology I think that I would have left that hotel with a much better taste in my mouth. If this hotel reads these reviews this next comment is for you, There are plenty of people in this world who are willing to work hard for the money you pay them, don't ever settle on some one who can't even listen to a complaint when asked to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Great”
Reviews.Author: Zal_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed over our easter break, group of london girls in the big apple. the location of the hotel was great, coz we walked to the center of manhatten within minutes, there were loads of breakfast places to eat out near by, so it was good, the staff at the hotel were very friendly and very helpfull. the rooms were decently sized, even though with girls there is never enuogh room for all your stuff. the space for hanging up your clotehes was decently sized as well, the beds were very omfortable. as i went with girlies who work in the travel industry we had discounted prices, but im sure that the real prices are not that high, so inm all good value for money. the showers were nice and big so you didnt feel closterfobic when showering like i have experienced in some hotels Overal good hotel, nice staff, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Time Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NateAlaska
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic location for tourists - just off of Broadway. The room was very small (I was aware of this when we made the reservation) but the room and bathroom were very clean and new. I believe that they just finished a renovation project. Also, they have a very hip bar and their employees were all very friendly and helpful. Overall, we were pretty happy with the hotel. However, I feel that they misadvertised the size of the bed in our room. My wife and I had a Superior Queen room and the bed was definitely not a queen-sized bed. We have a queen-sized bed at home and we could definitely tell the difference. However, when we called the front desk, they told us that we had a queen sized bed and that all Superior Queen rooms have a queen-sized bed. Despite this one concern, I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “gone down hill”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Run down since opening ..had to move rooms even though i booked superior level, room was tiny and worn. moved to larger room which was not much better

Reviews.Title: “Bush-league customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Read the following letter sent to the Time's General Manager Debbie Lewis on 3/6/06 (to which I have yet to receive any sort of response) and judge for yourself if you'd like to stay there... Dear Ms. Lewis -- As a repeat customer of the Time hotel, I was very surprised this week to receive treatment radically different from what I have grown accustomed to at the hands of your staff. When I arrived at 10:45pm on Tuesday, February 28th (after depositing my luggage at 2pm that day â€“ the room was not ready yet), I was given room 610, whose HVAC unit only produced heat. An engineer was called to the room, and after 10 minutes of adjustments, he said he would be back in 15 minutes to check to see if it was OK. Due to the late hour, I asked to change rooms. The desk associate moved me to the 8th floor, in a room with the exact same problem. I was then asked to look at another room on the 8th floor, which was clearly a smoking room. Finally, at about 11:30, I was placed in room 1615, a notable downgrade. The next morning, I packed up my things and left for the day, telling the morning desk associate that I was expecting to be placed in a deluxe room (my original room grade) with a working HVAC unit. When I arrived at the hotel at 8:30pm, I was shocked to be handed a key to room 610 once again. After I explained that this was the original problematic room, the desk associate informed me that the â€œhotel was overbooked,â€� and the only rooms left at that point were smoking rooms. After I asserted that they had had all day to fix this, the manager on duty came out, and without ever addressing me, begrudgingly told the desk associate to put me in room 612, a suite. The final insult came when I went to check out and the bill still reflected the deluxe room rate for Tuesday night â€“ I had to press to get Eddie (manager on duty) to revise it. If the associate on duty the night of 2/28 had placed me in the suite instead of the downgrade after the 3rd room change, I wouldnâ€™t feel like an undervalued customer right now. Thatâ€™s all it would have taken. I wouldnâ€™t have had to stay in a shoe box with a cracked sink on 2/28 after a long day of meetings (inconvenience #1), pack up again the next morning (inconvenience #2), argue again at the front desk on 3/1 (inconvenience #3), and fight about my bill at departure (inconvenience #4). The additional irony of all of this is that on my last stay in December, I had complimented the manager on duty, since I had noticed a big improvement in service and attitude from both the desk staff and the bell/front door staff (I recall that I even took the time to send in a positive comments card). Now one visit later, the Time is no longer my default business hotel of choice in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: hjlfh;hfjdnvha
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic, just 2 seconds walk to time square. Room was small but fine for the amount of time we spent in it. Quiet and always cleaned everyday. Staff were pleasant, door men especially nice. I would def recommend this hotel and would stay agin.

Reviews.Title: “What a top spot”
Reviews.Author: Rob74
Reviews.Content: Having lived in New York 2 years ago, my partner and I were keen to get back to catch up with some friends and fit in as much shopping as we could in 3 days. We used to live on 42nd street and so know the area fairly well and have also stayed in numerous hotels on the island. We booked a last minute deal through expedia and were unsure what to expect given it was such a good price. We weren't disappointed! Obviously we knew the location was very convenient but were surprised by the oasis of calm we had checked in to. We had a blue room which was really comfortable and clean but more importantly it was unbelievably quiet! The breakfast was superb as was the bar and the staff were genuinely bothered about how we enjoyed our stay when we checked out. Great little hotel and we're booking a return trip to the same hotel in May - loved the place!!

Reviews.Title: “In need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: Houlie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is threadbare and in need of renovation. It was probably superb a few years ago, but now it looks old and tired and dirty. I am unsure what I was actually tipping the cleaners for! The location is fab but this doesn't make up for poor service (it took 3 days to mend our safe.) This is a very expensive hotel that sells itself on it being funky. Its not. Shop around, your money is best spent elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Looking Foward to going Back!Roll out of bed and your in Times Square....”
Reviews.Author: amrsc77
Reviews.Content: At first I wasnt sure about going to the Time because it wasnt that known.Checked lots of reviews about this hotel and compared it to others and so glad I picked the Time! When my daughter and I first arrived we had to wait for a room.During this time the staff had changed shifts,sooo the wait ended up a bit long because they forgot about us and so I had to remind them about checking in.Yes the desk staff could have been a tad more friendlier but hey were in New York!Thought this could be a bad way to start off the trip but while we were waiting a young recording artist came to the desk and was checking in.Of course my daughter knew right away who he was and got to talk with him and get a picture and a CD!Needless to say it made her whole week!So this made up for the wait. Was very impressed with the rooms.We had a superior queen and it was large enough for the both of us.We had visitors later in ther week who said they liked it better than the hotel we stayed at last year (East Side Marriott).Small closet but we lived out of the suitcase and had no problem with that.Anyway who spends alot of time in the hotel room? The bathroom is small but with enough space to do what you need to do.The bath products are fantastic and you can buy larger products to take home.(They also sell the same products at Bloomingdales!)I do advise to take a sponge or puff to wash with because they give you a body wash and would be eaiser to wash if you had the sponge or puff.Towels were very good. The best part of this hotel is how close it is to Times Square.You can just about roll out of bed and walk out the door and your steps away from Times Square and the theatres.When we stayed at the other hotel it was such along walk to Times Square we kept taking taxi's and went back early,but being so close you can stay out late.Also if you need a taxi, they go right by the hotel so getting one is a snap or shall I save a wave! Since my daughter was under 21 then we didnt get to go to the bar nor did we have time to eat at the hotel but this time around we will.Heard that the bar is really great on the weekends.The manager at the restuarant was very nice to us even though we did't get to try the food.Also the door man was very helpful in getting us taxi's and answering our questions. There is a small fridge in the room but dont remove item to look at because you will be charged.(like other mini bars around)There is a small space that you can put water or drinks of your own.If you need ice, you have to call the front desk and it will be brought right up to you! I liked the color of the room (we had red).Liked the littel added extra too(free postcard,jelly beans,red scent perfume etc).I also really like how quiet this hotel was. Would we go back?...as I write I am also making plans to go back in April '06 to this hotel!See you there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Muz
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Time Hotel for 9 nights during February 2006. The location is awesome and the service was great. The rooms are a bit small but overall were pretty modern, comfortable and clean. The concept of rooms decorated in either red, yellow or blue colour schemes works well. However, it may be time to revamp the linen. Polyester bedspreads are a no no - YUK. The hotel needs to invest in some quality cotton and luxurious comforters and goose/duck down pillows as the existing pillow were pretty uncomfortable. Overall, we were happy with the quality of The Time Hotel and would stay there again on the above proviso i.e. a crucial linen and pillow update.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Idea..shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the attitude of staff. I expected my luggage to come up to my room quickly. Wanted to take it up myself. Ended up in someone else's room and had to be found. Made three calls to reception to sort it out. No apology. Think the owners need to educate staff on what hospitality actually means. Cool and chic staff don't just cut it when service is what guests want!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Love It, Didn't Hate It.”
Reviews.Author: parvathy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Time for three nights in December last year(12/22-12/25). While here, we felt like we were staying in the heart of the city, and were pleasantly suprised that the TKTS booth, most broadway theatres & almost everything we wanted to check out were all within walking distance from its' location. The staff were relatively friendly too, and we checked in and out without a hitch. However, everything else about the Time, like some other reviewers here have suggested, left me a little cold. The room itself was m-i-n-i-s-c-u-l-e (which would be fine, because this is, afterall, NYC) but the furniture felt musty, the carpets were raggedy, the washbasin in the toilet had giant cracks running through it and the concept of matching your mood to your room seemed a little tired. But we stayed here because we found a room sale on Expedia that offered us a rate that was more than half off on the regular price of about $350. And considering the great (i mean GREAT) location and the busy time of year we were travelling during, I don't feel like I can complain too much. Overall The Time seems a decent enough place if you don't have to pay more than $150 a night to sleep here, and more importantly if you plan to spend most of your time in NY exploring the city itself.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in a hectic area”
Reviews.Author: JRZ_GYRL
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a two-night stay at The Time--a terrific little botique hotel on 49th St. between 7th and Broadway. I was a bit skeptical at the Hotwire.com rate of $163 a night, but after staying, I can say without a doubt that I've just found my new favorite hotel in New York. This is not a five-star property, mind you, so you need to accept the fact that the corners of the wood furniture may be a little worn, and the bathtub tile could use a vigorous scrubbing; but the price and amenities more than made up for that. I entered my red-accented room (small, as to be expected in New York) to discover a customized "red" fragrance, a little box of red jellybeans, and Wolfgang Puck coffee. The furnishings had a great Scandinavian flair. In the stylish black and white bathrooom, I found a soft, stretchy bathrobe, high-end toiletries, a blow-dryer, and a selection of four great magazines including the current Time Out New York. The desk had good task lighting, high-speed Internet access, and was decorated with the hotel's whimsical square-donut shaped postcards which hung from hooks, ready for use. The bed was surprisingly comfortable, and there was a wide range of cable channels available, as well as a Bose wave radio. The front desk and bell staff were first-rate, and being just half a block away from Broadway cuts down incredibly on the noise and traffic. And how's this for serendipity? Before I made my reservation, I was holding a ticket for Sweeny Toddd (a must-see for fans of dark humor and musicals), and the hotel turned out to be right next door to the Eugene O'Neill theater. It was easy walking to the subway for jaunts uptown to shop 5th Ave. and to Lincoln Center, and downtown to stroll around the West Village. If you like boutique hotels and enjoy something a bit saner than the Marriott Marquis, this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Time Hotel New York We have just returned from a 5 day break to New York staying in the Time Hotel located just 200 yards from Time Square. This was exactly what we were looking for. 2 Adults and 2 children staying in a Deluxe Double Room. The hotel which is a Boutique Hotel was clean and modern and for us provided the right amount of service. If you are looking for full on hotel service around the clock this is not for you. For us the concierge and cleaning services were all we were looking for. The rest of the time left alone to come and go as we pleased. Lets be honest you are at the heart of the action and everything is within walking distance - Central Park, Empire State, Time Square, Broadway, Boat Trips, Great Restaurants, Fifth Ave and most of your time should be spent outside. We love walking and exploring and with 2 young kids (10 & 6) I was surprised how easy and safe New York was.

Reviews.Title: “Amiable but run-down”
Reviews.Author: Traveler074
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Time for three nights at the beginning of January. The location is great, the beds were comfortable, and the room was reasonably clean when we checked in and very quiet at night. However, the service was amiable but off-hand (the staff were mostly friendly, but we were overcharged by room service and there did not seem to be a way to fix it, and the daily cleaning was perfunctory at best), and the room and furniture were quite worn out. It seemed like there had been a cute and chic decorating scheme originally, but as everything is scuffed and torn the room was a little sad-looking. The bedside lamps would not stay up (they were worn out goosenecks), and there were a few bugs in the bathroom at night. It seemed like a lot of money for the shabbiness. I wouldn't stay there again unless they renovated the rooms or dropped the prices.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time at The Time.”
Reviews.Author: paradiselover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Time at the end of November and had a fantastic stay. We had a yellow king de-luxe on the 11th floor. I had done a lot of research on New York hotel rooms and I was pleased with our room. How people can fault the cleanliness is beyond me. Our room was spotless, the decor I must admit could do with sprucing up. The bed was by far the comfiest hotel bed I have ever slept in. The shower was superb hot clean and larger than I expected. The room I thought was a decent size. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was fantastic, straight into Times square what more can you want. We always stay in 4* Hotels where ever we travel and I think for a city hotel The Time is excellent. We have stayed in some pretty grotty 4* hotels in London and Paris, because it's a city they seem to think that they can get away with lower standards.I saw several hotels I had looked at booking and I was pleased with the choice I had made. My criteria was a clean bed, clean shower and bathroom and a good location. The Time met all these and I would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Could be a lot better”
Reviews.Author: Dex67
Reviews.Content: The Time has a fantastic location, great bar (if very expensive) and the staff are very accommodating. The beds are also very comfy. However The Time doesn't merit a four star rating. I would put it between two and three stars. The rooms are shabby and could do with a good overhaul (the lights over the bed were actually held together with masking tape!); the wardrobe door was actually a curtain; the blinds were torn and the cleaners didn't really know the meaning of the word clean. The rooms are also incredibly small. If you complain they will upgrade you to a bigger room but although bigger it may be, better it ain't! About five years ago I reckon this hotel was really special but no investment has been made recently. We paid a lot of money for a substandard hotel so shop around

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location very trendy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ambers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Time last week for 4 nights and had a great time in New York. The hotel is just off Times Square we could not of had a better location.We had a red room on the 12th floor which was comfy, warm, and clean with a view over the theatre showing Chicago! The staff were really friendly and helpful and we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good room for NY”
Reviews.Author: supernovea
Reviews.Content: I stayed in NY for 3 nights and this hotel was worth the price. Ok, the rooms are not very big, but it's NY. I have stayed in a more expensive hotel in NY where the rooms are even smaller. The location is excellent, the staff are very nice and helpful and the rooms are clean. Since I'm not in NY to stay in an hotel room, this was great.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: TCRL10
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets the job done, but is definitely nothing to write home about. I stayed in the hotel one night for business. It is located steps from Times Square and the Broadway Theaters for travelers who are in town for leisure. The room was decent and the staff was helpful. However, the room service menu leaves a little to be desired and the gym is definitely lacking. Overall, it's not bad...but I'm not sure it deserves the 4 star rating it is receiving here.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Noise at Time”
Reviews.Author: Rainmaker1
Reviews.Content: Trendy hotel, too bad i could not sleep in the bar! The room on the 3rd floor was small (which was fine) but beside an airconditionor on the roof which was so loud. Phoned to move room they said i could not. The light switch going into room was broken and walls had what looked like skid marks or crayon on them. Very disapointing and the fact that the front desk was so unaccomodating means never ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “loud generating room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the room was awful~ it was tiny, dusty, cold. the amenities and location of the hotel may be its redeeming quality. and there's no way for you to turn off the a/c or air vent so throughout the night, the thing would be humming its merry way. if you don't mind walking around NYC, i'd say pick a better hotel unless you can shell out a hundred more to upgrade to a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but tiny”
Reviews.Author: daler68
Reviews.Content: We styed at the Time Hotel for 3 nights at the end of September. The location is wonderful, the rooms clean and the staff very pleasant. However, our "superior queen" room was absolutely tiny. Not "small"- TINY! The bed was not queen size,either; maybe just a bit larger than a standard double bed On the positive side, it was very quiet-probably because our room was located in an air shaft! The airconditioning worked great so we were satisfied. We would only stay there again if we got a really good deal on the rate. We paid $209 and, frankly, it was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Time for an extended holiday - 9 nights - and have little negative to say. We were really pleased with the size of our room but the air conditioning was not working. Unfortunately, it was a couple of days until we could change rooms but the staff were kind and apologetic and upgraded us to a suite for the rest of our stay. I would say that the rooms all need a freshen up as they are looking tired and worn, but that is my only quibble. All amenities were good and the cleanliness great. The downstairs bar was always quiet surprisingly. Oh and watch your bill, we were nearly charged for movies we never watched. Worringly they didn't quibble it and took them off which makes me think it is a regular occurence! Overall great value and fantastic location in the heart of the city, I loved my time there.

Reviews.Title: “Room- Disappointing, Location- Unbeatable!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night stay at this hotel through hotels, and received a pretty good deal. on arriving at the hotel, i was first struck by the location - straight off Time Square, directly opposite the theatre showing Chicago, it was truly an awesome spot. The reception of the hotel, very modern and clean, was impressive, as was the service of the concierge. however, on entering our "superior room" i was most disappointed with several aspects of the accommodation, namely the size of the room. the room was very much on the small side and displayed no "superior" aspects to speak of. the view from the window was also unsightly, all i can say is thank goodness for the curtains, as i had no desire to look out upon a concrete pit and smoking pipes! on the whole, the room was adequate, but no way merits the title of "superior," and to be honest, im sure there is better accommodation available in NYC for better value than what we payed for at the Time. however, the location of the hotel cannot be faulted, and if you're looking for an adequate hotel right in the action, i would recommend this hotel if you can find a decent deal!

Reviews.Title: “so This is a Superior room?????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Time Hotel in NYC from 8/13/05 through 8/16/05. I booked a "superior" room with either a queen or king sized bed through ORBITZ. The room had the smallest QUEEN sized bed I have ever slept in. At my house that size is called "FULL" size. The room was very dark and small and looked out onto a lovely hole filled with big huge pipes surrounded by the rest of the hotel rooms. Lovely view!! And this room was termed a SUPERIOR room!!!! The one good thing was the location was very good, although there was a hotel right next door which was much cheaper. I am unhappy with both the TIME Hotel as well as Orbitz for not living up to the advertisement.

Reviews.Title: “Fair, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Time Hotel this weekend and found the property to be fair, but not great. The hotel seemed rather worn and I often saw large black garbage bags filled with trash from guest rooms sitting in the hallways. My room also was leaking in the bathroom via the light fixture due to a leak in the room above! When I contacted hotel management I was told "don't worry, we know" - what about the leak in my room?!? The staff were courteous, but did not seem to go out of their way, and the rooms were very, very small. I bumped into something just about every time I walked through the room. Bottom line, if you get a GREAT deal, you should consider the hotel. If not, keep shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine. Not spectacular.”
Reviews.Author: Scottological
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Time for five nights on a visit to see family. As an ex-New Yorker I knew of the bar on The Time's second floor which was, in its day, quite popular and hip. From the doorway to the reception area, the place exudes the ethos of a cool boutique hotel reminiscent of the "W" chain found throughout large North American cities. Unfortunately, while they try carry this hip ambience into the guestrooms, they don't quite succeed. The guest rooms are about average size for Manhattan, which is to say small - though not oppressively so. The furnishings are generally unimpressive and look a little worse for wear. The bathroom, in particular, far from being a spa-like setting, is simply a typical three-star Holiday Inn or Hyatt bathroom with a more modern faucet. This is not to say the place is a dump. It isn't. In fact, the room itself was perfectly clean and the bed and linens tremendously comfortable. However, if you're expecting a luxurious day-spa type setting, you won't find it here. This is a plain hotel with panache that ends at the reception desk. On the other hand, if you're looking for a relatively inexpensive place that offers clean, comfortable rooms, this is an excellent choice. The rooms are also quiet. If one turns on the fan or A/C, there is virtually no street noice whatsoever. On a final note, I found the service to be excellent. The staff was, at all times, helpful, kind, and professional. No "attitude" whatsoever. Bottom line: perfectly fine hotel, but not the hip urban oasis it wants to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Funnier1
Reviews.Content: The Time Hotel is boutique through and through. From the moment you enter the premise, the hotel's sleek, trendy style comes through. The location is perfectly located near Time Square and Central Park. Walking distance to everything. Lots of easy access to subways. The rooms were small (even for two), but nicely done. Clean with lots of detailed, upscale amenities; Molton Brown sundries, Jelly Belly's, matching eau d' jour, plush robes, in room coffee. The staff is helpful. Room service was great and reasonably priced -- especially for NYC prices. It was a pleasure to stay at The Time Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be any closer to the Action”
Reviews.Author: lovedNZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Time 18th - 26th June 05, room very small, clean, very limited wardrobe, drawer space, no safe in room, quickly rectified. Book above 3rd floor if you want a peaceful nights sleep, bar on 2nd floor very noisy. Arrived late Saturday night, bar in full swing, checked in on 2nd floor, very very dim reception area. Needed to consult with Conceirge one morning advised by reception staff, didn't start till 9.00, this was at 8.00, waited until 9.10 a.m. then advised didn't start till 10.00, finally spoke to conceirge about free use of mobile phone as advertised in room brochure. He had no knowledge of free use of mobile phone, checked with Manager, he had no idea either, told would get back to us, never did? Mini-bar in room electronic charges to your account if item removed, never went near mini-bar. Upon checkout $19 on our account for mini-bar purchases taken day prior, we had left hotel at 8.00 returning at 4.00 a.m. not in room to use minibar? Problem resolved, at same time lady beside me checking out also had $24 of minibar purchases she had not made? Apart from these minor glitches hotel very well located, door staff friendly, bathroom toiletries excellent quality, nice fluffy towels, great air conditioner. Would stay at the time again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Find....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Time Hotel in June for a theatre weekend, this is one of the best hotels I have stayed at in years. From the door staff to the concierge (Anthony very helpful). We arrived on a friday evening and were a bit beat from the long week. The desk clerk noticed how tired we were and suggested a yellow room to perk us up. Its so true that color does effect your mood. The bed was so comfortable and you could not hear a sound. This room had everything and anything I could want, and wa suprised to find a bose wave radio (nice touch). The room was a good size compared to other hotels I have stayed at in New York and well appointed. I travel to NYC on business about 25 times a year and this is the perfect location to get anywhere in town. I'll be back....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel more fond of itself than it deserved!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location was wonderful, can't complain a bit about that. We arrived in early at around noon and were told we'd be able to get into a room by 1:30-2:00. We came back at 2:30 with still no room available. At this point, they asked if we'd be willing to be in a smoking room while admitting that if you're a nonsmoker, these rooms have a pretty strong smoke scent. We agreed to take a room on a lower floor that what we originally booked just so we could get into a room. The front desk girl acted like we were really asking alot to get into a room. I'm not sensitive at all to attitude, but this girl had a really apparent one. She knew that we were rushing to get into the room as we had to get over to Letterman by 3:00. We waited for 20 minutes before our bags got upstairs and had to make two phone calls before we got them. Once insdie the room I was not impressed. The hotel definitely tries to be hip as we had a blue room with several other blue references. Unfortunately, they forgot the simple things like cleaning/replacing the bedspread (significant white stains on the bedspread and area headstand and holes in the bedspread), fix up the bathroom (huge crack on the side of the sink going all the way down to the floor). We stayed one night and couldn't get out of there fast enough to move to a nicer hotel!!! The cheap price definitely corresponded to the quality of the hotel. The only redeeming value was the location.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved the stay at The Time Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Time Hotel was magnificent. Located just a few blocks from Times Square it was so easy for us to get around. We walked to Times Square from the hotel and it was marvelous. The staff was so professional and provided exceptional customer services. They didnâ€™t hesitate to go the extra mile. We also loved the design of the hotel. It was great. This is this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in on holiday Should we decide to visit New York again, we will definitely return to The Time Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, pleasant atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: memotz30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent the night at the Time and had a very good stay. We took the suggestion of other reviewers and stayed above the 4th floor to avoid the noise of the 2nd floor lounge, our room on the 6th floor was very quiet and peaceful. The rooms are small but stylish, and well stocked with amenities. Molton Brown toiletries are a nice touch. The concierge, Tony Dolce, went out of his way to help us find a little known restaurant in the Village that had been suggested by a friend. Overall the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: beefie82
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Time for five nights and six days. We stayed in a room with two doubles, I thought the size was good enough. My sister and I loved the yellow theme of the room and off course the molten brown toiletries! Definately a plus! The housekeeping was excellent, the rooms were kept really clean. The downside of this hotel, the staff was young and inexperienced. The conceirge was never there. My sister and I couldn't get any information about new york from the front desk, we instead went a couple blocks down to the time square information center (great place for tourists!). Our safe was low on batteries, we had to wait for 30 minutes till a guy came up and changed the batteries. The fax machine was out of ink and the temperature wouldn't change, it was stuck on 70 degrees throughout our stay. One out of the two phones was not working. And on the last day we received out bill and was charged for 9 drinks that we never had. We looked inside the fridge and 4 of our drinks were missing....(pretty sketchy!) After reading all the reviews before staying at the Time I was afraid of the noise down in the lounge in the wee hours. However, our room was very quiet. However the hotel lounge is known to be a hip place and on fridays a radio show throws a party in the lounge. I would say all in all the experience was great! I thought location was key, we were in the middle of time square and the theatre district! I would recommend this hotel to others....but my advice is check in very early so if there is a problem you can switch rooms:) have fun!

Reviews.Title: “The Decline of a Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: misspipsy
Reviews.Content: What a difference between our stay at The Time in New York two years ago and our stay last week. In 2003, this was a stylish concept hotel. There was a high-energy vibe going with the sleek interiors, the time-oriented decor, and the fun color-centered rooms. The funky and highly functional rooms made one overlook how small they are. We had a great time there. Now The Time is grubby and worn. The fun decor remains, but looks neglected. Our room reeked of mustiness and mildew and we found part of our carpet was soaked from an air conditioner leak. The hotel was sold out so we couldn't change rooms until the next day. Our next room was dry, but the phone didn't work and the shower had barely enough pressure to run. We felt the less time spent in the room, the better. On the good side, the location is great, the staff is helpful, and the rooms offer very useful amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it use to be...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years ago and loved it. However, it seems to be runned down a bit now. The lobby and the rooms need to renovate...the lounge has lost it following...and staff have lost their youthful appearance. No wonder way my rate was low!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were first timers to NYC so I'm not sure what is the norm for room size but in saying that although the rooms were quite stylish I did find them rather on the smallish size. The elevators are definitely quite small but this did not cause us any issues. When we checked in at 10pm it was nearly impossible to even hear what the receptionist was saying as the booming music from the bar area was so loud. I imagine those staying on the lower floors would struggle getting to sleep with the noise. The carpet in the bar was heavily stained and looked filthy. We requested a non-smoking room but our room absolutely stank of smoke. A great location and pricing is ok but a bit disappointed overall.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous hotel; great location/value/features”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at The Time with a friend on a pleasure trip. We were a little apprehensive, having read some pretty negative reviews, but those fears vanished as soon as we arrived. We were greeted cheerfully upon our arrival, and since our room was not yet ready for us (we arrived at noon and checkin is 3pm), they stored our bags for us so we could start our wanderings.
