When we returned to the hotel at 5 to check in, our bags were taken up to our room, where the bellhop explained everything about the room: the fax machine, the mini-bar (which is electronically controlled... if you open it, the front desk knows about it... we decided not to even peek!), the temperature controls, the lights, everything. The room was great. We had a Blue Room with two double beds. Yes, a little snug, but certainly not cramped. There was plenty of room to set up the ironing board. There were two hanging rods and three shelves for folded-clothing storage (which, upon arrival, actually held the bed pillows). There was the standard TV with a pretty good selection of channels. We didn't try the wireless, which was $9.95 per 24 hours (billed noon to noon). We had drinks at the bar that night, which was loud but not too raucous. The bartender was great; when I was dismayed that my favorite drink was not on the menu, he asked what the ingredients were and made it for me. Very comfy seating in the bar, too... cushy armchairs and couches. There's an area in back that's a bit more funky, with color-changing lights in the ceiling; that seemed to be where the real partying was going on. The room was very quiet; we never heard anything from other rooms aside from hearing doors closing every now and then. There was a New York Times at our door each morning. The bathroom had two very fluffy bathrobes which were generously sized. The only problem with the bathroom was that the shower curtain was about two inches too short, and that would cause puddles on the main bathroom floor. Also, the tiles in the shower are on the slippery side; you can request a non-slip shower mat from the front desk. I'd recommend it. Other amenities: shampoo, conditioner, lotion, body wash, sewing kit, Q-tips and cotton makeup pads; shoe shine cloth; hair dryer. In the room: coffee maker with two mugs and coffee kit; a little box with jelly beans (blue, to match the room), and a small vial of "Eau de Blue" perfume (which was quite nice). All in all, I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, Nice Decor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. Having never been to NY before, we weren't sure what to expect. This hotel is in a great location, close to theatres & Times Square, Central Park, 5th Ave, etc. The decor was very nice. It was great to stay in a place that didn't have a cheesy floral bedspread.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay in the Time Hotel with my sister and mum as a christmas present. As this was there first visit to New York, i wanted it to be something special. I can say that i was not disappointed. We checked into the hotel and was met with a very helpful and polite receptionist. We were given a choice of room and were then helped with our bags to our room. Within five mins of being in our room, we recieved a call from reception to ensure that our room was to our satisfaction. It certainly was, however we did have a small problem with the safe. A engineer was with us within ten mins and fixed the problem. The room itself was slightly smaller than i had expected, but it was clean and modern, with some great finishing touches. The staff were both helpful and polite and the information service was excellent. Bar was comfortable and modern and again the staff were really accomodating. The location was second to none, right in the heart of things. Couldnt have asked for better.

Reviews.Title: “Kicking it at the Time”
Reviews.Author: rdavh
Reviews.Content: Arrived at The Time on a Thursday afternoon, which was very sunny. The receptionist greeted me with a beautiful smile and the Hotel was just getting into the swing of a Magazine Party!! I was on the 4th Floor with the gym ( never saw anyone use it but looked well equiped), never heard a thing from the bar 2 floors below. Room was ok as I was travelling alone it was just the right size ( this was a standard) however if I had of been travelling with a partner it may have become a bit cramp. Good room facilities, internet connection was cheap and from time to time there was WIFI available but not all day every day, Fax machine TV with the usual choice of channels, and mini bar, which was ok for prices in this part of town. I had to complain about the cleaning on my second day, but as soon as I had put the phone down, the duty Manager, House Manager and the lady that had apparently cleaned the room were there to have a look, excellent response, just get it right the first time, never had any problems after this. The room service menu was excellent and such a wide choice, again the usual price $20 for a main meal, just remember there is 18% tax and a $5 room service charge so order everything at once if you eat in the room. Chicago is on at the theatre across the road and it was impossible to get tickets, but there was no noise, infact the only noise I did hear was the bloke in the room next to me who was ringing my room bell at 4am, who then realised he had the wrong room! When I finally got out of bed he had passed out in the hall way. However I had a great time there, remember it is only a base and as far as bases go this was in a perfect location on 49th street between 7th and 8th. Go and enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, interesting decor”
Reviews.Author: Alexis_57
Reviews.Content: Excellent location within a block of 3 subway stations & close to 5th Avenue shopping. King room was much smaller than I expected, but we were there for only 2 days & didn't spend a lot of time in the room, so it was just fine. Don't know that I would like to stay there for a week in winter. Liked having a bit of empty fridge space in the mini bar for my own bottled water, loved the Molton Brown toiletries & the soft, fluffy towels, the bathrobe was a nice touch. Liked the fax machine & easy internet connection, the free postcards, the jellybellies & the little 'eau de bleu" in our blue room. Also liked the express checkout feature, and the in-room safe. Didn't like the 'closet' which was just a nook with a shower curtain door, and the light that stayed on all night. Would have prefered a drawer or two in the bedside table or the desk. Didn't mind the lack of view -- just stepping out the front door was view enough for me! Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, no views but nice people and good price”
Reviews.Author: GeorgieB333
Reviews.Content: Really disappointed in the room size, even for New York. Crowded elevator was tiny too. Staff was friendly and attentive and price was good, even considering the view was into a very dark and small alley.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Time in March, and couldn't fault it. Granted, the room was small, but the bed was comfortable and the bathroom good. The staff were very helpful, and the breakfast in the morning was fantastic - fresh fruit salad, eggs/omelettes/waffles cooked to order. The Molton Brown toiletries provided were lovely. The location for me was the best thing - round the corner from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Sixer_Tom
Reviews.Content: Like others, after reading the reviews I was a little nervous about my stay at the Time. Let me say that it was great. We showed up early and they gladly watched our bags until the room was ready. Thanks to everyone who warned us about the room size, we were ready for that, and we even booked a king for the extra room. The room was clean and very cool. And hears a tip...I found the best price on the Time's own web site. Also, (thanks to the great lady at the Time who answered the phone) you can put the room color you want in the comments section. I asked for a red room on the 5-10th floor (others said the lower rooms were too close to the lounge) and we got a red room on the 7th floor. Now that's service. Perhaps the end of March is an off time, but we NEVER had a problem waiting for an elevator...heck they even have little TV's in the wall near the elevators to help pass the time....so cool. Their concierge was also great. We wanted to go to Korea Town in Flushing to buy a specific Korean dress, but not being from NY, didn't know exactly where it was. The concierge didn't know off hand (who would), but he called back very fast (5-10 min) with an address, and subway directions...and he was exactly right. We couldn't have done it without him. Thank you! And I must add that I can't stand all the reviews that say it isn't worth it for the price. For the location, and trendiness, its one of the cheapest hotels I found on TimeSquare. I paided $209 for a king room. Most other hotels started at $250, and ended way, way up there. On our last day, they even held our bags so we could see some more sites until we left the city late in the day. I can honestly say I'll be staying there again the next time I'm in the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Skip It”
Reviews.Author: RichardP21
Reviews.Content: Our reservation was for a king size bed. We were told upon arrival that it was a mistake by the booking company even though our confirmation clearly showed what was reserved. We were given a room about the same size as a walk in closet. We could not get the heat regulated and had to open a window. Trying to get an elevator in the morning was a fifteen to twenty minute wait. It is a very trendy looking hotel but the customer service was terrible. There are much better hotels for the money in New York.

Reviews.Title: “The Time Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location!! 49th Street and Broadway, right in the theater district. This hotel has an amazing location and a superb staff. I was very impressed with the rooms, very clean and comfortable beds. I loved the color theme in each room, ours being blue. The concierge gave us great recommendations as to what to do and see. Overall, we had a great time at THE TIME!!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, horrible restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Kcbruin
Reviews.Content: The rooms were relatively nice, and a decent size for a king sized room. The elevators definitely need some fixing, they are small and it is a hassle just to get to the front desk (up to the second story, around the bar). Staff was not very helpful. The worst part of the hotel is the restuarant. Not only is it overpriced for an average breakfast buffet, but the service was horrible. They were slow and not very helpful (not worth leaving a tip). The atmosphere in the restaurant was just uncomfortable. Overall...nice rooms, but not much else nice about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will not Return to The Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First and last stay at the trendy Time Hotel on 49th. Only two small elevators for the entire hotel meant having to line-up in the cramped hallway and sometimes wait for the second elevator because the first was full. It's really annoying. The rooms are very small and we couldn't get the temperature regulated resulting in a room so hot we ended up sleeping with the windows open (they only open a small crack) just to get the temp, below 32c. Service in the restuarant for breakfast was non-existent. We had to ask for coffee, then for napkins and then wait a long time for the bill even though there were only three tables occupied. It is definitely not worth what they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CrazyDaisy11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at the Time. Booked a double deluxe which was very small and only had a shower and no heating in the bathroom (as this was New Yorks coldest winter for 100 years, it was like showering in the fridge). The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable but as others have said there was very little hanging space and no drawers. We upgraded to a suite the next day (only Â£40 a night extra) which was massive and very comfy with nice views. The hotel is in an excellent location and all the staff were very nice and helpful. Did n't go into the bar or the restaurant but the room service breakfast was fabulous. I would recommend the hotel even with the size of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced, cramped but good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Time Hotel is indeed a very modern hotel just as shown on the brochures and excellent in location as its just round the corner from Times Square. However, arriving there on a Friday night at midnight US time (5am UK time) we were somewhat confused if we were at the right palce as there was music blaring out just light a night club. There was no reception on the ground floor just Bouncers ushering you to a lift to go to the sencond floor. Whilst we were checking in the music was really thumping! Arriving to our room on the 12th floor, you could not hear any music but on entering our room though it was pleasant in style it was really small, just enough room to walk around the bed. No room to hang your clothes, just a small rail and a curtain to cover it. No place to put your suitcases and no draws. Basically for 6 days we had to live out of our suitcases and move thing in order to move from one side of the room to another. Apart from the hotel, the location was excellent and New York is an excellent city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad a time at the Time”
Reviews.Author: CJ64
Reviews.Content: Disappointed at the size of the room (Double Deluxe) which was booked for three people in total. One of our party dropped out at the last minute through illness. Had she come along it would have been a squash to get all three of us in the room. There was not enough hanging space and no draw storage in the room. Neither was there anywhere to store our suitacases which meant that not only did we have to live of our suitcases for 5 days we were tripping over them every time we moved round the room. The staff although they tried to appear to be helpful, they did not have any idea how to solve our problem or even if they understood why we were disappointed with the room. Apart from the size, the room was nicely decorated and was clean, though we had to chase housekeeping on two occasions to service our room. Great location for getting about, smack bang in the middle of Time Square and the hotel was pretty funky with quite a young client base. Would go there again purely for the location but don't try to get more than two people to a room no matter how good friends you are the "double beds" are not big enough for two people to sleep comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Great T ime”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this site after I had booked a week long stay at the Time Hotel and with a disabled husband I was very worried, but I have nothing but praise for the hotel and its staff everyone from the doorman up was kind, friendly and very helpful, the room was clean and cleaned every day, we arrived at 1pm and where informed that our room was ready and we checked in. As to the last comment about a $a a bag at the last hotel we stayed in New York we were charged $5 per bag. We plan to go back to NY next year and will stay at the Time

Reviews.Title: “So So Time”
Reviews.Author: chloeliketotravel
Reviews.Content: We were informed that the room was NOT available upon arriving.. so they moved us to a sister hotel called 'dream' (supposely much higher class than the TIME, but i really didnt see the big deal). The manager was very helpful and assistant about the whole situation until we were transported back to TIME. Overall quality of the hotel is ok. Not too impressive nor disappointed, since we spent most of the time outside touring around anyway. I hear you about the size of the room... they aren't that big. The location is awesome and around the hotel is pretty safe so guess it will be good the ladies. Will we be back here? Nope. with the price we paid, we'd rather stay at W hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Time at The Time”
Reviews.Author: GuyFromOH
Reviews.Content: Dirty. Tiny. Worn. Just some of the kinder things I have to say about The Time. I was not able to check in until almost 4:00 pm (3:00 pm check in). The suite I had reserved made me jealous for the spaciousness of my college dorm room from years ago. Of course, my college dorm room had fewer cigarette burns, and also smelled better. For the price, there are so many better options in Manhattan than The Time.

Reviews.Title: “A good Time”
Reviews.Author: blonde12
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a group & staying most of last week at the Crowne Plaza, we couldn't get a reservation there the last night & moved to the nearby Time. Based on the very mixed reviews, I was expecting trouble. HOWEVER, I was plesantly surprised at the comfortable room & incredible location. The hotel has a strong European feel, so Americans expecting a large room will be disappointed. The bed was comfortable, the toiletries were above average, and the Sunday breakfast buffet was one of the best values we experienced our entire trip! The desk staff can be stiff & blunt...they need some lessons in US customer service. While checking in, we overheard the experiences of someone who arrived late the night before to find The Time oversold. While they were sent to the Roosevelt that night, it appeared the communication regarding availability the next day was not good. The bar on the 2nd floor is very loud. Fortunately, we were not on the 3rd floor, as it would have been miserable. Floors 4 and above are unusually quiet for NYC, however. Either the music needs to be turned down, or the 3rd floor shouldn't be rented. All in all, great value for the money, and therefore, the "above average" rating. During Christmas a Sat. night stay other places would have been 2x the cost. Superb location. Diamond in the rough, and with an increased focus on customer service (checking in plus the noise issue), this place could shine!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived December 17 for a three night stay we were told that the hotel had overbooked and that they did not have a room for us. It was well after midnight, we were exhausted, and definitely not in the mood for a problem with our accomodations. The night manager had the doorman put us into a cab, paid the cab fare, and sent us to the Roosevelt. We were given the Ambassador suite for Friday night, which was out of this world! There was a large dining room table, a living room with fireplace (fake, but still nice), a kitchen, two bathrooms and a king bedroom. We returned to the Time on Saturday and filled out another check in card, but our room was not ready. They stored our bags and we went out to explore the city. The desk clerk on duty was much less helpful than the night manager had been, and was a bit surly, but when it became apparent that I was frustrated with him, another clerk stepped in and handled our check in smoothly. We were treated a lot better after we "dropped" the night manager's name a few times and mentioned the VIP treatment he had promised us for the remainder of our stay. The room was adequately furnished - small, but that's to be expected - and it was clean. The shower curtain does not prevent water from leaking onto the bathroom floor, but water temp and pressure was perfect. The bar spillover in to the reception area was a little unnerving, as there were several drunks in various stages of passing out and falling down, and the noise level was unbelievable. Our room was on the 7th floor, fortunately, so noise was not an issue. The maid was a bit annoying, as she would not take NO for an answer when we told her we did not need service early Sunday morning. We eventually told her to leave towels for us, as she desparately wanted to provide some service. Room service was quick to supply ice, and the extra mini bar charges that were added to our bill were removed without question when we explained that they were duplicate charges. The mini bar fridge did not work, and all beverages from it were room temperature. The location was fantastic, the hotel room was fine, there were certainly no rats in our room, as another reviewer mentioned. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location shame about the hotel itself”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights, location of the hotel great but the hotel was not what we expected. no doormen to greet us on arrival, hotel bar was closed to hotel guests 3 out of the 5 nights we were there due to private parties, room was very small for the price we paid, reception staff not very helpful when asked questions on nyc. very enjoyable holiday would recomened visiting new york just not the time hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you want sleep and good customer service - don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: cheshiretabbycat
Reviews.Content: We were put in a room on the third floor when we arrived after being told that the lift was out of order and that it would be better to be on a lower floor. The music in the lobby (second floor) was very loud and we asked if the room would be affected, the reception manager said no. We carried our cases up the stairs to our room which was clean and comfy. We went for some food and a drink but decided to be in bed fairly early as we had had a long flight from London and wanted to make the most of the weekend. Trying to sleep was impossible, the noise went on until 3.45am, it was incredible, so loud it thumped through the floor and every word could be heard. We kept ringing reception to ask them to turn it down and they said yes but never did. Eventually we went down at 3.30am in our bathrobes and asked them to turn it down and asked why on earth they thought it was a good idea to have a bar below hotel rooms. The response was unhelpful to say the least, once again they said they would turn it down but didn't. We had no sleep that night, the next morning although unapologetic they said they would move us to a higher floor. When we tried to check out on the sunday we could not get into the only working lift as it was packed trying to serve 16 floors, we waited for 25 minutes. Not impressive customer service and the claim that the hotel is tranquil is a joke, try sleeping on the third floor. Surely a hotel is obliged to provide a peaceful environment for sleeping and working lifts? Unimpressive customer service in a country that is meant to be renowned for it and generally lives up to that reputation, The Time needs to get its act together fast.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to love”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in November. Get over the broken elevator - if you want to stay right on Times Square, close to the subways, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, and more great resatuarants than you could ever hope to enjoy, this is your place. A quiet enclave in the heart of the city that never sleeps. The color themed rooms are efficient in space but long on a New York feeling. Bed was a little soft, but everything else was great. Clean bathroom, adequate amenities, trendy little bar on the 2nd floor - lobby level. Good service from the Bellmen and Jay the Concierge. I found it above average for the money (in New York dollars, anyway)

Reviews.Title: “not horrible, but not great either”
Reviews.Author: sudbury99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night last week in a 12th floor suite. Not great: Due to low ceilings, the first impression is that the room seemed very small. Also, the room was dark, even with all the lights on. The carpet, furniture, paint, etc. was tired and worn. Bathroom is small (one person at a time please!). One of the elevators was broken, so wait times were long. I didn't appreciate the Penthouse magazine (I'm not sure if it was left behind or put there on purpose); please just stick with Timeout magazine. Not horrible: I had a great meal via room service. Was met at the entrance by a bellman who helped me with my bag. Desk staff was friendly. The bed was very comfortable (although it is only a double...I cannot imagine two adults sleeping comfortably in it). Molton Brown bath products. Location is great. I would not recommend this hotel, unless the location is absolutely perfect for you or you get a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Since we could not find any other hotels available this past Marathon behind , we ended up at the Time. The Location is great; right BEHIND the Crowne Plaza in the center of midtown. We just wished we could have stayed at the Crowne Plaza as they probably have elevators that work and bellboys that are available. This is not the case at the Time. It seems they have 1 elevator down for a while and the other is hit or miss. After an all day hike through Manhatten, we had to hike up 12 flights of stairs to make it to our room at 11:30 on Saturday night. Not fun!! The room was small but adequate and the lobby is loud. Overall, the hotel was OK but I would never stay there or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Time after Time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the heart of Times Square, across a Broadway play Theater, near to subway, restaurants, taxis and much more...stay at The Times NY. We had an absolutely magnificent time at The Times. Planned 5 nights in hotel stay, stayed for 7. Staff was cortiuos, rooms clean and serviced soon after we would leave for sight seeing in the city early in the morning. But best of all, near to everything. My kids loved the look and theme of the hotel. Thanks for a wonderful time and experience at your hotel. Would go again and again.

Reviews.Title: “The Time, an antichrist version of the beautiful, trendy W Hotels”
Reviews.Author: 747alika
Reviews.Content: The TIME Hotel's website was slick and stylish, like a better version of the W Hotel chain. We were impressed with the central Time Square location and our being able to nab a $180 per night rate. When we arrived in our room we were shocked to look out our window at a solid brick wall within touching distance of a dank and dark alley. When we complained to the front desk, we were offered a room for $200 that looked out onto a noisy side street, but had some light. We immediately noticed that our tiny yet trendy, stylish room was worn and dirty all over, but the rest of the areas hotels were full for the Tony Awards and we prebooked our room for a week. Each day we left a nice tip for the maid in hopes that she would make an extra effort to clean our room. No such luck. We even noticed a used length of dental floss in the hallway and laughed each day we saw it. The only cleaning the maid did was the removal of our daily $$$ tip on our pillow for her. The used floss was how we based the daily progress of the hotel cleaniness. Not well indeed. We finally got tired of our shabby digs and tried to talk to a hotel manager who was always in a meeting, although the hotel is tiny. We did finally get the last night comped by the manager, and the "upgrade" charge removed per night. A fair compensation for a disappointing week at the Time Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: let's start with check-in: it took them an hour to get my room ready at check-in time of 4pm. the room was tiny! it took them 2 hours to get my mini-bar opened. i called the management to complain and he-she had an attitude! i will let all my friends know this was an awful experience.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE TIME”
Reviews.Author: colecole2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Time on various occations. I love the themed rooms and probably have stayed in all colors. Each time, that I have visited, the staff has been amazing. On one or two occasions I have brought my son. He was only a few months old less than (6) when we first visited. The staff was very accomadating. I moved some items in the mini bar to Jam bottles in and the front desk immediately took the charges off of my bill when I explained. I love the location and the high priced bar and rest inside. The rooms are small but many rooms in NYC are and quite honestly the hotel room is as big as some city apartments that are $1200 a month. If people think this room is extreme and small you should see LOEWS Universal Studios. I love this place and would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our time at The Time”
Reviews.Author: DebbyParker
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews, I was a little worried about what to expect. I brought a couple of friends who had never been to NYC before. I personally have stayed at several different hotels in NYC. I was much more impressed with The Time than I expected to be. Everyone was polite and helpful. The hotel is in a very convenient location. The room was comfortable and clean. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “things you should know”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well here's an overview of things I experienced July10-13th. 1) We had to park our car in the garage across the street ourselves.-no valet. even though web sites said they did. 2) go up a floor to the tiny front desk, an all-white room playing techno music. the employees are dressed in tight fitting, black t-shirts. It's like you're in the movie zoolander. 3) the people aren't rude, they might even be nice, but 90% of them are just plain wierd. 4) Its not located on the main strip, its kind of down a small alley/street (49th to be exact) which means that every rooms view is of an alley. 5) The doors you walk in are also the street entrance to the zoolander lounge on the first floor. If you're lucky enough to be there on a Saturday night just flash the bouncer your key and he'll let you in with a smile. 6) Beds are super soft. All in all, not bad, but last time in NY,we stayed in the Southgate towers and we were sorry we didn't go there this time. This hotel is ok if you can't afford a real times square hotel, hilton times square, marriott marquis, exc, then this is a good second rate hotel... as long as you liked that old mike meyers SNL skit "Sprockets"

Reviews.Title: “horrible service, potential”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: you had to get tickets to get your luggage checked in and seperate ones to check out . that is ---- called us in the middle of our last and only day to shop to come back and get different tickets so they could bring them down. THE TIME HOTEL. of course their time.......

Reviews.Title: “Petite but Lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location and comfortable rooms...

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about our 3-night stay at The Time after reading some of the reviews, but I had nothing to be worried about. Like many others, I felt the location of the hotel was excellent. Very close to many of the attractions of NYC. We walked almost the entire city from our hotel... and cab rides to further locations were never over $10. Upon arrival the doormen and other staff were very friendly and helpful with any questions we had. There is someone at the door pretty much 24 hours a day to open it for you and get a cab if you need one. The room was on the smaller side, but not uncomfortable. After a while I felt like I was just staying in someone's bedroom. I had the opportunity to see a room in a hotel a few blocks away and it was significantly smaller and about the same price. Our room was at the end of a hall and we didn't have any trouble with noise. We were on the 3rd floor and couldn't even here the noise from the busy bar on the 2nd floor. The room didn't have a view, but that wasn't a big deal to me. I was very comfortable in the hotel and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to my friends. I'm not sure I could picture my parents staying there, but if you don't have grand expectations of a luxury hotel, you shouldn't be disappointed. Two thumbs up from both me and my friend!

HotelInfo.Name: The Time
HotelInfo.Address: 224 West 49th Street, New York City, NY 10019
